en: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
hmr: Abraham naupa, David naupa, Isu Krista thlatuhai inthlazie chanchin chu:

en: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judah and his brethren;
hmr: Abrahamin Isak a thlah a; Isakin Jakob a thlah a; Jakobin Juda le a unauhai a thlah a;

en: and Judah begat Perez and Zerah of Tamar; and Perez begat Hezron; and Hezron begat Ram;
hmr: Judain Tamar leh, Perez le Zera a thlah a; Perezin Esrom a thlah a; Esromin Aram a thlah a;

en: and Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon; and Nahshon begat Salmon;
hmr: Aramin Amminadab a thlah a; Amminadabin Nason a thlah a; Nasonin Salmon a thlah a;

en: and Salmon begat Boaz of Rahab; and Boaz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;
hmr: Salmonin Rahab leh, Boaz a thlah a; Boazin Ruth leh, Obed a thlah a; Obedin Jessai a thlah a;

en: and Jesse begat David the king. And David begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Uriah;
hmr: Jessaiin lal David a thlah a; chun Davidin Uria nuhmei leh, Solomon a thlah a;

en: and Solomon begat Rehoboam; and Rehoboam begat Abijah; and Abijah begat Asa;
hmr: Solomonin Rehoboam a thlah a; Rehoboamin Abia a thlah a; Abiain Asa a thlah a;

en: and Asa begat Jehoshaphat; and Jehoshaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Uzziah;
hmr: Asain Jehosaphat a thlah a; Jehosaphatin Jehoram a thlah a; Jehoramin Uzzia a thlah a;

en: and Uzziah begat Jotham; and Jotham begat Ahaz; and Ahaz begat Hezekiah;
hmr: Uzziain Jotham a thlah a; Jothamin Ahaz a thlah a; Ahazin Hezekia a thlah a;

en: and Hezekiah begat Manasseh; and Manasseh begat Amon; and Amon begat Josiah;
hmr: Hezekiain Manasse a thlah a; Manassein Amos a thlah a; Amosin Josia a thlah a;

en: and Josiah begat Jechoniah and his brethren, at the time of the carrying away to Babylon.
hmr: Babulon tienga sala an ṭhuoi lai vel khan, Josiain Jekonia le a unau- hai a thlah a;

en: And after the carrying away to Babylon, Jechoniah begat Shealtiel; and Shealtiel begat Zerubbabel;
hmr: Chun, Babulon tienga sala an ṭhuoi hnungin Jekoniain Salathiel a thlah a; Salathielin Zerubbabel a thlah a;

en: and Zerubbabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;
hmr: Zerubbabelin Abiud a thlah a; Abiudin Eliakim a thlah a; Eliakimin Azor a thlah a;

en: and Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;
hmr: Azorin Sadok a thlah a; Sadokin Akim a thlah a; Akimin Eliud a thlah a;

en: and Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;
hmr: Eliudin Eleazar a thlah a; Elea- zarin Matthan a thlah a; Matthanin Jakob a thlah a;

en: and Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.
hmr: Jakobin Josef Mari pasal chu a thlah a; chu Maria chun Isu Krista an ti hi a hung insieng tah a.

en: So all the generations from Abraham unto David are fourteen generations; and from David unto the carrying away to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon unto the Christ fourteen generations.
hmr: Chuongchun, suon po po chu Abrahama inthawk David chenin suon sâwmpali, Davida inthawka Babulon tienga sala an ṭhuoi chenin suon sâwmpali, Babulon tienga sala an ṭhuoia inthawka Krista chenin suon sâwmpali an nih.

en: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When his mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together she was found with child of the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Chun, Isu Krista hung insieng- zie chu hieng ang hi a nih: A nu Mari chu Josef le an inhuol laiin, an inpâwl hmain Thlarau Inthiengin ân raitir ti an lo hriet tah a.

en: And Joseph her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, was minded to put her away privily.
hmr: Chun, a pasal Josef chu mi feltak a na; tlâng ihriet a nuom nawh a; arûka mâk el a nuom a.

en: But when he thought on these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chuong thu chu a ngaituo laiin, ngai ta, a mangah Lalpa vântirko a kuomah a hung inlâr a, “Josef, nang David naupa, Mari chu nuhmeia nei ṭi naw rawh; a nau vawn chu Thlarau Inthienga inthawk a nih i sawnnaw.

en: And she shall bring forth a son; and thou shalt call his name JESUS; for it is he that shall save his people from their sins.
hmr: Naupasal nei a ta, a hming chu Isu sak i tih; ama chun a mihai an thil suksuolnaa inthawkin a sandam ding a ni sih a”, a ta.

en: Now all this is come to pass, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,
hmr: Lalpain zâwlnei baua,

en: Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, And they shall call his name Immanuel; which is, being interpreted, God with us.
hmr: “Ngai ta, nunghâk inthieng chu inrâi a ta, Naupasal nei a ta; A hming dingin Immanuel sak an tih,” tia a hril kha a hung tlung theina dingin chuong po po chu a hung um a nih. (Immanuel chu, “Ei kuomah Pathien a um” tina a nih).

en: And Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took unto him his wife;
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef chu a in a tho a; Lalpa vântirkoin a kuoma thu a pêk ang chun a thawh a; Mari chu a nei tah a;

en: and knew her not till she had brought forth a son: and he called his name JESUS.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, naupasal a nei hmakhat chu a pâwl nawh a; chun, a hming chu ISU a sak tah a.

en: And he called unto him his twelve disciples, and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of disease and all manner of sickness.
hmr: Chun, a inchûktir sâwm le pahnihai chu a ko a, anni hnawt dawk theina dingin khawhri inthiengnawhai chunga thuneina a pêk a; damnawna tinrêng le natna tinrêng sukdam theina dingin thuneina a pêk bawk a.

en: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;
hmr: Tirko sâwm le pahni hai hming chu hieng hi an nih: A hmasataka chun Simon (Peter an ti) le a unau Andri hai, Zebedai naupa Jakob le a unaupa Johan hai;

en: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphæus, and Thaddæus;
hmr: Philip le Bartholomai hai; Thoma le siedâwltu Matthai hai; Alphai naupa Jakob le Thaddai hai,

en: Simon the Cananæan, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.
hmr: Kanaana mi Simon le a inman- tirtu Juda Iskariot hai hi an nih.

en: These twelve Jesus sent forth, and charged them, saying, Go not into any way of the Gentiles, and enter not into any city of the Samaritans:
hmr: Chuong sâwm le pahni hai chu Isûn a tir suok a, an kuomah thu a pêk a: “Jentailhai lampuiah fe naw unla, Samari mihai khuo hrim hrima khawm lût naw ro;

en: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
hmr: amiruokchu, Israel hnam berâm inhmanghai kuoma chun fe lem ro.

en: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.
hmr: Chun, in fein, ‘vân ram chu a hung hnai tah,’ tiin hril pei ro.

en: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse the lepers, cast out demons: freely ye received, freely give.
hmr: Damnawhai sukdam unla, mithi- hai keitho unla, phârhai sukthieng unla, khawhrihai hnawt dawk ro, a thlâwnin in hmuh a, a thlâwnin pe ro.

en: Get you no gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses;
hmr: In kâwngkhihaiah rângkachak tangka amanih, tangka manih, dâr tangka amanih chawi naw ro.

en: no wallet for your journey, neither two coats, nor shoes, nor staff: for the laborer is worthy of his food.
hmr: Inzinna dingin mansa amanih, zakuo pahni amanih, kekawk amanih, hmawl amani khawm chawi naw ro; sinthawtu chu a fâk ding hmu tlâk a ni sih a.

en: And into whatsoever city or village ye shall enter, search out who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go forth.
hmr: “Chun, khaw liena manih, khaw chîna manih, in lûtna taphawta chun ân tlungtir tlâk ding cheu mi zawng dawk unla, in suok nâwk hmakhat chutaka chun tlung zing ro.

en: And as ye enter into the house, salute it.
hmr: Chun, ina chun in lût dingin chibai bûk ro.

en: And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.
hmr: Chun, ina mihai chu intlungtir tlâk cheu an ni chun, in thlamuongna thu chu an chungah tlung sienla; an tlâk naw ruok chun in thlamuongna thu chu in chungah hung kîr nâwk raw se.

en: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, as ye go forth out of that house or that city, shake off the dust of your feet.
hmr: Chun, tukhawm lâwm lo cheu a, in thu khawm ngai naw taphawt chu, chu ina inthawka manih, chu khuoa inthawka manih in suok pha chun in kephaa pilvut chu thin thla ro;

en: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment, than for that city.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, ngaituo nia chun chu khuohai nêk chun Sodom le Gomorra ram tuor ding chu a dân um lem a tih.

en: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.
hmr: “Ngai ta u, satenehai laia berâm um angin ka tir cheu hi; chuongchun, rûl anga vara, vaṭhu anga pawi tâwkloin um unla.

en: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to councils, and in their synagogues they will scourge you;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mihriem lai chun fimkhur ro, rorêltuhai an in- mantir ding cheu a ni sih a, in- khâwmna inahai vuong an ti cheu a;

en: yea and before governors and kings shall ye be brought for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.
hmr: anih, hotuhai le lalhai hmaah annihai le Jentailhai inhriettirna dingin, keima leiin la ṭhuoi an ti cheu.

en: But when they deliver you up, be not anxious how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that hour what ye shall speak.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an inmantir pha cheu khawm, ‘Iengtin am, ieng thu am ka hril ding?’ tiin lungkham naw ro; in hril ding chu a hun taka chun ân hriettir ding cheu a ni sih a.

en: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father that speaketh in you.
hmr: A hriltu chu nangni in ni âwm si nawh a, in Pa Thlarau nangnia thu hriltu khan a hril lem ding a nih.

en: And brother shall deliver up brother to death, and the father his child: and children shall rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.
hmr: “Chun, sukhlum dingin unaupa le unaupa inmantir an ta, pa khawmin a nau inmantir bawk a tih; nauhai khawmin an nu le pahai do an ta, insukhlumtir bawk an tih.

en: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake: but he that endureth to the end, the same shall be saved.
hmr: Keia hming leiin mi po po theida nîng in tih; nisienlakhawm, a tâwp chena tuor pei chu, chu ngei chu sandamin um a tih.

en: But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the next: for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone through the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.
hmr: “Chuongchun, hi khuoa hin an suknawmna pha cheu, khaw dangah tlân san ro; titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, Mihriem Naupa a hung hmain Israel khuohai chu fang suok naw ti niu.

en: A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his lord.
hmr: “Inchûktir a inchûktirtu chung- ah a um nawh; suok khawm a pu chungah a um bawk nawh.

en: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his teacher, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more them of his household!
hmr: Inchûktir chu inchûktirtu anga a hung um le, suok chu a pu anga a hung um chu a hun deh. In neitupa hman Beelzebub an ti chun, a sûnghai chu an va ti nasa awm deh e!

en: Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.
hmr: “Chuongchun, anni chu ṭi naw unla; inlang lo dinga thup hmang iengkhawm a um si nawh a; hriet naw dinga ip iengkhawm a um bawk nawh.

en: What I tell you in the darkness, speak ye in the light; and what ye hear in the ear, proclaim upon the house-tops.
hmr: Inthima ka hril cheu hi varah hril ro, na bula in hriet hi in chunga chuongin tlânginsampui ro.

en: And be not afraid of them that kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
hmr: “Chun, taksa sukhluma thlarau sukhlum thei nawhai chu ṭi naw unla, Hremhmuna thlarau le taksa sukbo thei ruok chu ṭi ro.

en: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? and not one of them shall fall on the ground without your Father:
hmr: Chawngzawng pahni dâr tang- ka pakhatin an zawr hlak a ni naw am a nih? nisienlakhawm, anni laia pakhat khawm in Pa boin hnuoiah tla naw ni.

en: but the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
hmr: In samzai chen khawm hi tiem vawng a nih in sawnnaw.

en: Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
hmr: Chuleichun, ṭi naw ro; chawngzawng tamtak nêkin in hlu lem a nih.

en: Every one therefore who shall confess me before men, him will I also confess before my Father who is in heaven.
hmr: “Chuongchun, mihai hmaa a mi ṭan taphawt chu, ka Pa vâna mi hmaah ṭan vêng ka tih.

en: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father who is in heaven.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tukhawm mi- hai hmaa a mîn phat taphawt chu, ka Pa vâna mi hmaah inphat vêng ka tih.

en: Think not that I came to send peace on the earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.
hmr: “Khawvêla hin inremna inlêng- tir dinga hung am ka nih mi sâwn naw ro; inremna inlêngtir dinga hung ka ni nawh a, kâwlhnâm inlêngtir dinga hung ka ni lem.

en: For I came to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law:
hmr: Mi a pa indotir dingin, naunu a nu indotir dingin, mo le a pi indotir dinga hung ka nih in sawnnaw.

en: and a man’s foes shall be they of his own household.
hmr: Mi a hmêlmahai chu ama sûnghai laia mi ngei nîng an tih.

en: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
hmr: “Tukhawm a nu amanih, a pa amanih keia nêka hmangai lem chu ka mi ni tlâk a ni nawh; tukhawm naupa amanih, naunu amanih keia nêka hmangai lem chu ka mi ni tlâk a ni nawh.

en: And he that doth not take his cross and follow after me, is not worthy of me.
hmr: Tukhawm a kraws puta mi zui naw chu ka mi ni tlâk a ni nawh.

en: He that findeth his life shall lose it; and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.
hmr: Tukhawm a hringna hmu chun chân a ta; keia leia hringna chân chun hmûng a tih.

en: He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
hmr: “Tukhawm a lâwm cheu chu a mi lâwm a na, tukhawm a mi lâwm chu, a mi tirtu lâwm a nih.

en: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward: and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.
hmr: Tukhawm zâwlnei chu zâwlnei a ni leia lâwm chun, zâwlnei lâwmman hmûng a tih; tukhawm mi fel chu mi fel a ni leia lâwm chun mi fel lâwmman hmûng a tih.

en: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only, in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you he shall in no wise lose his reward.
hmr: Chun, tukhawm hieng mi chîn- tak laia pakhat kuoma hin, tirko a ni leia tuisik no khat chau khawm pe taphawt chun, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, a lâwmman chu chân naw tawp a tih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass when Jesus had finished commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and preach in their cities.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a inchûktir sâwm le pahni hai chu thu a pêk zo phingleh chutaka inthawkin an khuohaia inchûktir le thu hril dingin a fe tah a.

en: Now when John heard in the prison the works of the Christ, he sent by his disciples
hmr: Chun, Johanin Krista thilthaw- hai chu intângna inah a lo hrietin a inchûktirhai ân palaitir a, a kuomah,

en: and said unto him, Art thou he that cometh, or look we for another?
hmr: “A hung ding chu i ni, mi dang kan la ngai ding?” tiin.

en: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and tell John the things which ye hear and see:
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Fe nâwk ta unla, thil in hmu le in hriet hi Johan kuomah va hril ro;

en: the blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, and the dead are raised up, and the poor have good tidings preached to them.
hmr: mitdelhai an mit a lo var tah, kebaihai kein an lâwn tah, phârhai an lo inthieng tah, nasêthai an na a lo var tah, mithihai keithoin an um tah, pasiehaiin Chanchin Ṭha thu hril an dawng tah.

en: And blessed is he, whosoever shall find no occasion of stumbling in me.
hmr: Chun, tukhawm ka chunga lungninawna hmu naw chu, a hamṭha,” tiin a lo dawn a.

en: And as these went their way, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to behold? a reed shaken with the wind?
hmr: Chun, chuhai chu an fe phingleh, Isûn mipui kuoma chun Johan thu a hril tah a, “Ieng en dingin am thlalêrah in fe suok kha? Luong thli imût hnîng maw?

en: But what went ye out to see? a man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that wear soft raiment are in kings’ houses.
hmr: Annawleh, ieng en ding takin am in fe suok kha? Puon innêm sil maw? Ngai ta u, puon innêm silhai chu lal inahai in sawnnaw an um.

en: But wherefore went ye out? to see a prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.
hmr: Annawleh, ieng lei takin am in fe suok kha? Zâwlnei en dingin maw? A ni ngei kha, ka ti cheu hi, zâwlnei nêk khawma ropui lem,

en: This is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, Who shall prepare thy way before thee.
hmr: ‘En ta, ka tirko i hmaah ka tir a nih. Ama chun i hmaah i lampui siem a tih,’ tia a chanchin an inziek kha ama hi a nih.

en: Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not arisen a greater than John the Baptist: yet he that is but little in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, nuhmei sûnga insieng laiah Baptistu Johan nêka ropui lem an la suok ngai nawh, nisienlakhawm, vân rama mi chîn deu khawm ama nêkin an ropui lem sih a.

en: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and men of violence take it by force.
hmr: Baptistu Johana inthawk tu chen hin vân ram chun thaw rakna a tuok hlak a, a thaw rakhai chun an pâwnglâk hlak.

en: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
hmr: Zâwlneihai po po le Dân thu chun, Johan hung um chen khan an hril lâwk hlak a nih.

en: And if ye are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, that is to come.
hmr: In awi nuom chun, chu chu Elija, a hung ding chu a nih.

en: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
hmr: Tukhawm hrietna dinga na nei chun hre raw se.

en: But whereunto shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the marketplaces, who call unto their fellows
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, tulai ruol- tharhai hi ieng lêm hrilkhîng ka ta? Naupang dâwr hmunahai ṭhung a, an ruolhai ko a,

en: and say, We piped unto you, and ye did not dance; we wailed, and ye did not mourn.
hmr: ‘Theihle kan mût pêk cheu a, in lâm si nawh a, Kan ṭap rak a, âwm in chum si nawh a,’ tihai ang hi an nih.

en: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a demon.
hmr: “Johan chu a hung a, a fâkin a dâwn nawh a, ‘Khawhri a zâwl a ni hi,’ an ta.

en: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold, a gluttonous man and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners! And wisdom is justified by her works.
hmr: Mihriem Naupa a hung a, a fâkin a dâwn a, ‘En ta u, bu he mi, uoin he mi, siedâwltuhai le mi suolhai ruolpa saw,’ an ti sih a. Nisien- lakhawm, Varna chu a thilthawhaiin an inthiem,” a ta.

en: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not.
hmr: Chun, an sim naw leiin a thilmak thaw tamna tak khuohai chu a hal tah a.

en: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
hmr: “Korazin, i chung a rik! Bethsaida, i chung a rik! Nangnia thilmak thawa umhai kha, Tura le Sidona thaw ni sienla, saiip puon sila vut laia ṭhungin um tâng an tih.

en: But I say unto you, it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judgment, than for you.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka ti cheu hi ngaituo nia chun nangni tuor nêkin Tura le Sidon tuor chu a dân um lem a tih.

en: And thou, Capernaum, shalt thou be exalted unto heaven? thou shalt go down unto Hades: for if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in thee, it would have remained until this day.
hmr: Chun, nang Kapernaum, vân chena chawimawi i ni ding am a nih? Mithi khuo chenin i zu fe ding i sawnnaw. Nangmaa thilmak thawa umhai kha Sodoma thaw ni sienla, tu chen hin la um zing a tih.

en: But I say unto you that it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka ti che hi, ngaituo nia chun i tuor nêk chun Sodom ram tuor ding chu a dân um lem a tih,” a ta.

en: At that season Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou didst hide these things from the wise and understanding, and didst reveal them unto babes:
hmr: Chu lai chun Isûn a biek a, “Aw Pa, hnuoi le vân Lalpa, nangin mi var le mi bengvârhai kuomah hieng thu hi i ip a, nautehai kuomah i phuong lei hin kân pâk che.

en: yea, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in thy sight.
hmr: Anih, Pa, chuong anga thaw chu i ngaiin a ṭha a nih.

en: All things have been delivered unto me of my Father: and no one knoweth the Son, save the Father; neither doth any know the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son willeth to reveal him.
hmr: Ka pain thil iengkim a mîn kawltir tah; Pa naw chun Naupa hi tukhawmin an hriet nawh. Chun, Naupa le Naupain a phuong nuom- nahai chau naw chun tukhawmin Pa chu an hriet bawk nawh.

en: Come unto me, all ye that labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
hmr: “Nangni sininrim le phur rik phur po pohai, ka kuomah hung unla, keiin inchâwltir ka ti cheu.

en: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.
hmr: Ka rîngkawl bât unla, ka kuomah inchûk ro; thuhnuoirawl le lungrila inngaitlâwmtak ka ni hi; chuongchun, in thlarau ta dingin châwlna hmûng in tih.

en: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.
hmr: Ka rîngkawl chu ân hâwi a, ka phur khawm a zâng a nih,” a ta.

en: At that season Jesus went on the sabbath day through the grainfields; and his disciples were hungry and began to pluck ears and to eat.
hmr: Chu lai chun, Isu chu châwlniin bu bilah a fe thleng a; a inchûktirhai chu an phîng a ṭâm a, buvuihai chu an thliek a, an fâk tah a.

en: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which it is not lawful to do upon the sabbath.
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihaiin chu chu an hmu chun a kuomah, “En ta, i inchûktirhaiin Châwlnia thaw thieng naw chu an thaw hi,” an ta.

en: But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did, when he was hungry, and they that were with him;
hmr: Ama ruok chun an kuomah, “A ruolhai le an phîng ṭâm laia David thilthaw kha in tiem ngai naw am a nih?

en: how he entered into the house of God, and ate the showbread, which it was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them that were with him, but only for the priests?
hmr: Khânga Pathien inah a lût a, ama le a ruolhai fâk thieng naw, thiempuhai chau ifâk thieng entirna bei an fâk thu kha?

en: Or have ye not read in the law, that on the sabbath day the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are guiltless?
hmr: Annawleh, Châwlniin Pathien biekina thiempu umhai chun Châwlni an bawr khawmin an thiem pei ti Dân thua chun in tiem naw am a nih?

en: But I say unto you, that one greater than the temple is here.
hmr: Iengkhawm ni sien, Pathien biekin nêka ropui lem hitaka hin a um ti ka hril cheu hi.

en: But if ye had known what this meaneth, I desire mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ‘Inthâwina dit loin lunginsietna ka dit,’ ti hi a umzie hre thiem sa ni unla chu, mi thiemhai chu thiemnaw in inchangtir naw ding bah.

en: For the Son of man is lord of the sabbath.
hmr: Mihriem Naupa hi Châwlni Lal a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And he departed thence, and went into their synagogue:
hmr: Chun, chutaka inthawk chun a feh a, an inkhâwmna inah a va lût a.

en: and behold, a man having a withered hand. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day? that they might accuse him.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, mi pakhat kut zeng a lo um a, chun, an hêk theina dingin, “Châwlniin sukdam a thieng am?” tiin Isu an indawn a.

en: And he said unto them, What man shall there be of you, that shall have one sheep, and if this fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and lift it out?
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Nangni laia tukhawmin berâm pakhat nei unla, chu chu Châwlniin khurah tla ta ang sienla, tuin am chelin kei dawk nâwng in ta?

en: How much then is a man of more value than a sheep! Wherefore it is lawful to do good on the sabbath day.
hmr: Berâm pakhat nêk chun mi- hriem pakhat chu a va hlu lem de! Chuleichun, Châwlnia sukṭhat a thieng,” a ta.

en: Then saith he to the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he stretched it forth; and it was restored whole, as the other.
hmr: Chu phingleh, chu mipa kuoma chun, “I kut phar rawh,” a ta. Chuongchun, a phar a, a khing tieng angin a dam ta var a.

en: But the Pharisees went out, and took counsel against him, how they might destroy him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pharisaihai chu an suok a, ama an sukhlum theina ding dân ngaituoin an inrâwn a.

en: And Jesus perceiving it withdrew from thence: and many followed him; and he healed them all,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn chu chu a hrietin, chutaka inthawk chun a fe hmang tah a.

en: and charged them that they should not make him known:
hmr: Chun, mi tamtakin ama an zui a, an rêngin a lo sukdam vawng a, a chanchin phuong lo dingin an kuomah a ti tlat a.

en: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,
hmr: Zâwlnei Isaiin hieng thu a hril hi a hung tlung theina dingin:

en: Behold, my servant whom I have chosen; My beloved in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit upon him, And he shall declare judgment to the Gentiles.
hmr: “En ta, ka siehlaw, ka ithlang, Ka idittak, ka lungrilin a ilâwm bêk bêk hi; A chungah ka Thlarau sieng ka ta, Chuongchun, Jentailhai kuomah rorêlna thu hril a tih.

en: He shall not strive, nor cry aloud; Neither shall any one hear his voice in the streets.
hmr: Sêl naw nih a, khêk bawk naw nih a; Kawtthlêrhaia khawm tukhawmin a râwl hre bawk naw ni hai.

en: A bruised reed shall he not break, And smoking flax shall he not quench, Till he send forth judgment unto victory.
hmr: Hne dinga rorêlna a tir dawk hma khat chun Luong pawr suktan naw nih a, Pat khu khawm sukmit naw ni.

en: And in his name shall the Gentiles hope.
hmr: Ama hming chu Jentailhai chun beisei phâng an tih,” ti hi.

en: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a demon, blind and dumb: and he healed him, insomuch that the dumb man spake and saw.
hmr: Chu lai chun, mitdel ṭawng- theinaw khawhri iman pakhat a kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a; chun, ama chun a lo sukdam a, chuongchun, ṭawngtheinaw chu a hung ṭawng theiin, a hung hmu thei tah a.

en: And all the multitudes were amazed, and said, Can this be the son of David?
hmr: Chun, mipuihai po po chun mak an ti hle a, “Hi mipa hi David naupa chu a ni naw am a nih?” an ta.

en: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This man doth not cast out demons, but by Beelzebub the prince of the demons.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pharisaihaiin chu chu an hriet phingleh, “Hi mipa hin khawhri lal Beelzebub lei naw chun khawhrihai hnawt dawk naw ni,” an ta.

en: And knowing their thoughts he said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand:
hmr: Chun, Isûn an ngaituohai chu a lo hriet a, an kuomah, “Khâwlai ram khawm mâni indo taphawt chu an bo hlak; khâwlai khuo khawm sûngkhat khawm, mâni indo taphawt chu ngîr suok naw ni hai.

en: and if Satan casteth out Satan, he is divided against himself; how then shall his kingdom stand?
hmr: Setanin Setan bawk a hnawt dawk chun, mâni indo nîng a tih in sawnnaw; a ram chu iengtin am ngîr suok a ta?

en: And if I by Beelzebub cast out demons, by whom do your sons cast them out? therefore shall they be your judges.
hmr: Kei Beelzebub leia khawhrihai hnawt dawk hlak ka lo ni chun, in nauhaiin tu leiin am an lo hnawt dawk hlak lie? Chuleiin, anni chu nangni ngaituotu dinghai nîng an tih.

en: But if I by the Spirit of God cast out demons, then is the kingdom of God come upon you.
hmr: Amiruokchu, kei Pathien Thlarau leia khawhrihai hnawt dawk hlak ka ni chun, Pathien ram in kuomah a hung tlung tah nîng a tih.

en: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil his house.
hmr: Chuongchu a ni si naw chun, miin mi hrât chu a khuop hmasa bak naw chun, iengtin am mi hrât inah lûtin a sum lapêk thei a ta? Chu hnunga ruok chun a in chu inrampêk el a tih.

en: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.
hmr: Tukhawm keia tienga ṭhang naw chu a mi do a nih; tukhawm a mi lâk khâwmpui naw chun a sukdar a nih.

en: Therefore I say unto you, Every sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men; but the blasphemy against the Spirit shall not be forgiven.
hmr: “Chuleiin, ka ti cheu hi, mi an suolna tinrênga le, Pathien an hril- sietna tinrênga chun ngaidam nîng an ta, Thlarau Inthieng meu hrilsetu ruok chu ngaidam ni naw ni hai.

en: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him; but whosoever shall speak against the Holy Spirit, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, nor in that which is to come.
hmr: Chun, tukhawm Mihriem Nau- pa sawisêl taphawt chu a sawisêlna chu ngaidam nîng a ta; tukhawm Thlarau Inthieng meu sawisêl taphawt chu a sawisêlna chu, hi dam sûnga khawm, hun la hung tlung dinga khawm chun, ngaidam ni naw nih.

en: Either make the tree good, and its fruit good; or make the tree corrupt, and its fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by its fruit.
hmr: “Thing chu a ṭha a, a ra khawm a ṭha, in ti naw nghâl an leh, thing chu a sie a, a ra khawm a sie, ti nghâl nghâl ro; thing chu a rain ân hriet sih a.

en: Ye offspring of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.
hmr: Rûl thlahai, nangnîn suol zing pumin, iengtin am thu ṭha hril thei in ta? Lungrila sip liem chu bauin a hril hlak in sawnnaw.

en: The good man out of his good treasure bringeth forth good things: and the evil man out of his evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.
hmr: Mi ṭha chun a robâwm ṭhaa inthawkin thil ṭhahai a the dawk hlak, mi suol chun a robâwm siea inthawkin thil ṭha naw a the dawk hlak.

en: And I say unto you, that every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.
hmr: Chun, ka hril cheu hi, mihaiin thu teplo an hril taphawt, chuong thu chanchin chu ngaituo nia chun hril an tih.

en: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
hmr: I thuhril chun thiem inchangtir a ti cheh a, i thuhril bawk chun thiemnaw inchangtir a ti che i sawn- naw,” a ta.

en: Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered him, saying, Teacher, we would see a sign from thee.
hmr: Chu lai chun, Dân inchûktir- tuhai le Pharisaihai laia tuhaiin amanih an dawn a, a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, i kuoma inthawkin inchikna hmu kan nuom,” an ta.

en: But he answered and said unto them, An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it but the sign of Jonah the prophet:
hmr: Ama ruok chun an kuomah, “Ruolthar suoltak le uire hmang takhai chun inchikna an zawng a; nisienlakhawm, zâwlnei Jona inchik- na chau naw chu an kuomah inchikna hrim hrim pêk ni naw ni;

en: for as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the whale; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
hmr: Jona chu ni thum le zân thum ngapui phîng sûnga a um ang khan, Mihriem Naupa hi ni thum le zân thum hnuoi khur sûngah a um bawk ding a nih.

en: The men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, a greater than Jonah is here.
hmr: Ninevi khuoa mihai chu ngaituo pha chun tulai ruoltharhai kuomah hin ngîr vêng an ta, thiemnaw inchangtir an tih; Jona thu hril leiin an sim sih a; Jona nêka ropui lem hitaka hin a um in sawnnaw.

en: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
hmr: Simtieng lalnu kha ngaituo pha chun tulai ruoltharhai lai hin tho vêng a ta, thiemnaw inchangtir a tih; Solomon varna ngai ding hmanin kâwlkawdawnga inthawkin a hung sih a; ngai ta u, Solomon nêka ropui lem hitaka hin a um in sawnnaw.

en: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passeth through waterless places, seeking rest, and findeth it not.
hmr: “Chun, khawhri inthieng naw chu mi sûnga inthawka a suokin, châwlna zawngin tui um nawna hmunahai ân vâk ân vâk a, a hmu ngai si nawh a.

en: Then he saith, I will return into my house whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.
hmr: Chun, ‘Ka suokna ina khan kîr nâwk el ka tih,’ a ta; chun, a va tlung chun, a ruoka, phît faia cheiṭhatin a hmuh a.

en: Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man becometh worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this evil generation.
hmr: Chu phingleh a va feh a, ama nêka suol lem khawhri dang pasari a hung ṭhuoi a, chutaka chun an lût a, an um zing hlak a, chu mihriem um dân nuhnung lem chu a hmasa nêkin a hung ṭha naw lem hlak a nih. Chuong ang bawkin tulai ruolthar suol takhai chunga hin la um a tih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: While he was yet speaking to the multitudes, behold, his mother and his brethren stood without, seeking to speak to him.
hmr: Mipuihai kuoma thu a la hril lai chun, ngai ta, a nu le a unauhai chu ama biek tumin tuolah an ngîr a.

en: And one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, seeking to speak to thee.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhatin a kuomah, “Ngai ta, i nu le i unauhai biek che tumin tuola sawn an ngîr zing ie,” an ta.

en: But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?
hmr: Ama ruok chun a hriltu kuoma chun, “Ka nu chu tu am a na? Ka unauhai khawm chu tuhai am an na?” tiin a dawn a.

en: And he stretched forth his hand towards his disciples, and said, Behold, my mother and my brethren!
hmr: Chun, a inchûktirhai tieng a kut a phar a, “En ta u, ka nu le ka unauhai hi!

en: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father who is in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.
hmr: Tukhawm ka Pa vâna mi dit zâwng thaw taphawt chu, ka unau le, ka farnu le, ka nuhai an nih in sawnnaw,” a ta.

en: On that day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.
hmr: Chu ni chun Isu chu ina inthawkin a fe suok a, dîl panga chun a ṭhung a.

en: And there were gathered unto him great multitudes, so that he entered into a boat, and sat; and all the multitude stood on the beach.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah mipui nasatak an hung inkhâwm a, chuongchun, lawngah a chuong a, a ṭhung a; mipui po po ṭieuphoah an ngîr a.

en: And he spake to them many things in parables, saying, Behold, the sower went forth to sow;
hmr: Chun, tekhithuin an kuomah thu tamtak a hril a, “Ngai ta u, bu chi thetu chu bu chi the dingin a feh a.

en: and as he sowed, some seeds fell by the way side, and the birds came and devoured them:
hmr: Chun, a the laiin a ṭhen lampui sîrah a tlah a, vatehaiin an hung tlân zo tah a.

en: and others fell upon the rocky places, where they had not much earth: and straightway they sprang up, because they had no deepness of earth:
hmr: Chun, aṭhen pielthlêng leihnuoi inphânna hmunah a tlah a, leihnuoi a sa naw leiin a mâwng nghâl tah a.

en: and when the sun was risen, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nisa a hung insâng deuin em vuoiin a hung um a, zung a nei naw leiin a rawp el tah a.

en: And others fell upon the thorns; and the thorns grew up and choked them:
hmr: Chun, a ṭhen hlohlingnei lai a tlah a, hlo chu a hung mâwng sâng a, a dîp hmang tah a.

en: and others fell upon the good ground, and yielded fruit, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
hmr: A ṭhen hnuoi ṭhaah a tlah a, ṭhenkhat a lêt za dâm, ṭhenkhat a lêt sâwmruk dâm, ṭhenkhat a lêt sâwm- thum dâmin a hung ra tah a.

en: He that hath ears, let him hear.
hmr: Tukhawm na nei chun hre raw se,” a ta.

en: And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chu an hung a, a kuomah, “Iengdinga an kuomah tekhithua i hril am?” an ta.

en: And he answered and said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a dawn a, an kuomah, “Vân ram thurûk chu nangni ihriet chu phal a nih, anni ihriet ruok chu phal a ni nawh.

en: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that which he hath.
hmr: Tukhawm a nei taphawt chu pe sâng an ta, nei ṭeu an tih; nisienlakhawm, tukhawm a nei naw taphawt chu, an nei sun khawm lâkpêk an tih.

en: Therefore speak I to them in parables; because seeing they see not, and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.
hmr: Chuleichun, tekhithuin an kuomah ka hril a nih; hmu hai sien khawm an hmu ngai nawh a, nain hrehai sien khawm an hriet ngai nawh a, a ngaina khawm an hriet ngai naw leiin.

en: And unto them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah, which saith, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall in no wise understand; And seeing ye shall see, and shall in no wise perceive:
hmr: Chun, Isai thuhrillâwk kha an chungah a hung tlung a ni hi; ‘Na chun hre dêng in ta chu, a ngaina ruok chu hre tawp naw ti niu; Hmu chu hmu dêng in ta chu, hriet ruok chu hre tawp naw ti niu;

en: For this people’s heart is waxed gross, And their ears are dull of hearing, And their eyes they have closed; Lest haply they should perceive with their eyes, And hear with their ears, And understand with their heart, And should turn again, And I should heal them.
hmr: Hi chihai lungril hi a lo ngawng tah a, An nahai a lo sêt tah a, An mit an insîm bawk a. Chuong naw chun an mitin hmûng an ta, An nain hrieng an ta, An lungrilin hre bawk an ta, Ngha kîr nâwk an ta, Keiin anni sukdam hlau rawi ka tih,’ a ti kha.

en: But blessed are your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear.
hmr: “Nangni mit chu a vângnei a nih, a hmu hlak leiin; in na khawm a vângnei a nih, a hriet hlak leiin.

en: For verily I say unto you, that many prophets and righteous men desired to see the things which ye see, and saw them not; and to hear the things which ye hear, and heard them not.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, zâwlnei tamtakhai le mi fel tam- takhai khawmin, in thil hmuhai hi hmu an inhâwk a, nisienlakhawm, an hmu si nawh a; in thil hriethai khawm hi hriet an inhâwk a; nisienlakhawm, an hriet si nawh a!

en: Hear then ye the parable of the sower.
hmr: “Chuongchun, bu chi thetu tekhithu chu hre ro:

en: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth it not, then cometh the evil one, and snatcheth away that which hath been sown in his heart. This is he that was sown by the way side.
hmr: Tukhawmin ram thu chu naa a lo hriet a, a ngaina a hriet si naw chun, mi suol chu a hung a, a lungrila the sa chu a lâkpêk hlak. Chu chu lampui sîra the chu a nih.

en: And he that was sown upon the rocky places, this is he that heareth the word, and straightway with joy receiveth it;
hmr: Chun, pielthlêng hmuna the chu, thu hre a, lâwmtaka pawm nghâl hlak hi a nih;

en: yet hath he not root in himself, but endureth for a while; and when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, straightway he stumbleth.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, amaa chun zung a um naw leiin sâwt nawte chau a um a; chun, thu lei chun, rinumna amanih, suknawmnatna amanih a hung um phingleh a tlu nghâl el hlak.

en: And he that was sown among the thorns, this is he that heareth the word; and the care of the world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.
hmr: Chun, hlohlingnei laia the chu, thu hretu a na; nisienlakhawm, khawvêl lungkhamna le hausakna hlêmna chun thu chu a dîp a, ra loin a um hlak.

en: And he that was sown upon the good ground, this is he that heareth the word, and understandeth it; who verily beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
hmr: Chun, leihnuoi ṭha chunga the chu, thu chu naa hre a, a ngaina hre bawk hi a nih. Chu chu a ra ngei a, ṭhenkhat a lêt za dâm, ṭhenkhat a lêt sâwmruk dâmin, ṭhenkhat a lêt sâwmthum dâmin a pung hlak,” a ta.

en: Another parable set he before them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man that sowed good seed in his field:
hmr: Tekhithu dang an kuomah a hril nâwk a, “Vân ram chu, mi a loa chi ṭha thetu le chun hrilkhi a nih;

en: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares also among the wheat, and went away.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, mi an in kârin a hmêlma a hung a, bu lai chun bu tehlêm a the a, a fe hmang nâwk tah a.

en: But when the blade sprang up and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.
hmr: Chun, bu chu a hung mâwng a, a hung vui chun, bu tehlêm chu a hung inlang ve tah a.

en: And the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst thou not sow good seed in thy field? whence then hath it tares?
hmr: Chun, in neitu suokhai chu an hung a, a kuoma chun, ‘Pu, i loah chi ṭha i the a ni naw am a nih? bu tehlêm saw khâwlaia hung um am a ni leh?’ an ta.

en: And he said unto them, An enemy hath done this. And the servants say unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, ‘Chu chu hmêlmain a lo thaw a ni ta chu,’ a ta. Chun, suokhai chun a kuomah, ‘Chuong chu la khâwm el inlang rem i ti?’ an ta.

en: But he saith, Nay; lest haply while ye gather up the tares, ye root up the wheat with them.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, ‘Ti lo e; bu tehlêm chu in lâk khâwm chun bu chu phawi sa hlau rawi in tih.

en: Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of the harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather up first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them; but gather the wheat into my barn.
hmr: Bu sîk chenin um hmun khat raw se; chun, bu sîk pha chun, bu âttuhai kuomah, bu tehlêm chu la khâwm hmasa phawt unla, raw dingin intêl ro, bu ruok chu ka inah sêk lût ro, la tîng ka tih,’ a tih a,” a ta.

en: Another parable set he before them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like unto a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:
hmr: Tekhithu dang an kuomah a hril nâwk a, “Vân ram chu anṭam chi mal khat mîn a lâk a, a loa a the ang chu a na;

en: which indeed is less than all seeds; but when it is grown, it is greater than the herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the heaven come and lodge in the branches thereof.
hmr: chu chu chi po poa chîn tak a na: nisienlakhawm, a hung mâwng sâng pha chun, thlaihai nêk chun a lien lem a, thing a hung ni hlak a, chuongchun, chunglêng vatehai chu an hung a, a zârhaia chun an riek hlak a,” a ta.

en: Another parable spake he unto them; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, till it was all leavened.
hmr: Tekhithu dang an kuomah a hril nâwk a, “Vân ram chu chawl, nu- hmeiin a ilâk, beiphit tekhâwng thum laia arênga a tho vawng hmakhata a iphûm ang chu a nih,” a ta.

en: All these things spake Jesus in parables unto the multitudes; and without a parable spake he nothing unto them:
hmr: Chuong po po chu Isûn tekhi- thuin mipuihai kuomah a hril a, tekhithu nawin iengkhawm a hril nawh:

en: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world.
hmr: zâwlneiin, “Tekhithuin ka bau kâng ka ta, Leihnuoi insieng tîra inthawka thil inthup chu hril dawk ka tih,” tia a hril kha a hung tlung theina dingin.

en: Then he left the multitudes, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Explain unto us the parable of the tares of the field.
hmr: Chu lai chun mipuihai chu a fesan a, ina chun a lût tah a; chun, a inchûktirhai chu a kuomah an hung a, “Loa bu tehlêm tekhithu kha mi hrilfie rawh,” an ta.

en: And he answered and said, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;
hmr: Chun, ama chun a dawn a, “Chi ṭha thetu chu Mihriem Naupa hi a nih;

en: and the field is the world; and the good seed, these are the sons of the kingdom; and the tares are the sons of the evil one;
hmr: Lo chu khawvêl hi a na; chi ṭhahai chu Ram nauhai an na; bu tehlêmhai chu suol nauhai an nih.

en: and the enemy that sowed them is the devil: and the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are angels.
hmr: Hmêlma a thetu chu diebol a na; bu sîk chu khawvêl tâwpna ding a na; bu sîktuhai chu vântirkohai an nih.

en: As therefore the tares are gathered up and burned with fire; so shall it be in the end of the world.
hmr: Chuongchun, bu tehlêmhai chu an lâk khâwma meiah an raw ang hin khawvêl tâwpnaa chun la um a tih.

en: The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that cause stumbling, and them that do iniquity,
hmr: Mihriem Naupa hin a vântir- kohai chu tir dawk a ta, a rama inthawka insuksuoltirtuhai le thil suksuoltuhai po po chu thlang dawk an ta,

en: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
hmr: rawtuina meia chun pei an ta, chutaka chun ṭap le harâwt chu la um a tih.

en: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He that hath ears, let him hear.
hmr: Chu pha chun, mi felhai chu an Pa rama chun nisa angin var tâng an tih. Na nei chun hre raw se.

en: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a treasure hidden in the field; which a man found, and hid; and in his joy he goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.
hmr: “Vân ram chu loa ro phûmrûk ang a nih; chu chu miin a hmuh a, a thup hmang a, a lâwm leiin a feh a, a nei po po chu a va zawr a, chu lo chu ân châwk tah a.

en: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is a merchant seeking goodly pearls:
hmr: “Chun, vân ram chu sumdâwng mi lunghlu ṭhatak zawngtu ang chu a ni nâwk a,

en: and having found one pearl of great price, he went and sold all that he had, and bought it.
hmr: chun, ama chun lunghlu hlutak pakhat a hmuh a, a fe tah a, a nei po po chu a va zawr a, ân châwk tah a.

en: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:
hmr: “Chun, vân ram chu lênkhang tuisuorieta dênga, chi tinrêng fûn khâwmna ang chu a ni nâwk bawk a.

en: which, when it was filled, they drew up on the beach; and they sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but the bad they cast away.
hmr: Chu chu a sip phingleh va- pangah an hnûk dawk a; chun, an ṭhung a, a ṭha po chu bâwmah an lâk khâwm a, a sie ruok chu an pei a.

en: So shall it be in the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the righteous,
hmr: Khawvêl tâwp pha chun chuong ang bawk chun la um a tih; vân- tirkohai chu hung suok an ta, mi fel laia inthawkin mi suol hai chu ṭhêng an ta,

en: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
hmr: rawtuina meia chun pei an ta; chutaka chun ṭap le harâwt chu um a tih,” a ta.

en: Have ye understood all these things? They say unto him, Yea.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Chuong po po chu in hriet am?” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “Hre e,” an ta.

en: And he said unto them, Therefore every scribe who hath been made a disciple to the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is a householder, who bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Chuong a ni chun Dân inchûktirtu vân ram lampui inchûktira um taphawt chu, in neitu, a ro bâwma inthawka thil tharhai le, thil hluihai phawr dawk hlaktu ang chu a nih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.
hmr: Chun, Isûn chuong tekhithuhai chu a hril zo phingleh, chutaka inthawk chun a fe tah a.

en: And coming into his own country he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath this man this wisdom, and these mighty works?
hmr: Chun, a umna khuo tieng chu a tlung a, an inkhawmna ina chun anni ân chûktir tah a; chuongchun, mak an ti hle a. “Hi mipa hin, hieng varna le, thilmak thaw theinahai hi, khâw- laia inthawka a hmu am a ni leh?

en: Is not this the carpenter’s son? is not his mother called Mary? and his brethren, James, and Joseph, and Simon, and Judas?
hmr: Hi mi pa hi thingrem siemtu naupa kha a ni naw am a nih? A unauhai khawm, Jakob, Josef, Simon, Juda an tihai chu an ni naw am a nih?

en: And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath this man all these things?
hmr: A farnuhai khawm ei kuoma um an ni vawng a ni naw am a nih? Hi mi hin khâwlaia inthawk hrima hieng po po hi a hmu am a na?” an ta.

en: And they were offended in him. But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honor, save in his own country, and in his own house.
hmr: Chuongchun, a chungah an lungni ta nawh a. Nisienlakhawm, Isûn an kuomah, “Zâwlnei chu ama khuo tieng le ama ina chau naw chu inpâk loin a um ngai nawh,” a ta.

en: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
hmr: Chun, an ring naw leiin chutaka chun thilmak tam a thaw ta nawh a.

en: At that season Herod the tetrarch heard the report concerning Jesus,
hmr: Chu lai tak chun lal Herod chun Isu chanchin a lo hriet a,

en: and said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore do these powers work in him.
hmr: a siehlawhai kuomah, “Chu chu Baptistu Johan kha a ni chu, mithi laia inthawkin a tho nâwk tah a ni chu tie; chuleiin, chuong thilthaw- theinahai chun amaah sin a thaw a ni chu,” a ta.

en: For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
hmr: Herod chun a unaupa Philip nuhmei Herodi leiin Johan chu a man a; a khuop a, intângna inah a khum tah a na;

en: For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.
hmr: Johan chun a kuomah, “Ama i nei hi a thieng nawh,” a ti pêk leiin.

en: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.
hmr: Chun, Johan chu sukhlum a tum leh mipui a ṭih a, zâwlneiin an ruot si leiin.

en: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced in the midst, and pleased Herod.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Herod pieng champhaphâk ni chu a hung tlungin Herodi naunu chu a laiah a lâm a, Herod chu a suklâwm tah a.

en: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she should ask.
hmr: Chuleichun, a ihni taphawt pe dingin inkhâmin ân tiem tah a.

en: And she, being put forward by her mother, saith, Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptist.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a nu infuiin, “Hiva hin thlêngin Baptistu Johan lu mi pe rawh,” a ta.

en: And the king was grieved; but for the sake of his oaths, and of them that sat at meat with him, he commanded it to be given;
hmr: Chun, lal chu a lungngai tah a; nisienlakhawm, a thutiem le a thlai- thlêng awtpuihai lei chun pêk ding thu a pêk a;

en: and he sent and beheaded John in the prison.
hmr: chuongchun, mi a tir a, intângna ina Johan lu chu ân tantir a.

en: And his head was brought on a platter, and given to the damsel: and she brought it to her mother.
hmr: Chun, a lu chu thlêngin a hung lâk a, naupangnu kuoma chun an pêk a; ama chun a nu kuomah a fepui tah a.

en: And his disciples came, and took up the corpse, and buried him; and they went and told Jesus.
hmr: Chun, a inchûktirhai chu an hung a, a ruong chu an inhlawm a, an phûm a; chun, an feh a, Isu an va hril tah a.

en: Now when Jesus heard it, he withdrew from thence in a boat, to a desert place apart: and when the multitudes heard thereof, they followed him on foot from the cities.
hmr: Chun, Isûn chu chu a hrietin, chutaka inthawkin thlalêr hmun tieng lawngin a tumin a fe tah a. Nisienlakhawm, mipuihai chun an hriet phingleh khuoa inthawk dâm chun kea fein an zui tah a.

en: And he came forth, and saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, and healed their sick.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chu vapanga a suok chun, mipui nasatak a hmuh a; a lunginsiet bêk bêk a, an damnawhai a sukdam a,

en: And when even was come, the disciples came to him, saying, The place is desert, and the time is already past; send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves food.
hmr: Chun, zântieng a hung ni chun, inchûktirhai chu a kuomah an hung a, “Ahi thlalêr hmun a na, an ta dinga fâk ding an inchâwk theina dingin mipuihai hi infetir ta la,” an ta.

en: But Jesus said unto them, They have no need to go away; give ye them to eat.
hmr: Isu ruok chun an kuomah, “An fe hmang a ngai nawh ie; nangniin fâk ding pe ro,” a ta.

en: And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Ahin beiphêk panga le nga pahni chau kan nei a nih,” an ta.

en: And he said, Bring them hither to me.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Ahin ka kuomah hung la ro,” a ta.

en: And he commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass; and he took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake and gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes.
hmr: Chun, hlo chunga ṭhung dingin mipui chu thu a pêk a, beiphêk panga le nga pahni chu a lâk a, vân tieng enin mal a sâwm a, a khawi a, beiphêk panga chu inchûktirhai kuomah a pêk a; inchûktirhai chun mipui kuoma chun an pêk a.

en: And they all ate, and were filled: and they took up that which remained over of the broken pieces, twelve baskets full.
hmr: Chun, an rêngin an fâk a, an khawp tâwl tah a; an fâk mahla nawi khawm chu bâwm sâwm le pahni an rût sip a.

en: And they that did eat were about five thousand men, besides women and children.
hmr: A fatuhai chu nuhmei le nau- pang tiem loin patling ruok khawm sâng nga rau an nih.

en: And straightway he constrained the disciples to enter into the boat, and to go before him unto the other side, till he should send the multitudes away.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu ân ṭîntir vêl sûngin, a fe hmaa râlkhing tienga fe dingin inchûktirhai chu lawngah ân chuongtir hrâm nghâl tah a.

en: And after he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into the mountain apart to pray: and when even was come, he was there alone.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu ân ṭîntir hnungin ṭawngṭai dingin tlânga chun a tumin a hang feh a; chun, zântieng a hung ni chun ama chauin chutaka chun a um tah a.

en: But the boat was now in the midst of the sea, distressed by the waves; for the wind was contrary.
hmr: Lawng ruok chu dîl lailung takah a um tah a; thliin annaw tieng a mût leiin tuifâwnin a vawr tah a.

en: And in the fourth watch of the night he came unto them, walking upon the sea.
hmr: Chun, vârṭien tâwmin dîl chunga kea lâwnin an kuom tieng a hung pan a.

en: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a ghost; and they cried out for fear.
hmr: Inchûktirhai chun, ama chu dîl chunga kea lâwn an hang hmu chun, “Thla a ni saw,” tiin an thlaphâng a, an ṭih a, an khêk ta rak el a.

en: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn anni chu a biek nghâl tah a, “Lungmuongtakin um ro, kei ka ni annâwm, ṭi naw ro,” a ta.

en: And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee upon the waters.
hmr: Chun, Peterin a dawn a, “Lalpa, nang i ni chun, tui chunga i kuoma hung thu mi pe rawh,” a ta.

en: And he said, Come. And Peter went down from the boat, and walked upon the waters to come to Jesus.
hmr: Ama chun, “Hung ta la,” a ta. Peter chu lawnga inthawk chun a ṭum a, Isu kuom tieng panin tui chunga chun kein a fe tah a.

en: But when he saw the wind, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried out, saying, Lord, save me.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, thli hrâng chu a hmuin a ṭih a; chun a tlum vâng vâng a, “Lalpa, mi sandam rawh” tiin a khêk tah a.

en: And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand, and took hold of him, and saith unto him, O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?
hmr: Chun, Isûn a ban nghâl tah a, ama chu a chel a, a kuomah, “Nang ringna tlâwm, iengdinga i ringhla am a na?” a ta.

en: And when they were gone up into the boat, the wind ceased.
hmr: Chun, lawngah an chuong chun thli chu a ma ta el a.

en: And they that were in the boat worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.
hmr: Lawnga umhai chun, “Pathien Naupa i lo ni tak zet hi,” tiin chibai an bûk a.

en: And when they had crossed over, they came to the land, unto Gennesaret.
hmr: Chun, râlkhing tieng an kai chun, Gennesaret ram khawmuol an tlung tah a.

en: And when the men of that place knew him, they sent into all that region round about, and brought unto him all that were sick;
hmr: Chu hmuna mihai chun ama an hriet phingleh, chu kâwl vêl ram po poa chun mi an tir a, damnaw po po chu a kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a;

en: and they besought him that they might only touch the border of his garment: and as many as touched were made whole.
hmr: chun, a puon hmawr bêk them thei an hnih a; chun, a them phawt chu an hung dam ta pei a.

en: Then there come to Jesus from Jerusalem Pharisees and scribes, saying,
hmr: Chu lai tak chun, Jerusalema inthawkin Pharisaihai le Dân inchûktirtuhai Isu kuomah an hung a,

en: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.
hmr: “Iengdinga i închûktirhaiin upa- hai thurosie chu an bawsiet hlak am a na? Bei an fâk pha kut an sâwp ngai si nawh a,” an ta.

en: And he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God because of your tradition?
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Nangni khawm iengdinga in thu- rosie leia Pathien thupêk in bawsiet am a na?

en: For God said, Honor thy father and thy mother: and, He that speaketh evil of father or mother, let him die the death.
hmr: Pathienin, ‘I nu le pa chawimawi rawh,’ ‘Tukhawm a nu amanih, a pa amanih hrilse taphawt chu thi tei tei raw se,’ a ti sih a.

en: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, That wherewith thou mightest have been profited by me is given to God;
hmr: Nangni ruok chun tukhawm a nu amanih, a pa amanih kuoma, ‘I mi sawrna ding hi Pathien kuoma pêk a ni tah, ti taphawt chun,

en: he shall not honor his father. And ye have made void the word of God because of your tradition.
hmr: a nu amanih, a pa amanih a chawimawi ding a ni nawh’ in ti hlak a. Chuongchun, in thurosie leiin Pathien thu chu in baw hmang tah a ni hi.

en: Ye hypocrites, well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,
hmr: Vervêkhai Isai hin in chung- châng thu a lo hrillâwk indik ngei el:

en: This people honoreth me with their lips; But their heart is far from me.
hmr: ‘Hi hairawi hin an bauin an mi chawimawi a, An lungril ruok chun an mi hlat sih a.

en: But in vain do they worship me, Teaching as their doctrines the precepts of men.
hmr: Iengkhawm ni sienla, an inchûktirnaah mihriem thupêk an inchûktir leiin, An mi biek hlak hi a thlâwn el a nih,’ tiin,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And he called to him the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:
hmr: Chun, mipui chu a ko a, an kuomah, “Ngai unla, a ngai lo thiem ro;

en: Not that which entereth into the mouth defileth the man; but that which proceedeth out of the mouth, this defileth the man.
hmr: baua lût chu mihriem suk- thieng nawtu a ni nawh a, baua suok, achu ngei chu mihriem sukthieng nawtu a ni lem,” a ta.

en: Then came the disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, when they heard this saying?
hmr: Chu lai chun, a inchûktirhai an hung a, a kuomah, “Pharisaihaiin kha thu kha an hriet a, an lungninaw kha i hriet am?” an ta.

en: But he answered and said, Every plant which my heavenly Father planted not, shall be rooted up.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, “Kûng po po ka Pa vâna mi phun naw chu phâwi- dawkin um an tih.

en: Let them alone: they are blind guides. And if the blind guide the blind, both shall fall into a pit.
hmr: Anni chu pawisa naw ro; ṭhuoitu mitdel an nih. Chuongchun, mitdelin mitdel ma a ṭhuoi chun khurah tla rêl an tih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And Peter answered and said unto him, Declare unto us the parable.
hmr: Chun, Peterin a kuomah, “Tekhithu kha mi hrilfie ta la,” tiin a dawn a.

en: And he said, Are ye also even yet without understanding?
hmr: Ama chun, “Tu chen hin nangni khawm hrietna nei loin in la um rawp maw?

en: Perceive ye not, that whatsoever goeth into the mouth passeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?
hmr: Baua lût taphawt chu phîngah a tla thlah a, inhnawmnaah pei dawkin a um ti in hriet naw am a nih?

en: But the things which proceed out of the mouth come forth out of the heart; and they defile the man.
hmr: Baua suokhai ruok chu lungrila hung suok a na; chuong ngei chun mihriem a sukthieng naw hlak a nih.

en: For out of the heart come forth evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, railings:
hmr: Lungrila hin ngaituona suolhai, tuolthatna hai, uiretna hai, inditna hai, inrûkna hai, inhêkna hai, hrilsietna hai a hung suok hlak sih a.

en: these are the things which defile the man; but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not the man.
hmr: chuong chu mihriem suk- thieng nawtu a nih; kut sâwp loa bu fâk ruok chun mi a sukthieng naw nawh,” a ta.

en: And Jesus went out thence, and withdrew into the parts of Tyre and Sidon.
hmr: Chun, Isu chutaka inthawk chun a suok a; Tura le Sidon bielah a fe tah a.

en: And behold, a Canaanitish woman came out from those borders, and cried, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, thou son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a demon.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, chuong rama in- thawk chun Kanaan nuhmei pakhat a hung suok a, “Lalpa, David naupa, mi lunginsiet rawh, ka naunu khawhriin a man tlat a nih,” tiin a khêk a.

en: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.
hmr: Ama ruok chun bau khat khawmin a dawn nawh. Chun, a inchûktirhai chun, “Ei hnungah a khêk a khêk sih a, infetir el ta la,” tiin an hung ngên a.

en: But he answered and said, I was not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, “Israel hnam laia berâm inhmang kuoma naw chu tir ka ni nawh,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: But she came and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nuhmei chu a hung a, “Lalpa, mi san rawh,” tiin chibai a bûk a.

en: And he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children’s bread and cast it to the dogs.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Nauhai bei lâkpêk a, uihai kuoma pêk chu a mawi nawh ie,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: But she said, Yea, Lord: for even the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.
hmr: Ama chun, “Lalpa, ni chu a nih; nisienlakhawm, uihai khawmin an pu dawkâna inthawka bei nawi tla chu an fâk hlak annâwm,” a ta.

en: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great is thy faith: be it done unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was healed from that hour.
hmr: Chu phingleh Isûn a kuomah, “Nuhmei, i ringna a nasa êm el; i dit ang takin i chungah um raw se,” a ta, a dawn a. Chuongchun, a naunu chu, chu chena chun a hung dam el tah a.

en: And Jesus departed thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and he went up into the mountain, and sat there.
hmr: Chun, Isu chutaka inthawk chun a feh a, Galili dîl kâwl a hung tlung a; chun tlânga chun a hang feh a, chutaka chun a ṭhung tah a.

en: And there came unto him great multitudes, having with them the lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and they cast them down at his feet; and he healed them:
hmr: Chun, mipui nasatak, kebaihai, mitdelhai, ṭawngtheinawhai, pieng- suolhai hung ṭhuoiin a kuomah an hung a, a ke bulah an sieh a; chun, a lo sukdam tâwl a.

en: insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb speaking, the maimed whole, and the lame walking, and the blind seeing: and they glorified the God of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui chun, ṭawngtheinawhai chu hung ṭawng a, piengsuolhai chu hung ṭhah a, kebaihai chu kea lâwn a, mitdelhai chu hmu theia an hmuin, mak an ti hle a; chuongchun, Israelhai Pathien chu an inpâk tah a.

en: And Jesus called unto him his disciples, and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days and have nothing to eat: and I would not send them away fasting, lest haply they faint on the way.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a inchûktirhai chu a ko a, “Mipuihai hi tuhin ka kuomah ni thum an um tah a, fâk ding iengkhawm an nei naw leiin ka lungsiet bêk bêk a nih; bu ngheiin kân fetir nuom nawh ie, chuong naw chun lam kârah châu rawi an tih,” a ta.

en: And the disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so many loaves in a desert place as to fill so great a multitude?
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chun a kuomah, “Mipui hieng zât zât khawpna khawp beiphêk chuong zât lâwm lâwm thlalêrah khâwlai am hmûng kan ta?” an ta.

en: And Jesus said unto them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few small fishes.
hmr: Chun, an kuomah, “Beiphêk iengzât am in nei a?” a ta. Anni chun, “Phêk sari, ngatê tlâwmte leh,” an ta.

en: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground;
hmr: Ama chun hnuoia ṭhung dingin mipui chu thu a pêk a.

en: and he took the seven loaves and the fishes; and he gave thanks and brake, and gave to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes.
hmr: Chun, bei pasari le ngatê chu a lâk a, lâwmthu a hril a, a khawi a, inchûktirhai kuomah a pêk a; inchûktirhai chun mipuihai kuomah an pêk a.

en: And they all ate, and were filled: and they took up that which remained over of the broken pieces, seven baskets full.
hmr: Chun, an rêngin an fâk a, an khawp tâwl tah a, an fâk mahla khawm chu bâwmrâng sari an rût sip a.

en: And they that did eat were four thousand men, besides women and children.
hmr: A fatuhai chu nuhmei le nau- pang tiem loin patling ruok khawm sâng li an nih.

en: And he sent away the multitudes, and entered into the boat, and came into the borders of Magadan.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu ân ṭintir hnungin lawngah a chuong a, Magadan ram a hung tlung a.

en: And the Pharisees and Sadducees came, and trying him asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai le Saddu- kaihai an hung a, ama fiena dingin vâna inthawka inchikna anni inentir dingin an hnih a.

en: But he answered and said unto them, When it is evening, ye say, It will be fair weather: for the heaven is red.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun an kuomah, “Zântieng a hung ni pha, ‘Khuo a ṭha ding nîng a tih, kâwl a sen êm el,’ in ti hlak a.

en: And in the morning, It will be foul weather to-day: for the heaven is red and lowering. Ye know how to discern the face of the heaven; but ye cannot discern the signs of the times.
hmr: Chun, a zîngkâr chun, ‘Vawisûn chu khuo a se ding nîng a tih, kâwl a sen a, vân ân nîm êm el,’ in ti hlak a. Vân umzie in hrietthiem thei sih a, nisienlakhawm, hun inchiknahai hi in hriet fie thei si nawh a.

en: An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of Jonah. And he left them, and departed.
hmr: Ruolthar suol tak le uire hmang- hai chun inchikna an zawng a; nisienlakhawm, Jona inchikna chau naw chu an kuomah inchikna hrim pêk ni naw ni,” a ta, a dawn a. Chun, anni a fesan a, a fe ta dai a.

en: And the disciples came to the other side and forgot to take bread.
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chu râlkhing tieng an tlung chun, bei an lo chawi theinghil a,

en: And Jesus said unto them, Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
hmr: Isûn an kuomah, “Pharisaihai le Saddukaihai chawla inthawk chun invêng unla, fîmkhur ro,” a ta.

en: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, We took no bread.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, “Bei ei chawi dêr nawh,” tiin an inngaituoh a.

en: And Jesus perceiving it said, O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have no bread?
hmr: Chun, Isûn chu chu a hriet a, “Ringna tlâwmhai, iengdinga bei in nei naw leia in inngaituo am a na?

en: Do ye not yet perceive, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?
hmr: Tu khawm hin in lungrilin in la hriet naw rawp maw? Mi sâng nga beiphêk panga le, in bâwm rût sip zât kha in hriet zing naw am a nih?

en: Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?
hmr: Mi sâng li beiphêk pasari le, in bâwmrâng rût sip zât khawm kha?

en: How is it that ye do not perceive that I spake not to you concerning bread? But beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
hmr: Bei thu in kuomah ka hril nawh ti iengtiziea in hriet naw am a na? Pharisaihai le Saddukaihai chawla inthawk ruok chun fîmkhur ro,” a ta.

en: Then understood they that he bade them not beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
hmr: Chu phingleh, bei chawla inthawka fîmkhur dingin a ti nawh a, Pharisaihai le Saddukaihai inchûk- tirnaa inthawka fîmkhur dingin anni a ti lem ti an hung hriet tah a.

en: Now when Jesus came into the parts of Cæsarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, Who do men say that the Son of man is?
hmr: Chun, Isu chu Philip Kaisari biel a hung tlung chun, a inchûktirhai kuomah, “Mihaiin Mihriem Naupa hi tu am a nih an tih a?” tiin ân dawn a.

en: And they said, Some say John the Baptist; some, Elijah; and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.
hmr: Anni chun, “Ṭhenkhatin, ‘Bap- tistu Johan an ti che a,’ ṭhenkhatin, ‘Elija’, ṭhenkhatin, ‘Jeremia amanih, zâwlnei tu amanih’ an ti che” an ta.

en: He saith unto them, But who say ye that I am?
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “An leh, nangnîn tu am a nih in mi tih a?” a ta.

en: And Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.
hmr: Simon Peterin, “Krista Pathien hring Naupa chu I nih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And Jesus answered and said unto him, Blessed art thou, Simon Bar-Jonah: for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but my Father who is in heaven.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Simon Bar-Jona, i hamṭha ie; tisa le thisenin ân hriettir che a ni si nawh a, ka Pa vâna mîn ân hriettir lem che a nih.

en: And I also say unto thee, that thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church; and the gates of Hades shall not prevail against it.
hmr: Chun, nang Peter i nih ti ka hril che; hi lungpui chunga hin ka kohran rem ka ta, mithi khuo kul kawtkhârhai chun chu chu ngam naw ni hai.

en: I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven; and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
hmr: Vân ram chabihai pêng ka ti cheh a, hnuoi chunga iengkhawm i phuor taphawt vânah phuor ning a ta; hnuoi chunga iengkhawm i sût taphawt chu vânah sût ning a tih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Then charged he the disciples that they should tell no man that he was the Christ.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Krista a ni ti tukhawm hril lo dingin inchûktirhai chu a ti tlat a.

en: From that time began Jesus to show unto his disciples, that he must go unto Jerusalem, and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.
hmr: Chu chena inthawk chun, Isûn Jerusalema a fe dingzie dâm, upahai, thiempu lalhai, Dân inchûktirtuhaia inthawka thil tamtak a tuor dingzie dâm, sukhluma a um dingzie dâm le ni thum nia keithoa a um dingzie dâm chu a inchûktirhai chu ân hriettir phut tah a.

en: And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him, saying, Be it far from thee, Lord: this shall never be unto thee.
hmr: Chun, Peter chun ama chu a tumin a ṭhuoi a, “Lalpa, Pathienin lunginsiet raw se che!; chuong chu i chungah tlung naw tawp a tih,” tiin a kâwk tah a.

en: But he turned, and said unto Peter, Get thee behind me, Satan: thou art a stumbling-block unto me: for thou mindest not the things of God, but the things of men.
hmr: Ama ruok chu a nghah a, Peter kuoma chun, “Setan, ka hnungah fe rawh, keia ta dingin tlûkna i nih; Pathien thil ngaituo loin mihriem thil i ngaituo lem a ni hi,” a ta.

en: Then said Jesus unto his disciples, If any man would come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a închûktirhai kuomah, “Tukhawmin mi zui a nuom chun, mâni inhnâwlin, a kraws putin, mi zui raw se.

en: For whosoever would save his life shall lose it: and whosoever shall lose his life for my sake shall find it.
hmr: Tukhawm a hringna hum nuom taphawt chun chân a tih; tukhawm keia leia hringna chân phawt chun hum a tih.

en: For what shall a man be profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and forfeit his life? or what shall a man give in exchange for his life?
hmr: Mîn khawvêl hi a pumin nei sien, ama hringna chân si sienla, a ta dingin ieng am ṭhahnem a ta? Annawleh, mîn a hringna sikin ieng am pêng a ta?

en: For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels; and then shall he render unto every man according to his deeds.
hmr: Mihriem Naupa hi a vântir- kohai leh, a Pa ropuinaa inthuomin a hung ding a ni sih a; chu pha chun mi tin an thilthaw ang peiin thung seng a tih.

en: Verily I say unto you, There are some of them that stand here, who shall in no wise taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hitaka ngîr a ṭhen hi, Mihriem Naupa a rama a hung an hmu hmakhat chun, thina intem tawp lo ding an um,” a tih a.

en: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John his brother, and bringeth them up into a high mountain apart:
hmr: Chun, ni ruk hnung chun Isûn Peter hai, Jakob hai, a unau Johan hai a ṭhuoi a, a tumin tlâng insângtakah a hang fepui a;

en: and he was transfigured before them; and his face did shine as the sun, and his garments became white as the light.
hmr: an hmaa chun a hmêl umzie chu a hung danglam tah a; a hmai nisa angin a hung var a; a silfênhai chu vûr angin a hung vâr tah a.

en: And behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elijah talking with him.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, Mosie le Elija chu ama le inbien an kuomah an ngîr a.

en: And Peter answered, and said unto Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here: if thou wilt, I will make here three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.
hmr: Chun, Peterin Isu a biek a, “Lalpa, ei ta dingin hitaka um hi a ṭha; i nuom chun hitaka hin bâwkte pathum khâwng ka ta; i ta dingin pakhat, Mosie ta dingin pakhat, Elija ta dingin pakhat,” a tih a.

en: While he was yet speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold, a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.
hmr: A la hril lai zingin ngai ta, sûm vârtakin anni a hung hlie tah a; chun, ngai ta, sûma inthawk râwlin, “Hi hi ka Naupa dittak, ka ilâwm bêk bêk chu a nih, ama thu ngai ro,” a ta.

en: And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.
hmr: Inchûktirhai chun chu chu an hrietin bawkkhupin an tluh a, an ṭi ta bêk bêk a.

en: And Jesus came and touched them and said, Arise, and be not afraid.
hmr: Chun, Isûn anni chu a hung them a, “Tho unla, ṭi naw ro,” a ta.

en: And lifting up their eyes, they saw no one, save Jesus only.
hmr: Chun, an hang dâk a, Isu chau naw chu tukhawm an hmu ta nawh a.

en: And as they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen from the dead.
hmr: Chun, tlânga inthawka an ṭum lai chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Mihriem Naupa hi mithi laia inthawka a thonâwk hmakhat chu in thil hmu kha tukhawm hril naw ro,” tiin thu a pêk tah a.

en: And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elijah must first come?
hmr: Chun, a inchûktirhaiin a kuomah, “Dân inchûktirtuhaiin ‘Elija a hung hmasa ding a nih,’ iengtiziea ti am an ni leh?” tiin an indawn a.

en: And he answered and said, Elijah indeed cometh, and shall restore all things:
hmr: Ama chun, “Elija chu a hung ding hrim a nih, tinrêng siem ṭha bawk a tih.

en: but I say unto you, that Elijah is come already, and they knew him not, but did unto him whatsoever they would. Even so shall the Son of man also suffer of them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka hril cheu, Elija chu a hung tah a nih, ama chu an hriet nawh a, a chungah an nuom nuomin an thaw ta lem a. Chuong ang bawkin Mihriem Naupa khawm hin annia inthawkin a tuor ve ding a nih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Then understood the disciples that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.
hmr: Chu phingle chun inchûktirhai chun, Baptistu Johan thu an kuomah a hril a ni ti an lo hriet tah a.

en: And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a man, kneeling to him, and saying,
hmr: Chun, mipui kuom an hung tlung chun, mi pakhat a kuomah a hung a, a hmaa dingṭhaṭhuonin,

en: Lord, have mercy on my son: for he is epileptic, and suffereth grievously; for oft-times he falleth into the fire, and oft-times into the water.
hmr: “Lalpa, ka naupa saw lunginsiet rawh, hringawl invawi a na, a tuor nasa êm el; vawi tamtak meiah a tlu hlak, vawi tamtak tuiah a tlu bawk hlak a nih.

en: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.
hmr: I închûktirhai kuomah ka hung ṭhuoi a, an sukdam thei si nawh a,” a ta.

en: And Jesus answered and said, O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I bear with you? bring him hither to me.
hmr: Chun, Isûn, “Ruolthar ringna nei loa kawmawhai, ieng chen am in kuomah um ka tih a, ieng chen am ngai thei ka ti cheu a? Ama chu ka kuoma hin hung ṭhuoi ro,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And Jesus rebuked him; and the demon went out of him: and the boy was cured from that hour.
hmr: Chun, Isûn khawhri chu a hal a, a sûnga inthawk chun a suok tah a; chu dâr chena inthawk chu naupang chu a hung dam tah a.

en: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast it out?
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chu a tumin Isu kuomah an hung a, “Iengdinga keinîn kan hnawt dawk thei naw am a na?” an ta.
