en: And he saith unto them, Because of your little faith: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “In ring- na tlâwm leiin. Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, anṭam mu mal khat ang ringna in nei chun, hi tlâng kuoma hin, ‘Hitaka inthawkin saw taka sawn vân sawn rawh,’ tîng in ta, insawn el a tih; in ta dingin thaw thei naw hrim hrim iengkhawm um naw ni.
[Amiruokchu, hieng ang hi ṭawngṭai le bunghei chau naw chun a suok thei nawh]”, a ta.

en: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, The Son of man shall be delivered up into the hands of men;
hmr: Chun, Galili rama an hung inkhâwm laiin, Isûn an kuomah, “Mihriem Naupa hi mihriemhai kuta inmantirin a um ding a nih;

en: and they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised up. And they were exceeding sorry.
hmr: chun, sukhlum an ta, chun, ni thum nia chun keithoin um a tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, an lungngai ta bêk bêk a.

en: And when they were come to Capernaum, they that received the half-shekel came to Peter, and said, Doth not your teacher pay the half-shekel?
hmr: Chun, Kapernaum chu an hung tlungin biekin tangka dâwltuhai chu Peter kuomah an hung a, “In inchûktirtu hin biekin tangka chu a pêk ve hlak naw am a nih?” an ta. Ama chun, “Pe ve hlak e,” a ta.

en: He saith, Yea. And when he came into the house, Jesus spake first to him, saying, What thinkest thou, Simon? the kings of the earth, from whom do they receive toll or tribute? from their sons, or from strangers?
hmr: Chun, inah a va lût chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Simon, iengtin am i ngai a? hnuoia lalhaiin sie amanih, sum nei man amanih, tu kâwl âm an lâk hlak a? an nauhai kuom âm, mi dang kuomah?” tiin a lo hril khal a.

en: And when he said, From strangers, Jesus said unto him, Therefore the sons are free.
hmr: Chun, Peterin, “Mi dang kuomah,” a ti phingleh, Isûn a kuomah, “Chuong a ni si chun nauhai chu an âwl ni naw ni.

en: But, lest we cause them to stumble, go thou to the sea, and cast a hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a shekel: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nang dîlah va fe la, ngakuoi inchie la, nga hung suok hmasa chu man rawh; chun, a bau i keika phingleh tangka pahni hmu el i tih; chu chu la la, kei le nanga ta dingin an kuomah pe rawh, chuong naw chun anni chu suklungawi naw rawi ei tih,” a ta.

en: In that hour came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?
hmr: Chu lai tak chun inchûktirhai chu Isu kuomah an hung a, “Vân ramah tu am ropuitak a ta?” an ta.

en: And he called to him a little child, and set him in the midst of them,
hmr: Ama chun, naupangte a ko a, anni lai ân ngîrtir a,

en: and said, Verily I say unto you, Except ye turn, and become as little children, ye shall in no wise enter into the kingdom of heaven.
hmr: “Titakzetin ka ti cheu hi, in inleta naupangte ang in hung ni naw chun, vân ramah lût naw tawp in tih.

en: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
hmr: Chuongchun, tukhawm hi nau- pangte anga inngaitlâwm taphawt, ama chu vân rama chun ropuitak a tih.

en: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me:
hmr: Chun, tukhawm ka hming leia hieng ang naupangte pakhat lâwm taphawt chu keia mi lâwm nîng a tih.

en: but whoso shall cause one of these little ones that believe on me to stumble, it is profitable for him that a great millstone should be hanged about his neck, and that he should be sunk in the depth of the sea.
hmr: “Amiruokchu, tukhawm hieng a mi awitu mi chînhai laia pakhat khawm sukthlu taphawt chu, a rîngah bu râwtnawina lung lientak inhlîtirin tuisuoriet inthûk laiah thlâk dai hai sien a ta dingin ṭha lem a tih.

en: Woe unto the world because of occasions of stumbling! for it must needs be that the occasions come; but woe to that man through whom the occasion cometh!
hmr: “Tlûknahai leiin khawvêl chung a rik de! tlûknahai chu hung um ding chu a nih; nisienlakhawm, tlûkna inumtirtu chung chu a rik!

en: And if thy hand or thy foot causeth thee to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from thee: it is good for thee to enter into life maimed or halt, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire.
hmr: Chun, i kutin amanih, i kein amanih a sukthlûk che chun, tan la, pei dai rawh; kut pahni amanih, ke pahni amanih neia kumkhaw meia peia um nêk chun, piengsuolin amanih, ke baiin amanih hringnaa lût i ta dingin a ṭha lem.

en: And if thine eye causeth thee to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: it is good for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the hell of fire.
hmr: Chun, i mitin a sukthlûk che chun, khel dawk la, pei dai rawh, mit khinghni neia Hremhmun meia peia um nêk chun mit khing khat neia hringnaa lût i ta dingin a ṭha lem.

en: See that ye despise not one of these little ones: for I say unto you, that in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father who is in heaven.
hmr: “Hieng mi chîn laia pakhat khawm hi hmusit naw dingin fîmkhur ro; an vântirkohaiin vânah ka Pa vâna mi hmêl an hmu rawp hlak ti ka hril cheu hi,”
[Bohmanghai sandam dingin Mihriem Naupa hi a hung a nih.]

en: How think ye? if any man have a hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and go unto the mountains, and seek that which goeth astray?
hmr: “Ieng angin am in ngai a? Mi tukhawmin berâm za nei sienla, an laia pakhat invâk hmang sienla, sâwmkuo le pakuo chu mâksan a, tlânghaiah hang fein, ân hmang chu a zawng naw ding am a nih?

en: And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth over it more than over the ninety and nine which have not gone astray.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, a hmu nâwk hlau chun, sâwmkuo le pakuo ân vâk hmang nawhai chunga nêk chun a chungah lâwm lem a tih.

en: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin, hieng mi chînhai laia pakhat bohmang khawm hi in Pa vâna mi dit zâwng a ni nawh.

en: And if thy brother sin against thee, go, show him his fault between thee and him alone: if he hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.
hmr: “Chun, i unauin i chungah thil suksuol ta sienla, fe la, ama le nang chau hrietah a suolnaa chun kâwk rawh, i thu a ngai chun i unau chu i hne ni tâng a tih.

en: But if he hear thee not, take with thee one or two more, that at the mouth of two witnesses or three every word may be established.
hmr: A ngai naw ruok che chun, mi dang pakhat amanih, pahni amanih i kuomah ṭhuoi la, chuongchun, thu tinrêng chu hretu pahni amanih, pathum amanih baua sukdet a ni theina dingin.

en: And if he refuse to hear them, tell it unto the church: and if he refuse to hear the church also, let him be unto thee as the Gentile and the publican.
hmr: Chun, anni khawm chu a ngai nuom naw chun, kohranah intlun el rawh; chun, kohran thu khawm a ngai naw chun ama chu i ta dingin Jentail le siedâwltu ang ni raw se.

en: Verily I say unto you, What things soever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven; and what things soever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
hmr: “Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hnuoi chunga iengkhawm in phuor taphawt chu vânah phuor nîng a tih; hnuoi chunga iengkhawm in sût taphawt chu vânah sût nîng a tih.

en: Again I say unto you, that if two of you shall agree on earth as touching anything that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of my Father who is in heaven.
hmr: “Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hnuoi chunga hin nangni laia mi pahni amanih an thil hni chunga an inthuruol chun, ka Pa vâna mi thawpêkin um an tih.

en: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.
hmr: Mi pahni amanih, pathum ama- nih, ka hminga an inkhâwmna taphawta chun anni lai ka um si hlak a,” a ta.

en: Then came Peter and said to him, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? until seven times?
hmr: Chu lai chun Peter a hung a, a kuomah, “Lalpa, ka unauin vawi ieng zât am ka chungah thil suksuol sien la ka ngaidam ding? vawi sari chen ding am a nih?” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven times; but, Until seventy times seven.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “ ‘Vawi sari chen- in,’ ka ti naw che, ‘Vawi sari hmun sâwmsari chenin,’ ka ti lem che a nih.

en: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king, who would make a reckoning with his servants.
hmr: “Chuleichun, vân ram chu, laltak tu amanih, a suokhai kuoma sum chanchin sukfel tumtu le chun hrilkhi a nih.

en: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, that owed him ten thousand talents.
hmr: Chun, a hang sukfel hlim chun, mi pakhat talent sing khat bat a kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a.

en: But forasmuch as he had not wherewith to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
hmr: Pêk ding a nei naw leiin, a pu chun a nuhmei leh, a inei po po leh zawra thung ding thu a pêk a.

en: The servant therefore fell down and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.
hmr: Chuongchun, a suokpa chun, ‘Pu ka chungah za la ngai phawt la, arêngin pe vawng ka ti che,’ tiin bawkkhupin chibai a bûk a.

en: And the lord of that servant, being moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.
hmr: Chuongchun, suok neitupa chun a lunginsiet ta bêk bêk a, ân thlah a, a bat chu a ngaidam tah a.

en: But that servant went out, and found one of his fellow-servants, who owed him a hundred shillings: and he laid hold on him, and took him by the throat, saying, Pay what thou owest.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chu suok chu a va fe suok a, a suok chanpui laia pakhat, a duli za battu a va hmuh a; a man a, ‘I bat kha mi pe rawh,’ tiin a rîng a rêk a.

en: So his fellow-servant fell down and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, a suok chanpui chu a bawkkhup a, ‘Ka chungah za la ngai phawt la, la pêng ka ti che,’ tiin a ngên rak a.

en: And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay that which was due.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a nuom nawh a; a ibat chu a tlâk hmakhat chu intângna inah a va khum tah a.

en: So when his fellow-servants saw what was done, they were exceeding sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that was done.
hmr: Chuongchun, a suok chanpuihai chun a thilthaw chu an hmuin, an lungngai bêk bêk a; a thilthaw po pohai chu an pu an va hril tah a.

en: Then his lord called him unto him, and saith to him, Thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou besoughtest me:
hmr: Chu phingleh a pu chun a ko a, a kuomah, ‘Suok rilo, i mi hni rak leiin i bat po po kha ka ngaidam che a na,

en: shouldest not thou also have had mercy on thy fellow-servant, even as I had mercy on thee?
hmr: ka lunginsiet che ang khan nang khawmin i suok chanpui i lunginsiet ve ding a ni naw am a nih?’

en: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due.
hmr: Chun, a pu chu a lunginsen a, a ibat po po a thung hmakhat chu sawisatuhai kuomah a pêk tah a.

en: So shall also my heavenly Father do unto you, if ye forgive not every one his brother from your hearts.
hmr: Mi tinin in lungril taka in unauhai in ngaidam naw chun, ka Pa vâna mi khawmin chuong ang bawkin in chungah thaw vêng a tih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass when Jesus had finished these words, he departed from Galilee, and came into the borders of Judæa beyond the Jordan;
hmr: Chun, Isûn chuong thu chu a hril zo phingleh Galili rama inthawk a suok a, Jordan vadung râla Judai rama chun a va feh a;

en: and great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there.
hmr: chun, mipui nasatakin an zui a; chutaka chun anni chu a sukdam tah a.

en: And there came unto him Pharisees, trying him, and saying, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai a kuomah an hung a, ama fie dingin, “Ieng lei khawmin mîn a nuhmei a mâk a thieng am?” an ta.

en: And he answered and said, Have ye not read, that he who made them from the beginning made them male and female,
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Hi thu hi in tiem ngai naw am a nih? A tîra inthawka anni siemtu khan nuhmei le pasalin a siem le,

en: and said, For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife; and the two shall become one flesh?
hmr: ‘Hi lei hin pasalin a nu le pa mâksan a ta, a nuhmei chel a tih; chuongchun, an pahni chun tisa pumkhat ni tâng an tih,’ ti hi.

en: So that they are no more two, but one flesh. What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.
hmr: Chuongchun, pahni an ni ta nawh a, tisa pumkhat an ni ta lem a nih. Chuleiin, Pathienin a izawm ta chu mihriemin ṭhe naw raw se,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: They say unto him, Why then did Moses command to give a bill of divorcement, and to put her away?
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah “An leh iengdinga Mosien inmâkna lekha pêka mâk ding thu a pêk si am a na?” an ta.

en: He saith unto them, Moses for your hardness of heart suffered you to put away your wives: but from the beginning it hath not been so.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Mosiein in lungril ngar leiin annâwm in nuhmeihai mâk a phal; nisienla- khawm, a tîra inthawkin chuong ang a ni si nawh.

en: And I say unto you, Whosoever shall put away his wife, except for fornication, and shall marry another, committeth adultery: and he that marrieth her when she is put away committeth adultery.
hmr: Kei chun ka ti cheu hi, tukhawm tlangvâl dit lei ni loa, nuhmei maa, mi dang nei taphawt chu a uire a nih; mâk hnung chu nei taphawt khawm a uire a nih,” a ta.

en: The disciples say unto him, If the case of the man is so with his wife, it is not expedient to marry.
hmr: Inchûktirhai chun a kuomah, “Nuhmei kawngah pasal thu chuong ang a ni si chun, innei a ṭha nawh ie,” an ta.

en: But he said unto them, Not all men can receive this saying, but they to whom it is given.
hmr: Ama ruok chun an kuomah, “Chu thu chu mi nazawngin an pawm thei nawh, a ipêkhai chau naw chun.

en: For there are eunuchs, that were so born from their mother’s womb: and there are eunuchs, that were made eunuchs by men: and there are eunuchs, that made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven’s sake. He that is able to receive it, let him receive it.
hmr: Mi tillâk an nu phîng sûnga inthawka chuong anga insieng hrim an um a; mi tillâk mihriem kuta lâk khawm an um bawk a; mi tillâk vân ram leia tillâka insiem fâwm khawm an um bawk a. Tukhawm a pawm thei taphawt chun pawm raw se,” a ta.

en: Then were there brought unto him little children, that he should lay his hands on them, and pray: and the disciples rebuked them.
hmr: Chun, an chunga a kut innghat a a iṭawngṭaipêk dingin a kuomah naupangtêhai an hung ṭhuoi a; chun, inchûktirhai chun an lo hal a.

en: But Jesus said, Suffer the little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for to such belongeth the kingdom of heaven.
hmr: Isu ruok chun, “Naupangtêhai ka kuomah inhungtir unla, khap naw ro; vân ram chu hieng ang mi ta a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And he laid his hands on them, and departed thence.
hmr: Chun, an chungah a kut ân nghat a, chutaka inthawk chu a fe tah a.

en: And behold, one came to him and said, Teacher, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat a hung a, a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, kumkhuoa hringna ka nei theina dingin thil ṭha ieng am thâwng ka tih a?” a ta.

en: And he said unto him, Why askest thou me concerning that which is good? One there is who is good: but if thou wouldest enter into life, keep the commandments.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Thil ṭha thu iengdinga i mîn dawn? Ṭha chu pakhat chau a um, ieng- khawm ni sienla, hringnaa lût i nuom chun thupêkhai chu zâwm rawh,” a ta.

en: He saith unto him, Which? And Jesus said, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness,
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “A ieng tak am ie?” a ta. Isûn, “ ‘Tuol i that ding a ni nawh, i uire ding a ni nawh; în rûk ding a ni nawh, hrietpuina inkhêl i pêk ding a ni nawh,

en: Honor thy father and thy mother; and, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
hmr: I nu le pa chawimawi rawh,’ tihai le, ‘Nangma în hmangai angin i vênghai i hmangai ding a nih,’ ti hi,” a ta.

en: The young man saith unto him, All these things have I observed: what lack I yet?
hmr: Tlangvâl chun a kuomah, “Chuong thu po po chu ka zâwm hlak, ieng am ka la bâk a?” a ta.

en: Jesus said unto him, If thou wouldest be perfect, go, sell that which thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Ṭha famkima um i nuom chun, fe la, i nei chu zawr la, pasiehai kuomah pe rawh; chuongchun, vânah ro nei i tih; chun hung la, mi hung zui rawh,” a ta.

en: But when the young man heard the saying, he went away sorrowful; for he was one that had great possessions.
hmr: Tlangvâl ruok chun chuong thu chu a hrietin lungngaitakin a fe hmang tah a; sum tamtak nei a ni leiin.

en: And Jesus said unto his disciples, Verily I say unto you, It is hard for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of heaven.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a inchûktirhai kuoma chun, “Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, mi hausa ta dingin vân rama lût chu intak tak a nih.

en: And again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
hmr: Ka hril nâwk cheu hi, mi hausa Pathien rama a lût nêkin, sang- hâwngsei ṭhimnaa a lût thleng a awl lem,” a ta.

en: And when the disciples heard it, they were astonished exceedingly, saying, Who then can be saved?
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chun chu chu an hriet chun, mak an ti nasa bêk bêk a, “Tu am sandam ni thei a ta?” an ta.

en: And Jesus looking upon them said to them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.
hmr: Chun, Isûn anni chu a en a, an kuomah, “Chu chu mihriem dingin thaw ruol a ni nawh a; Pathien ding ruok chun iengkim thaw thei a nih,” a ta.

en: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee; what then shall we have?
hmr: Chun, Peterin a kuomah, “Ngai ta, keinin iengkim mâksanin kan zui ta cheh a; ieng am hmûng kan ta le?” a ta, ân dawn a.

en: And Jesus said unto them, Verily I say unto you, that ye who have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit on the throne of his glory, ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
hmr: Isûn an kuomah, “Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, siemtharnaa chun, Mihriem Naupa a ropuina ṭhung- phaah a ṭhung phaleh nangni a mi zuituhai rawi hi, Israel hnam sâwm le hnam hnihai chu ngaituoin, lalṭhungpha sâwm le pahniah la ṭhung vêng in tih.

en: And every one that hath left houses, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or children, or lands, for my name’s sake, shall receive a hundredfold, and shall inherit eternal life.
hmr: Chun, mi tin inhai amanih, unauhai amanih, farnuhai amanih, pa amanih, nu amanih, nauhai amanih, ramhai amanih, ka hming leia fesan taphawt chun, a let za hmûng an ta, kumkhuoa hringna chang bawk an tih.

en: But many shall be last that are first; and first that are last.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, mi tamtak, a hmasatakhai chu, a nuhnungtakah la um an ta; a nuhnungtakhai khawm a hmasatakah la um an tih.

en: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judæa in the days of Herod the king, behold, Wise-men from the east came to Jerusalem, saying,
hmr: Chun, lal Herod inlal laia, Juda rama Bethlehemah Isu a hung piengin, ngai ta, khawsak tienga inthawkin mi varhai Jerusalemah an hung a,

en: Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we saw his star in the east, and are come to worship him.
hmr: “Judahai lal hung pieng chu khâwlai am a um a? A arasi khawsak tieng kan hmuh a, ama chibai bûk dingin kan hung a nih,” an ta.

en: And when Herod the king heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
hmr: Lal Herod chun a hriet phingleh a lunginzîng tah a, Jerusalema mi po po khawm an lunginzîng ve a.

en: And gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he inquired of them where the Christ should be born.
hmr: Chuongchun, thiempu lalhai le mihai Dân inchûktirtu po po a ko khâwm a. Krista piengna ding chu ân dawn a.

en: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judæa: for thus it is written through the prophet,
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Juda rama Bethlehemah hieng ang hin zâwl- neiin a ziek kha,

en: And thou Bethlehem, land of Judah, Art in no wise least among the princes of Judah: For out of thee shall come forth a governor, Who shall be shepherd of my people Israel.
hmr: ‘Chun, nang Juda rama Bethlehem, Juda khawpuihai laiah i chîn tak naw tawp; I sûnga inthawkin awptu a hung suok ding a ni sih a, Ka mi Israelhai vêngtu ding chu,’ ti hi,” an ta.

en: Then Herod privily called the Wise-men, and learned of them exactly what time the star appeared.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Herodin mi varhai chu arûkin a ko a, arasi inlang hun chu nguntakin anni ân dawn a.

en: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search out exactly concerning the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word, that I also may come and worship him.
hmr: Anni chu Bethlehemah ân fetir tah a, “Fe unla, nautê thu chu nguntakin indawn suok ro; chun kei khawmin ama chu chibai ka hung bûk ve theina dingin, in hmu phingleh mi hung hril nâwk ro,” a ta.

en: And they, having heard the king, went their way; and lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.
hmr: Chun, lal thu chu an hriet a, an fe tah a; chun, ngai ta, khawsak tienga arasi an hmu kha nautê umna chung zâwn a tlunga a ngîr hmakhat chu an hmaah a fe pei a.

en: And when they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.
hmr: Chun, arasi chu an hmuin an hlim nasa bêk bêk a.

en: And they came into the house and saw the young child with Mary his mother; and they fell down and worshipped him; and opening their treasures they offered unto him gifts, gold and frankincense and myrrh.
hmr: In sûngah an va lût a, a nu Mari kuoma nautê chu an hmuh a, an bawkkhup a, chibai an bûk a. Chun, an ro bâwmhai an hawng a, a kuomah lâwmna — rângkachak dâm, beraw dâm, murra dâm an pêk a.

en: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.
hmr: Herod kuoma kîr nâwk lo dingin manga hrila an um leiin, lampui dangah an khuo tieng an kîr tah a.

en: Now when they were departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I tell thee: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.
hmr: Chun, an fe hnungin, ngai ta, Lalpa vântirko Josef kuomah a mangah ân lâr a, “Tho la, nautê le a nu ṭhuoi la, Aigupta ramah tlân hmang rawh, ka hril nâwk hmakhat che chu chutaka chun um zing rawh; Herodin nautê sukbo dingin a zawng ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And he arose and took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt;
hmr: Chuongchun, a tho a, azân azânin nautê le a nu a ṭhuoi a, Aiguptaah a fê tah a.

en: and was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt did I call my son.
hmr: Herod thi hmakhat chu chutaka chun a um zing a; Lalpain zâwlnei baua, “Ka naupa chu Aiguptaa inthawkin ka ko dawk a,” tia a hril kha a hung tlung theina dingin.

en: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the Wise-men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the male children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the borders thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had exactly learned of the Wise-men.
hmr: Chun, Herodin mi varhai hlêmin a um ti ân hriet phingin a lung a sen bêk bêk a, mi a tir a, a hun laitak thu mi varhai nguntaka ân dawn suo ang khan, Bethlehem le a vêl po poa pasal naupang kum hnia inthawka hnuoitieng po po chu an rêngin a that ta vawng a.

en: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying,
hmr: Chuong lai chun zâwlnei Jeremiain hieng thu a hril hi a hung tlung tah a:

en: A voice was heard in Ramah, Weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; And she would not be comforted, because they are not.
hmr: “Rama khuoah khêkri an hriet a, Ṭap dâm, mithi ngaia khêk rawng rawng dâm; Rakil chun a nauhai a ṭah a, An um ta naw leiin thlamuong thei a ni nawh,” ti hi.

en: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Herod chu a thi hnungin, ngai ta, Lalpa vântirko Aiguptaa chun Josef kuomah mangah ân lâr a,

en: Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead that sought the young child’s life.
hmr: “Tho la, nautê le a nu ṭhuoi la, Israel ramah fe rawh; nautê that tumtuhai kha an thi tah,” a ta.

en: And he arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, a tho a, nautê le a nu chu a ṭhuoi a, Israel ramah a lût tah a.

en: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judæa in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither; and being warned of God in a dream, he withdrew into the parts of Galilee,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Arkelaus a pa Herod aiawin ân lal ti a hrietin chutaka fe chu a ṭi tah a; chun, a manga hrila a um leiin Galili tieng a fe ta dai a.

en: and came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets, that he should be called a Nazarene.
hmr: Khuo pakhat Nazareth an tia chun a va um tah a: “Ama chu Nazareth mi tîng an tih,” tia zâwlnei baua an hril kha a hung tlung theina dingin.

en: For the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that was a householder, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers into his vineyard.
hmr: “Vân ram chu in neitupa, a grêp huona sinthawtuhai ruoi dinga zîngkâr inhmataka suok ang chu a ni sih a.

en: And when he had agreed with the laborers for a shilling a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, sinthawtuhai le chun ni khata dulil hlaw dinga an inrem phingleh, huona chun a tir tâwl tah a.

en: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing in the marketplace idle;
hmr: Chun, vairik lai vêlin a va suok a, mi dang dâwr hmuna ngîr mei meihai a hmuh a;

en: and to them he said, Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you. And they went their way.
hmr: an kuomah, ‘Nangni khawm grêp huonah va fe ta u, a mawi tâwk ang pei pêng ka ti cheu,’ a ta. Chuongchun, an fe tah a.

en: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.
hmr: Chun, nisa inding vêl le zân bu suong pha vêl lai chun a va suok nâwk a; chuong ang bawkin a thaw nâwk a.

en: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing; and he saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?
hmr: Chun, zântieng chun a va suok a; mi dang lo ngîrhai chu a hmu a; an kuomah, ‘Iengdinga sûnnithlâka hitaka ngîr mei mei cheu am?’ a ta.

en: They say unto him, Because no man hath hired us. He saith unto them, Go ye also into the vineyard.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, ‘Tu- khawmin an mi ruoi naw leiin,’ an ta. Ama chun an kuomah, ‘Nangni khawm grêp huonah va fe ta u,’ a ta.

en: And when even was come, the lord of the vineyard saith unto his steward, Call the laborers, and pay them their hire, beginning from the last unto the first.
hmr: “Chun, khuo a hung inhnu chun, grêp huon neitupa chun a sum en- kawltu kuomah, ‘Sinthawtuhai kha ko la, a nuhnungtaka phutin a hma- satak chenin an hlaw pe rawh,’ a ta.

en: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour, they received every man a shilling.
hmr: Chun, zântienga a iruoihai chu an hung chun duli an hmu seng a.

en: And when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise received every man a shilling.
hmr: Chun, a hmasatakhai an hung chun hmu tam deu an inring a; nisienlakhawm, anni khawm chun duli bawk an hmu seng a.

en: And when they received it, they murmured against the householder,
hmr: Chuongchun, an lâk lai chun, in neitupa chungah an chier a,

en: saying, These last have spent but one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us, who have borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat.
hmr: ‘Hieng a nuhnungtakhai hin darkâr khat chau an thawh a, keini sûn rinum le khawsa dotuhai tlukin i siem sih a,’ an ta.

en: But he answered and said to one of them, Friend, I do thee no wrong: didst not thou agree with me for a shilling?
hmr: Ama ruok chun anni laia mi pakhat kuomah, ‘Ruola, i chungah iengkhawm ka suksuol lêm; duli hlaw dingin ei inrem naw am a nih?

en: Take up that which is thine, and go thy way; it is my will to give unto this last, even as unto thee.
hmr: I ta kha la la fe el rawh; nang ka ipêk che ang bawk kha, hi a nuhnung tak kuoma khawm hin ka pêk nuom a nih.

en: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own? or is thine eye evil, because I am good?
hmr: Ka ta nâknâk chu ka nuom ang anga ka thaw a thieng naw am a nih? Annawleh, kei ka ṭhat leiin nangin i thîk am a nih?’ tîn a dawn a.

en: So the last shall be first, and the first last.
hmr: Chuongangin a nuhnungtak- hai chu a hmasatak la nîng an ta, a hmasatakhai khawm chu a nu- hnungtakhai la nîng an tih,” a ta.

en: And as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples apart, and on the way he said unto them,
hmr: Chun, Isu Jerusalema a hang fe laiin, inchûktirhai sâwm le pahni chu a tumin a ṭhuoi a, lampuia chun an kuomah,

en: Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests and scribes; and they shall condemn him to death,
hmr: “Ngai ta u, Jerusalemah ei fe ding a ni hi. Mihriem Naupa hi thiempu lalhai le Dân inchûktirtuhai kutah inmantirin a um ding a nih; chun, anni chun thi dingin a chungah thu sukthlûng an ta;

en: and shall deliver him unto the Gentiles to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify: and the third day he shall be raised up.
hmr: nuiza siemna dinga hmang ding le, vuok ding le krawsa hemde dingin Jentailhai kuomah pêng an tih; chun, ni thum niin keithoin um a tih,” a ta.

en: Then came to him the mother of the sons of Zebedee with her sons, worshipping him, and asking a certain thing of him.
hmr: Chu lai chun, Zebedai naupa- salhai nu chu, a naupahai ṭhuoiin a kuomah a hung a, chibai a bûk a, ieng amanih a hnih a.

en: And he said unto her, What wouldest thou? She saith unto him, Command that these my two sons may sit, one on thy right hand, and one on thy left hand, in thy kingdom.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Ieng am i dit a?” a ta. Ama chun a kuomah, “Hieng ka naupahai pahni hi i ramah i changtiengah pakhat, i vawitiengah pakhat an ṭhung theina dingin thu pe ta la,” a ta.

en: But Jesus answered and said, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink the cup that I am about to drink? They say unto him, We are able.
hmr: Isu ruok chun “In hni hi in hriet naw a nih, ka no dâwn ding chu in dâwn thei am a nih?” a ta, a dawn a. Annîn a kuomah, “Thei e,” an ta.

en: He saith unto them, My cup indeed ye shall drink: but to sit on my right hand, and on my left hand, is not mine to give; but it is for them for whom it hath been prepared of my Father.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Ka no chu dâwn ngei in tih; nisienlakhawm, ka changtieng le ka vawitienga ṭhung ding thu chu keia pêk ding a ni nawh a, ka Pa ibuotsaipêkhai ta ding ni lem a tih,” a ta.

en: And when the ten heard it, they were moved with indignation concerning the two brethren.
hmr: Chun, sâwm hai chun chu chu an lo hrietin unau pahni hai chunga chun an lunginsen tah a.

en: But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Ye know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
hmr: Isu ruok chun anni chu a ko a, “Jentailhai chunga rorêltuhai chu an chungah an inlal bêk bêk hlak a, an mi lienhai chun an chungah thu an nei bêk bêk hlak ti in hriet.

en: Not so shall it be among you: but whosoever would become great among you shall be your minister;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nangni laia chu chuong ang chu ni naw ni, tukhawm nangni laia mi lien ni nuom phawt chu in rawngbâwltuin a um ding a nih,

en: and whosoever would be first among you shall be your servant:
hmr: tukhawm nangni laia a hma- satak ni nuom taphawt chu in sie- hlawin a um bawk ding a nih;

en: even as the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
hmr: Mihriem Naupa hi rawng- bâwlpêka um dinga hung a ni nawh a, rawngbâwl ding le mi tamtak intlan- na dinga, a hringna pe lem dinga a hung ang hin,” a ta.

en: And as they went out from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.
hmr: Chun, Jerikoa inthawka an suok laiin mipui nasatakin ama an zui a.

en: And behold, two blind men sitting by the way side, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, saying, Lord, have mercy on us, thou son of David.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, mitdel pahni lam sîra ṭhunghai chun Isu a fe ti an hriet phingleh, “Lalpa, David Naupa, mi lunginsiet rawh,” tiin an khêk a.

en: And the multitude rebuked them, that they should hold their peace: but they cried out the more, saying, Lord, have mercy on us, thou son of David.
hmr: Chun, mipui chun to dingin an hal a; nisienlakhawm, anni chun “Lalpa, David Naupa, mi lunginsiet rawh,” tiin an khêk nâwk zuol a.

en: And Jesus stood still, and called them, and said, What will ye that I should do unto you?
hmr: Chun, Isu a ngîr a, anni a ko a, “In chungah ieng ang am ka thaw in nuom a?” a ta.

en: They say unto him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Lalpa, mit var kan nuom,” an ta.

en: And Jesus, being moved with compassion, touched their eyes; and straightway they received their sight, and followed him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isûn a lunginsiet bêk bêk a, an mit a them a; chuongchun, an hmu thei nghâl tah a, ama chu an zui tah a.

en: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and came unto Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem an tlung dinga Bethphage khuo, Oliv tlâng chu an tlung chun Isûn a închûktirhai pahni a tir a,

en: saying unto them, Go into the village that is over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.
hmr: an kuomah, “In hma zâwna khuoa sawn va fe unla, sabengtung thlung, a kâwla a tê leh hmûng in ta; sût unla, ka kuomah hung kei ro.

en: And if any one say aught unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.
hmr: Tukhawmin in kuomah, ieng- khawm an lo hril chun, ‘Lalpain a mamaw a nih,’ tîng in ta; chun, ama chun hung tîr nghâl el a tih,” a ta.

en: Now this is come to pass, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying,
hmr: Zâwlnei baua hieng thu hrila um ta kha a hung tlung theina dingin chuong chu a hung um ta a nih.

en: Tell ye the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, Meek, and riding upon an ass, And upon a colt the foal of an ass.
hmr: “ ‘En ta, i Lal chu thuhnuoirawltakin, Sabengtung chungah, sabengtungtê chunga ngeia chuongin, I kuomah a hung ding a nih,’ tiin, Zion naunu chu hril rawh,” ti hi.

en: And the disciples went, and did even as Jesus appointed them,
hmr: Chuongchun, inchûktirhai chu an va feh a, Isûn an kuoma thu a pêk ang ngeiin an thawh a,

en: and brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their garments; and he sat thereon.
hmr: sabengtung le a tê chu an hung kei a, an chunga chun puonhai an phah a, ama chun a chuongpha tah a.

en: And the most part of the multitude spread their garments in the way; and others cut branches from the trees, and spread them in the way.
hmr: Chun, mipui laia a tam lemin lampuia chun an puonhai an phah a, mi dangin thinga sâwlhna an sât a, lampuiah an pha bawk a.

en: And the multitudes that went before him, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.
hmr: Chun, mipui a hma tienga fe le a zuihai chun, “David naupa kuomah Hosanna! Lalpa hminga hung chu inpâkin um raw se! Achunghnungtaka khin, Hosanna!” tiin an khêk a.

en: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred, saying, Who is this?
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem a lût chun, a khuoin, “Hi mipa hi tu am a na?” tiin an inhnîng sup sup a.

en: And the multitudes said, This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chun, “Hi hi zâwlnei Isu, Galili rama, Nazaretha mi chu a nih,” an ta.

en: And Jesus entered into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money-changers, and the seats of them that sold the doves;
hmr: Chun, Isu Pathien biekina chun a va lût a, biekina iengkhat zawrtuhai le inchawtuhai po po chu a hnawt dawk a, tangka thlengtuhai dawkânhai le vaṭhu zawrhai ṭhung- phahai dâm chu a nam thlûkpêk a,

en: and he saith unto them, It is written, My house shall be called a house of prayer: but ye make it a den of robbers.
hmr: an kuomah, “ ‘Ka in chu ṭawngṭaina in tîng an tih,’ ti ziek a na, nangni ruok chun suomhmanghai pûkin in siem lem hlak a nih,” a ta.

en: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.
hmr: Chun, Pathien biekina chun mitdelhai le kebaihai a kuomah an hung a, anni a sukdam a.

en: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children that were crying in the temple and saying, Hosanna to the son of David; they were moved with indignation,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, thiempu lalhai le Dân inchûktirtuhai chun a thilmak thawhai le, biekina, “David naupa kuomah Hosanna” tia, naupang khêkhai chu an hmuin, an lungninaw bêk bêk a,

en: and said unto him, Hearest thou what these are saying? And Jesus saith unto them, Yea: did ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?
hmr: a kuomah, Hienghai thu hril hi i hriet am?” an ta. Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Hre e: ‘Nautêhai le nene ne laihai baua suok chun, Inpâkna i sukṭhafamkim tah,’ ti hi in tiem ngai naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: And he left them, and went forth out of the city to Bethany, and lodged there.
hmr: Chun, anni chu a mâksan a, khawpuia inthawk chun a suok a, Bethaniah a feh a; chutaka chun a riek tah a.

en: Now in the morning as he returned to the city, he hungered.
hmr: Chun, zîngkâra khawpui tienga a kîr nâwk laiin a phîng a hung ṭâm tah a.

en: And seeing a fig tree by the way side, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only; and he saith unto it, Let there be no fruit from thee henceforward for ever. And immediately the fig tree withered away.
hmr: Chun, lam sîra chun theichang kûng a hmuh a, a va pan a, a hna chau naw chu iengkhawm a hmu nawh a.

en: And when the disciples saw it, they marvelled, saying, How did the fig tree immediately wither away?
hmr: Chun, a kuomah, “Kumkhaw- tluongin lo ra ta dêr naw rawh,” a ta. Chun, theichang chu a thêm nghâl el tah a. Chun, inchûktirhai chun chu chu an hmuin, “Iengtiziea theichang hi a thêm nghâl el am a na?” tiin mak an ti hle a.

en: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do what is done to the fig tree, but even if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou taken up and cast into the sea, it shall be done.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Titak- zetin ka hril cheu hi, ringna in nei a, in ringhla naw chun, theichang chunga thaw ang chau hi thaw naw ti niu a, hi tlâng kuoma khawm hin, ‘Lo insawn la tuisuorietah lo inpei rawh,’ in ti chun, in ti ang chun lo um a tih.

en: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.
hmr: Chun, iengkim ringtaka ṭawng- ṭaia in hni taphawt chu hmûng in tih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?
hmr: Chun, Pathien biekina a lût hnunga ân chûktir lai chun, thiempu lalhai le vântlâng upahai chu a kuomah an hung a, “Tu thuin am hieng thil hi i thaw a? Tuin am thu a pêk cheh a?” an ta.

en: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I also will ask you one question, which if ye tell me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Kei khawmin thu bau khat indawn vêng ka ti cheu, chu chu in mi hril chun tu thuin am hieng thilhai hi ka thaw, hril vêng ka ti cheu.

en: The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven or from men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why then did ye not believe him?
hmr: Johan baptisma kha khâwlaia mi thu am a na? Vâna mi thu am a ni mihriem thu?” a ta, a dawn a. Chun, an inngaituoh a, “Vâna mi thu, ei ti chun, ‘Iengdinga a thu in awi naw am a na’ mi ti sîng a ta.

en: But if we shall say, From men; we fear the multitude; for all hold John as a prophet.
hmr: Chun, ‘Mihriem thu’ ei ti chun mipui chu ei ṭi sih a; mi po poin Johan chu zâwlneiin an ngai sih a,” an ta.

en: And they answered Jesus, and said, We know not. He also said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu an dawn a, “Kan hriet nawh,” an ta. Ama khawm chun an kuomah, “Kei khawmin tu thuin am hieng thil hi ka thawh a hril bîk naw ning cheu.

en: But what think ye? A man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work to-day in the vineyard.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, nangnîn ieng- tin am in ngai a? Mi tuin amanih naupasal pahni a nei a. Pakhat kuoma chun a va feh a, ‘Ka nau, vawisûn grêp huonah sin va thaw rawh,’ a ta.

en: And he answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented himself, and went.
hmr: Ama chun, ‘Ka nuom nawh,’ a ta, a dawn a; nisienlakhawm, a nakie chun a lungril ân thleng a, a fe tah a.

en: And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, I go, sir: and went not.
hmr: Chun, pakhat kuoma khawm chun a va feh a, chuong ang bawkin a va ta. Ama chun, ‘Pu, fêng ka tih’ a ta, a dawn a, nisienlakhawm, a fe ta si nawh a.

en: Which of the two did the will of his father? They say, The first. Jesus saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, that the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.
hmr: Chuonghai pahni atu lem chun am an pa dit zâwng an thawh a?” a ta. Anni chun, “A hmasa lem chun,” an ta. Isûn an kuomah, “Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, siedâwltuhai le nawchi- zawrhai chun, Pathien ramah an lût khal ding cheu a ni hi.

en: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not; but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye saw it, did not even repent yourselves afterward, that ye might believe him.
hmr: Johan chu felna kawnga chun in kuomah a hung a, ama chu in awi si nawh a; nangni chu in hmu hnung khawmin ama chu in awi theina dingin in inlet chuong si nawh a.

en: Hear another parable: There was a man that was a householder, who planted a vineyard, and set a hedge about it, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into another country.
hmr: “Tekhithu dang ngai ro, mi tu amanih in neitu a um a, ama chun grêp huon a siem a, palin ân huon vêl a, grêp sâwrna khur a cho a, in insâng a bâwl a; chun, lo enkawltuhai kuomah thlohlaw dingin a pêk a, ram dangah a fe tah a.

en: And when the season of the fruits drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, to receive his fruits.
hmr: Chun, a ra lo a hun ding chun, a ra lo dingin lo enkawltuhai kuomah a suokhai a tir a.

en: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.
hmr: Chun, lo enkawltuhai chun a suokhai chu an lo man a, pakhat an vuok a, pakhat an sukhlum a, pakhat lungin an dêng a.

en: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them in like manner.
hmr: Chun, suok dang a hmasa pâwl nêka tam lem a tir nâwk a; annihai chunga khawm an hmaa mihai an thaw ang bawkin an lo thaw nâwk a.

en: But afterward he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.
hmr: Chu hnunga ruok chun, ‘Ka naupa hi chu inza ngei an tih,’ tiin a naupa chu an kuomah a tir a.

en: But the husbandmen, when they saw the son, said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and take his inheritance.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lo enkawltuhai chun a naupa chu an lo hmu phingleh, ‘Hi mipa hi rohluotu ding chu a nih; that ei tiu a, a ro hluo ding hi nei pêk ei tiu,’ an ta.

en: And they took him, and cast him forth out of the vineyard, and killed him.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chu an man a, grêp huona inthawk chun an pei dawk a, an sukhlum tah a.

en: When therefore the lord of the vineyard shall come, what will he do unto those husbandmen?
hmr: Chuongchun, grêp huon neitupa a hung pha chun chuong lo enkawltuhai chunga chun iengtin am thaw tâng a ta le?” a ta.

en: They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those miserable men, and will let out the vineyard unto other husbandmen, who shall render him the fruits in their seasons.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Chuong mi suolhai chu rimsitakin sukbo- hmang a ta, grêp huon chu lo enkawltu dang, a lo pha poleh rahai chu a kuomah pe pei dinghai kuomah thlohlaw dingin pêng a tih,” an ta.

en: Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, The same was made the head of the corner; This was from the Lord, And it is marvellous in our eyes?
hmr: Isu chun an kuomah, “Pathien lekhaa, ‘In bâwltuhai lung dit naw kha, Chu ngei chu a kia lung ṭhangkai tak a hung ni tah. Chu chu Lalpa thaw a na, Ei mithmua hin a mak a nih,’ ti hi in tiem ngai naw am a nih?

en: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken away from you, and shall be given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.
hmr: “Chuleichun, ‘Pathien ram chu in kuoma inthawkin lâk hmang nîng a ta, ra insuo ding hnam kuomah pêk nîng a tih,’ ti ka hril cheu hi.

en: And he that falleth on this stone shall be broken to pieces: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will scatter him as dust.
hmr: Chun, chu lung chunga tlu chu kawi dar a ta; a idel lem chu râwt nawi tih” a ta.

en: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.
hmr: Chun, thiempu lalhai le Pharisaihai chun a tekhithuhai chu an hrietin, anni chungthu a hril ti an hriet tah a.

en: And when they sought to lay hold on him, they feared the multitudes, because they took him for a prophet.
hmr: Chun, ama chu man an tum a; nisienlakhawm, mipuihai chu an ṭi sih a, zâwlneiin an ruot leiin.

en: And Jesus answered and spake again in parables unto them, saying,
hmr: Chun, Isûn anni a biek a, an kuomah tekhithuin a hril nâwk a,

en: The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a certain king, who made a marriage feast for his son,
hmr: “Vân ram chu lal tu amanih, a naupa ta dinga inneina ruoiṭhena siem le chun tekhi a nih.

en: and sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the marriage feast: and they would not come.
hmr: Chun, inneina ruoiṭhe fa dinga a fielhai chu ko dingin a suokhai a tir a; nisienlakhawm, an hung nuom nawh a.

en: Again he sent forth other servants, saying, Tell them that are bidden, Behold, I have made ready my dinner; my oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready: come to the marriage feast.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, ‘Ka ifielhai kuoma khan, ngai ta u, ka ruoi chu kân zo tah; ka bâwngchalhai le ka ran châwm thauhai ka that a, iengkim inzo a ni tah, inneina ruoi fa dingin hung ta ro ti ro,’ tiin suok dang a tir nâwk a.

en: But they made light of it, and went their ways, one to his own farm, another to his merchandise;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an lo ngaisak nawh a, an fe hmang el ta a, pakhat chu loah a feh a, pakhat chu sum- dâwngnaah,

en: and the rest laid hold on his servants, and treated them shamefully, and killed them.
hmr: mi danghai chun a suokhai chu an man a, inzakumtakin an siem a, an sukhlum el tah a.

en: But the king was wroth; and he sent his armies, and destroyed those murderers, and burned their city.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chu a lunginsen tah a; a sipaihai a tir a, chuong tuolthathai chu a sukbo a, an khuo khawm a rawpêk tah a.

en: Then saith he to his servants, The wedding is ready, but they that were bidden were not worthy.
hmr: “Chun, a suokhai kuoma chun, ‘Inneina ruoi inzo a ni tah; fielhai ruok kha chu fa tlâk an ni nawh.

en: Go ye therefore unto the partings of the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage feast.
hmr: Chuongchun, lampêt ṭhuom- haiah fe unla, mi in hmu taphawt inneina ruoi fa dingin fiel ro,’ a ta.

en: And those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together all as many as they found, both bad and good: and the wedding was filled with guests.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu suokhai chu an suok a, lampuihaia chun an va feh a, an hmu taphawt, mi suol le mi ṭhahai khawm an ṭhuoi khâwm ta vawng a; chuongchun, inneina ruoi pindan chu mi fiel haiin an lo sip tah a.

en: But when the king came in to behold the guests, he saw there a man who had not on a wedding-garment:
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, lal chu mi fielhai en dinga a hung lût chun, inneina puon sil lo mi pakhat chutaka chun a hmuh a.

en: and he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding-garment? And he was speechless.
hmr: Chuongchun, a kuomah, ‘Ruola, iengtizie am a na, inneina puon boin hitaka hin i hung lût el a?’ a ta. Chun, ama chu a to zing a.

en: Then the king said to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and cast him out into the outer darkness; there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a suokhai kuomah, ‘A kut le a ke khuop unla, tuol tieng inthimah pei dawk ro, chutaka chun ṭap le harâwt chu um a tih,’” a ta.

en: For many are called, but few chosen.
hmr: “Fielhai chu tamtak an na, thlang hai ruok chu tlâwmte an nih” a ta.

en: Then went the Pharisees, and took counsel how they might ensnare him in his talk.
hmr: Chu lai chun, Pharisaihai chun a thu hrila an man theina zie ding an vân râwn a,

en: And they send to him their disciples, with the Herodians, saying, Teacher, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, and carest not for any one: for thou regardest not the person of men.
hmr: Chun, an inchûktirhai, Herod pâwla mihai leh an tir a; chuonghai chun, “Inchûktirtu, mi indiktak i na, titakzetin Pathien thu kawng în chûktir hlak a, pawisak bîk tukhawm i nei nawh ti kan hriet a; tukhawm thlierbîk i nei si nawh a.

en: Tell us therefore, What thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Cæsar, or not?
hmr: Chuongchun, ieng angin am i ngai a? mi hril raw khai! Kaisar kuomah sie chawi hi a thieng am, a thieng naw?” an ta.

en: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, Why make ye trial of me, ye hypocrites?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn an suolzie chu a lo hriet a, “Vervêkhai, ieng dinga in mi fie?

en: Show me the tribute money. And they brought unto him a denarius.
hmr: Sie tangka chu mîn entir ro,” a ta. Chun, a kuomah duli an hung lâk a.

en: And he saith unto them, Whose is this image and superscription?
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Hi hi tu lim le tu hming am a na?” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “Kaisar,” an ta.

en: They say unto him, Cæsar’s. Then saith he unto them, Render therefore unto Cæsar the things that are Cæsar’s; and unto God the things that are God’s.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “A ni sa chun, Kaisar thilhai chu Kaisar kuomah pe unla, Pathien thilhai chu Pathien kuomah pe ta unla,” a ta.

en: And when they heard it, they marvelled, and left him, and went away.
hmr: Chuong thu chu an hrietin mak an ti hle a, ama an mâksan a, an fe ta dai a.

en: On that day there came to him Sadducees, they that say that there is no resurrection: and they asked him,
hmr: Chu ni ma chun, Saddukaihai, thonâwkna a um nawh tituhai chu a kuomah an hung a,

en: saying, Teacher, Moses said, If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
hmr: a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, Mosie- in, ‘Mi nau nei loa a thi chun, a unaupain a nuhmei chu neiin, a unaupa ta dingin chi a thlapêk ding a nih,’ a ta.

en: Now there were with us seven brethren: and the first married and deceased, and having no seed left his wife unto his brother;
hmr: Âwle, keini lai sal sari an um a; a upa takin nuhmei a nei a, a thi a; chun, suon a nei naw leiin a nuhmei chu a unaupa ihluo dingin a mâksan a;

en: in like manner the second also, and the third, unto the seventh.
hmr: chuongang bawkin a pahnina leh, a pathumna leh, a pasarina chenin an hluo seng a.

en: And after them all, the woman died.
hmr: Chun, an rênga an thi hnung chun nuhmei khawm chu a thi tah a.

en: In the resurrection therefore whose wife shall she be of the seven? for they all had her.
hmr: Chuongchun, thonâwk pha chun pasarihai lai chun atu nuhmei tak am nîng a ta? an rêngin an nei sih a,” tiin an indawn a.

en: But Jesus answered and said unto them, Ye do err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God.
hmr: Isûn a dawn a, an kuomah, “Pathien Lekha thu le, Pathien thil- thawtheina in hriet naw leiin in ngai suol hlak a nih.

en: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as angels in heaven.
hmr: Thonâwknaah nuhmei pasal innei ta naw ni hai a, vâna vântir- kohai ang an ni ta lem ding a nih in sawnnaw.

en: But as touching the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,
hmr: Chun, mithi thonâwkna thua Pathienin in kâwla hienga a hril kha in tiem naw am a nih?

en: I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.
hmr: ‘Kei Abraham Pathien, Isak Pathien, Jakob Pathien ka nih,’ tiin Pathien chu mithi Pathien a ni nawh a, mi hring Pathien a ni lem,” a ta.

en: And when the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chun chu chu an hrietin, a thu inchûktir chu mak an ti hle a.

en: But the Pharisees, when they heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, gathered themselves together.
hmr: Pharisaihai ruok chun, Isûn Saddukaihai a sêldawng ti an hrietin an inkhâwm tah a.

en: And one of them, a lawyer, asked him a question, trying him:
hmr: Chun, anni laia mi pakhat dânhretu hin ama fiena dingin,

en: Teacher, which is the great commandment in the law?
hmr: “Inchûktirtu, Dân thua chun ieng thupêk am a ropuitak a?” tiin ân dawn a.

en: And he said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “ ‘Lalpa I Pathien chu I lungvar po poin, i thlarau po poin, i lungril po poin i hmangai ding a nih,’ ti hi.

en: This is the great and first commandment.
hmr: Chu chu thupêk ropui le pawimaw tak a nih.

en: And a second like unto it is this, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
hmr: Chun, a dawttu, a în angpui chu hi hi a nih, ‘Nangma în hmangai angin i vênghai khawm i hmangai ding a nih,’ ti hi.

en: On these two commandments the whole law hangeth, and the prophets.
hmr: Hieng thupêk pahnia hin Dân thu le zâwlneihai thu po po ân khaikhâwm vawng a nih,” a ta.

en: Now while the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question,
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai chu an inkhâwm lai chun, Isûn anni chu thu ân dawn a,

en: saying, What think ye of the Christ? whose son is he? They say unto him, The son of David.
hmr: “Krista chu ieng angin am in ngai a, tu naupa am a na?” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “David naupa,” an ta.

en: He saith unto them, How then doth David in the Spirit call him Lord, saying,
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Ieng- tiziein am David chun Thlarauin ‘Lalpa’ tiin,

en: The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, Till I put thine enemies underneath thy feet?
hmr: ‘Lalpa chun ka Lalpa kuomah, Ka chang tieng ṭhung rawh; I hmêlmahai i kepha hnuoia ka sie hmakhat chu,’ a tih a? a ta.

en: If David then calleth him Lord, how is he his son?
hmr: “David chun ama chu, ‘Lalpa,’ a ti si chun iengtin am a naupa ni thei a ta?” a ta.

en: And no one was able to answer him a word, neither durst any man from that day forth ask him any more questions.
hmr: Chun, tukhawmin bau khat khawma an dawn thei ta nawh a; chu ni chena inthawk chu tukhawmin thu dang hrim hrim khawma an indawn ngam ta nawh.

en: Then spake Jesus to the multitudes and to his disciples,
hmr: Chun, Isûn mipuihai le a inchûktirhai kuomah thu a hril a,

en: saying, The scribes and the Pharisees sit on Moses’ seat:
hmr: “Dân inchûktirtuhai le Pharisai- hai chu Mosie ṭhungphaah an ṭhung hlak.

en: all things therefore whatsoever they bid you, these do and observe: but do not ye after their works; for they say, and do not.
hmr: Chuleichun, thaw dinga an hril taphawt cheu chu zâwm unla, thaw pei ro, an thilthaw ang ruok chu thaw ve naw ro, hril chu an hril hlak a, an thaw ngai si nawh a.

en: Yea, they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves will not move them with their finger.
hmr: Phurrik rinumtakhai an siem a, mihai an hnâwk hlak a; anni ruok chun an kutpâr khawmin an tâwk nuom nawh.

en: But all their works they do to be seen of men: for they make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge the borders of their garments,
hmr: An thilthaw po po chun mihriem hmu dingin a nih an thaw lem hlak; an iengkhat bunhai le khumhai chu an suklien a, an puon hmawrkai an sukbuk hlak a;

en: and love the chief place at feasts, and the chief seats in the synagogues,
hmr: ruoiṭhenaah hmun ṭhatakhai, in- khâwmna inah ṭhungpha ṭhatakhai,

en: and the salutations in the marketplaces, and to be called of men, Rabbi.
hmr: dâwr hmuna chibai bûkhai, mihaiin, ‘Rabbi’ an itihai an ngaina hlak sih a.

en: But be not ye called Rabbi: for one is your teacher, and all ye are brethren.
hmr: “Nangni ruok chu, ‘Rabbi’, tia koin um naw ro; in inchûktirtu chu pakhat chau a nih; nangni po po chu unau in ni sih a.

en: And call no man your father on the earth: for one is your Father, even he who is in heaven.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi chunga hin tu- khawm, ‘Pa,’ ti naw ro; in Pa chu pakhat chau a nih, vâna mi khi.

en: Neither be ye called masters: for one is your master, even the Christ.
hmr: ‘ṭhuoituhai’ tia ko khawmin um naw ro; in ṭhuoitu chu pakhat chau a nih, Krista chu.

en: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.
hmr: In laia ropuitak chu in rawngbâwltu a um lem ding a nih.

en: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be humbled; and whosoever shall humble himself shall be exalted.
hmr: Tukhawm ân ngaihlu phawt chu tlâwm a ta, tukhawm ân ngaitlâwm phawt chu chawimawiin um a tih.

en: But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye shut the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye enter not in yourselves, neither suffer ye them that are entering in to enter.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, nangni Dân inchûktirtu le Pharisai vervêkhai, in chung a rik; vân ram lampui chu mihai in khâr pêk sih a; nangni hlak in lût si nawh a, mi a lût dinghai khawm in inlûttir phal ngai si nawh a.
[Nangni Dân inchûktirtu le Pharisai vervêkhai, in chung a rik! Hmeithaihai sum in fâk zo a, mi hlêmna dingin sâwttak tak in ṭawng- ṭai a; chuleiin, thiemnaw changna nasa nâwkzuol hmûng in tih.]

en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he is become so, ye make him twofold more a son of hell than yourselves.
hmr: Nangni Dân inchûktirtu le Pharisai vervêkhai in chung a rik; Saphun pakhat khawm siem dingin tuisuoriet le khawmuol in fe huol sih a, chun, chuong anga a hung um phaleh ama chu nangni lethni rauin Hremhmun naupaah in siem hlak.

en: Woe unto you, ye blind guides, that say, Whosoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, he is a debtor.
hmr: “Nangni ṭhuoitu mitdel, ‘Tukhawm Pathien biekin sâla inkhâm po chu iengkhawm a ni nawh; tukhawm Pathien biekina râng- kachak sâla inkhâm po chun hlen ding a nih,’ tituhai, in chung a rik!

en: Ye fools and blind: for which is greater, the gold, or the temple that hath sanctified the gold?
hmr: Nangni mi invêt, mitdelhai, a ieng am a ropui lem a, rângkachak am, Pathien biekin rângkachak sukthiengtu chu?

en: And, Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gift that is upon it, he is a debtor.
hmr: Chun, ‘Tukhawm mâichâm sâla inkhâm po chu iengkhawm a ni nawh, a chunga thilpêk sâla inkhâm po ruok chun hlen ding a nih,’ in ta.

en: Ye blind: for which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifieth the gift?
hmr: Nangni mitdelhai! A ieng am a ropui lem a, thilpêk am, mâichâm thilpêk sukthiengtu chu?

en: He therefore that sweareth by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.
hmr: Chuongchun, tukhawm mâi- châm sâla inkhâm taphawt chun mâichâm le a chunga um po po sâlin ân khâm hlak.

en: And he that sweareth by the temple, sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.
hmr: Tukhawm Pathien biekin sâla inkhâm taphawt chun, Pathien biekin le a sûnga um chu sâlin ân khâm hlak.

en: And he that sweareth by the heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.
hmr: Tukhawm vân sâla inkhâm taphawt chun Pathien ṭhungpha le a chunga ṭhung chu sâlin ân khâm hlak a nih.

en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye tithe mint and anise and cummin, and have left undone the weightier matters of the law, justice, and mercy, and faith: but these ye ought to have done, and not to have left the other undone.
hmr: “Nangni Dân inchûktirtu le Pharisai vervêkhai, in chung a rik! pudina dâm, mohuri dâm, zira dâm chu sâwma pakhat in pêk hlak a, dân thu pawimaw lem felna dâm, lunginsietna dâm, ringumna dâm chu in ngaitha si hlak; nisienlakhawm, chuong chu a nih in sawnnaw in thaw ding chu, a danghai chu thaw ṭhul chuong loin.

en: Ye blind guides, that strain out the gnat, and swallow the camel!
hmr: Nangni ṭhuoitu mitdel, thosi thlitfaia sanghâwngsei lem si hlak- hai!

en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full from extortion and excess.
hmr: “Dân inchûktirtu le Pharisai vervêkhai, in chung a rik! no le thlêng puo tieng in sâwp fai a, a sûng ruok chu hlêprûkna le insûm nawnain a sip sih a.

en: Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first the inside of the cup and of the platter, that the outside thereof may become clean also.
hmr: Nang Pharisai mitdel, no le thlêng sûng tieng chu sâwp fai hmasa rawh, a puo tieng khawm a hung fai theina dingin.”

en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres, which outwardly appear beautiful, but inwardly are full of dead men’s bones, and of all uncleanness.
hmr: “Dân inchûktirtu le Pharisai vervêkhai, in chung a rik! Thlân nâl vâr, puo tienga mawitaka inlang, a sûng tieng ruok chu mithi ruhai le hmunhnawk tinrênga siphai ang chu in nih in sawnnaw.

en: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but inwardly ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.
hmr: Nangni khawm chuong ang takin puo tieng chun, mihriem mit- hmua chun feltakin in inlang hlak, in sûng tienga ruok chun vervêkna le suolnain in sip sih a.

en: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and garnish the tombs of the righteous,
hmr: “Nangni Dân inchûktirtu le Pharisai vervêkhai, in chung a rik! zâwlnei thlân inhai in bâwl a, mi fel thlânhai khawm in cheimawi a,

en: and say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we should not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.
hmr: ‘Ei puhai dam lai khan lo um ve inla khawm, zâwlneihai thisen an insuonaa chun ṭhang ve nâwm ei nih,’ in ti hlak a.

en: Wherefore ye witness to yourselves, that ye are sons of them that slew the prophets.
hmr: Chuongchun, zâwlneihai that- tuhai nau in nih ti in inhriettir a nih.

en: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers.
hmr: In puhai inkhîna chu suksip nghâl nghâl ro.

en: Ye serpents, ye offspring of vipers, how shall ye escape the judgment of hell?
hmr: Rûlhai, rûl thlahai, Hremhmun rorêlna chu iengtin am pumpel thei in ta?

en: Therefore, behold, I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: some of them shall ye kill and crucify; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city:
hmr: “Ngai ta u, chuleichun, in kuomah zâwlneihai, mi varhai, inchûktirtuhai, ka hung tir ding a nih; ṭhenkhat sukhlum in ta, krawsah hemdêng in tih, ṭhenkhat inkhâwmna inhaiah savun hruiin vuong in ta, khaw tinah suknawmna zui pei in tih.

en: that upon you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of Abel the righteous unto the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom ye slew between the sanctuary and the altar.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abel mi feltak thisena inthawkin Pathien biekin le mâichâm inkâra Baraki naupa Zakari in ithat a thisen chen khan, hnuoi chunga mi fel thisen an insuo po po chu nangni chungah la hung tlung thei a tih.

en: Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, chuong po po chu tulai ruoltharhai chunga hin la tlung a tih.

en: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that killeth the prophets, and stoneth them that are sent unto her! how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, and ye would not!
hmr: “Aw Jerusalem, Jerusalem! zâwlneihai thattu, i kuoma an hung tirhai lunga lo dêng hlumtu, ârpuiin a têhai a thla hnuoia a awp khâwm angin, i nauhai vawi iengzât am awp khâwm ka tum a! Nisienlakhawm, in nuom si nawh.

en: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.
hmr: En ta u, in in chu a ruoka mâksan cheuin a um tah.

en: For I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.
hmr: Ka hril cheu hi, ‘Lalpa hminga hung chu inpâkin um raw se,’ in ti hmakhat chun tuta hnung in mi hmu nâwk ta naw ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And Jesus went out from the temple, and was going on his way; and his disciples came to him to show him the buildings of the temple.
hmr: Chun, Isu Pathien biekina inthawk chun a suok a, a fe ding a na.

en: But he answered and said unto them, See ye not all these things? verily I say unto you, There shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.
hmr: Chun, a inchûktirhai chu Pathien biekinhai inentir dingin a kuomah an hung a. Ama ruok chun, an kuomah, “Hieng po po hi in hmu maw? Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, sukchim loa lung inthuo hrim hrim hitaka hin um naw ni,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And as he sat on the mount of Olives, the disciples came unto him privately, saying, Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign of thy coming, and of the end of the world?
hmr: Chun, Oliv tlânga a ṭhung laiin inchûktirhai chu anni khâtin a kuomah an hung a. “Chuong chu iengtik am hung um a ta? I hung nâwkna le khawvêl tâwpna inchikna chu ieng am nîng a ta? mi hril rawh,” an ta.

en: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Take heed that no man lead you astray.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a dawn a, an kuomah, “Tukhawmin an hlêm nawna ding cheuin fîmkhur ro.

en: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am the Christ; and shall lead many astray.
hmr: Mi tamtakin, ‘Krista chu ka nih,’ tiin keia hming sâlin hung an ta, mi tamtak an hlêm ding a ni sih a.

en: And ye shall hear of wars and rumors of wars; see that ye be not troubled: for these things must needs come to pass; but the end is not yet.
hmr: Chun, indo thu le indo thuthang la hrieng in ta; in lunginzîng nawna dingin fîmkhur ro; chuong chu a hung tlung ding hrim a nih; nisien- lakhawm, tâwpna chu la ni hri naw nih.

en: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there shall be famines and earthquakes in divers places.
hmr: Hnam tum le hnam tum indo an ta, ram tum le ram tum indo an ta; hmun tum tumah ṭâmhai tlâng a ta, simkhawleihnuoihai inhnîng a tih.

en: But all these things are the beginning of travail.
hmr: Chuong po po chu nauhase phutna a nih.

en: Then shall they deliver you up unto tribulation, and shall kill you: and ye shall be hated of all the nations for my name’s sake.
hmr: “Chu phâ chun rinum tuor dingin inmantir an ti cheu a, sukhlum an ti cheu a; ka hming leiin hnam po po theida nîng in tih.

en: And then shall many stumble, and shall deliver up one another, and shall hate one another.
hmr: Chu phâ chun mi tamtak tlûng an ta, inmantir tuo tâwl an ta; intheida tuo tâwl an tih.

en: And many false prophets shall arise, and shall lead many astray.
hmr: Zâwlnei tehlêm tamtak khawm hung suok an ta, mi tamtak hlêm an tih.

en: And because iniquity shall be multiplied, the love of the many shall wax cold.
hmr: Chun, suol a la pung ding a ni leiin mi tam lem hmangaina chu la dei a tih.

en: But he that endureth to the end, the same shall be saved.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a tâwpna chena tuor pei taphawt chu, chu ngei chu sandamin um a tih.

en: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole world for a testimony unto all the nations; and then shall the end come.
hmr: “Chun, hi Ram Chanchin Ṭha hi hnam po poin an hrietna dingin khawvêl po poah hrilin um a tih; chu zoa chun tâwpna chu la tlung a tih.

en: When therefore ye see the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let him that readeth understand),
hmr: “Chuongchun, sukrêmtu tirdak- um, zâwlnei Daniel ihril kha hmun inthienga ngîra in hmu phâ chun (a tiem taphawt chun a umzie hre raw se),

en: then let them that are in Judæa flee unto the mountains:
hmr: Juda rama umhai chu tlânga dâm tlân hmang raw hai se;

en: let him that is on the housetop not go down to take out the things that are in his house:
hmr: in chunga um chu a ina thilhai inchû dingin ṭum naw raw se;

en: and let him that is in the field not return back to take his cloak.
hmr: chun, loa um chu a puon inchû dingin kîr nâwk naw raw se;

en: But woe unto them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days!
hmr: Chuong nia chun inrâihai le nautesen pawmhai chung chu rik a tih!

en: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on a sabbath:
hmr: Chun, in tlân hmang ding hun chu thlasik amanih, châwlni amania a hung tlung nawna dingin ṭawngṭai ro;

en: for then shall be great tribulation, such as hath not been from the beginning of the world until now, no, nor ever shall be.
hmr: chu phâ chun rinumna nasatak a um ding a ni sih a; chuong ang hrim hrima nasa chu leihnuoi insieng tira inthawkin tu chen hin a la um ngai nawh a, um khawm iengtika khawm um nâwk ta bawk naw ni.

en: And except those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved: but for the elect’s sake those days shall be shortened.
hmr: Chun, chuong nihai chu suk- tâwi ni naw sien chu mihriem hrim hrim damin suok naw ni hai; nisienlakhawm, thlanghai lei chun chuong nihai chu suktâwi nîng a tih.

en: Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here is the Christ, or, Here; believe it not.
hmr: “Chu phâ chun, tukhawmin in kuomah, ‘En ta, Krista chu hitaka hi a um,’ amanih, ‘Hiva hi,’ amanih an ti chun awi naw ro;

en: For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall show great signs and wonders; so as to lead astray, if possible, even the elect.
hmr: Krista tehlêm le zâwlnei te- hlêmhai an hung suok ding a ni sih a; thei hai sien la chu, thlanghai rau khawm an hlêm theina dingin inchik- na le thilmak ropuitakhai thâwng an tih.

en: Behold, I have told you beforehand.
hmr: Ngai ta u, ka hril lâwk ta cheu hi.

en: If therefore they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the wilderness; go not forth: Behold, he is in the inner chambers; believe it not.
hmr: Chuongchun, in kuomah, ‘Ngai ta u, thlalêrah a um,’ an ti cheu chun fe suok naw ro, ‘Pindan sûngrilah a um,’ an ti cheu chun awi nuom naw ro.

en: For as the lightning cometh forth from the east, and is seen even unto the west; so shall be the coming of the Son of man.
hmr: Kâwl saktieng a hung inlep a, thlangtieng chen khawmin ân lang hlak. Mihriem Naupa hung nâwkna chu chuong ang chu a ni ding a ni sih a.

en: Wheresoever the carcase is, there will the eagles be gathered together.
hmr: Khâwlaia khawm saruong umna taphawta chun mulukawlhai khawm um khâwm an tih.

en: But immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, chuong ni rinum zo phingle chun, nisa inthimin um a ta, thla var ta naw nih a, vâna arasihai hung tlâng an ta, vân thilthawtheinahai chu sukhnîngin um a tih.

en: and then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
hmr: Chu phâ chun Mihriem Naupa inchikna chu vânah inlang a ta, chun, hnuoia um chi tinin an âwmhai chum an ta, Mihriem Naupa hi thil- thawtheina le ropuina nasatak leh vân sûm chunga hung hmûng an tih.

en: And he shall send forth his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
hmr: Chun, a vântirkohai chu taw- tawrâwt ri nasatak leh tir suok a tih. Anni chun a ithlanghai chu kâwl kil lia inthawkin, vân tâwpa inthawka a tâwp khing tieng chenin lâwr khâwm an tih.

en: Now from the fig tree learn her parable: when her branch is now become tender, and putteth forth its leaves, ye know that the summer is nigh;
hmr: “Chuongchun, theichang kûnga hin chu tekhithu chu inchûk ro. A kâu a hung indâwn a, a hna a hung inder chun, nipui a ni ding a nih ti in hriet.

en: even so ye also, when ye see all these things, know ye that he is nigh, even at the doors.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin nangni khawmin chuong po po chu in hmu phâ chun, ama chu a hung hnai tah a, kawtkhâr bulah a um ti hre ro.

en: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all these things be accomplished.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, chuong po po chu a tlung kim hmakhat chu tulai ruoltharhai hi bo naw ni hai.

en: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.
hmr: Hnuoi le vân bo a ta, ka thu ruok chu bo naw ni.

en: But of that day and hour knoweth no one, not even the angels of heaven, neither the Son, but the Father only.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, chu ni le a phâ thu chu Pa chau naw chun, tukhawmin, vâna vântirkohai khawmin, Naupa khawmin an hriet nawh.

en: And as were the days of Noah, so shall be the coming of the Son of man.
hmr: Chun, Noa damlai ang bawk khan Mihriem Naupa hung nâwkna chu nîng a tih.

en: For as in those days which were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark,
hmr: Chuong ni tuilêt hmahai chun, Noa lawnga a lût ni chenin an fâkin an dâwn a, nuhmei pasal an innei hlak;

en: and they knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall be the coming of the Son of man.
hmr: tui a hung lêt a, an rênga a lâk hmang vawng hmakhat chu ieng- khawm an hriet nawh a; Mihriem Naupa hung nâwkna chu chuong ang bawk chu nîng a tih.

en: Then shall two men be in the field; one is taken, and one is left:
hmr: Chu phâ chun, loah mi pahni um an ta, pakhat chu fe hmangpuiin um a ta; pakhat chu mâksanin um a tih.

en: two women shall be grinding at the mill; one is taken, and one is left.
hmr: Nuhmei pahni bu râwtnawina chun bu râwtnawiin um an ta, pakhat chu fe hmangpuiin um a ta; pakhat chu mâksanin um a tih.

en: Watch therefore: for ye know not on what day your Lord cometh.
hmr: Chuongchun, ngaiven ro, ieng ni am in Lalpa a hung ding in hriet si nawh a.

en: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch the thief was coming, he would have watched, and would not have suffered his house to be broken through.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, hi hi hre ro, inru a hung ding pha in neituin hre sienla vêng a ta, a in inverpawptir naw ni.

en: Therefore be ye also ready; for in an hour that ye think not the Son of man cometh.
hmr: Chuleiin, nangni khawm inring zingin um ro, in ring naw hunah Mihriem Naupa a hung din g a ni sih a.

en: Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath set over his household, to give them their food in due season?
hmr: “Suok ringum vartak, a puin a hun po leh an bu chan ding sem pêk dinga a sûnghai chunga hotua a siem chu tu tak am nîng a ta le?

en: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.
hmr: A pu a hung phâleh suok chuong anga thawa a hung hmu ding chu a hamṭha.

en: Verily I say unto you, that he will set him over all that he hath.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, a inei po po chungah hotûn siem a tih.

en: But if that evil servant shall say in his heart, My lord tarrieth;
hmr: Amiruokchu, suok suol chun a lungrilin, ‘Ka pu a hung vak naw ding a nih,’ tiin,

en: and shall begin to beat his fellow-servants, and shall eat and drink with the drunken;
hmr: a suok chanpuihai lo vaw ta sienla, mi inruihai kuomah fain dâwn sienla,

en: the lord of that servant shall come in a day when he expecteth not, and in an hour when he knoweth not,
hmr: chu suok pu chu a ring naw niah, a hriet naw laiin hung a ta,

en: and shall cut him asunder, and appoint his portion with the hypocrites: there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
hmr: tum hni hung insuong a ta, mi vervêkhai chan ang hung inchangtir a tih; chutaka chun ṭap le harâwt chu um a tih.

en: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.
hmr: “Chu pha chun, vân ram chu nunghâk inthieng sâwm, an khâwnvar chawia, mo neitu tuok dinga suokhai le chun, tekhi ni tâng a tih.

en: And five of them were foolish, and five were wise.
hmr: Anni lai chun panga an var a, panga an invêt a.

en: For the foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them:
hmr: Ân vêthai chun an khâwnvarhai an chawiin a tui an chawisa si nawh a.

en: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
hmr: A varhai ruok chun an khâwn- vartui bûrhaiah a tui thunin, khâwn- varhai leh an chawi a.

en: Now while the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.
hmr: Chun, mo neitu chu a hung intak leiin, an rêngin an lo inlusuh a, an lo in tah a.

en: But at midnight there is a cry, Behold, the bridegroom! Come ye forth to meet him.
hmr: Chun, zân rila chun, ‘Ngai ta u, mo neitu chu a hung ie! a tuok dingin hung suok ro khai,’ tiin khêkri a hung um tah a.

en: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.
hmr: Chu phingle chun nunghâk inthienghai chu an tho vawng a, an khâwnvarhai chu an siemrêl a.

en: And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are going out.
hmr: Chun, ân vêthai chun a varhai kuomah, ‘In khâwnvartui kha mi pe ro, kan khâwnvarhai a thi ding a nih,’ an ta.

en: But the wise answered, saying, Peradventure there will not be enough for us and you: go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.
