hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a varhai chun, ‘Keini le nangni ta dingin indai naw ni; a zawrtuhai kuomah fe unla, inchaw lem ro,’ tiin an dawn a.

en: And while they went away to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage feast: and the door was shut.
hmr: Chun, inchaw dinga an fe hmang kâr chun, mo neitu chu a hung tlung tah a; chuongchun, ân zohai chu ama le chun inneina ruoi fa dingin an lût a; chun, kawt chu an khâr tah a.

en: Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun, nunghâk inthieng danghai khawm chu an hung tlung a, ‘Pu, pu, mi hawngpêk rawh,’ an ta.

en: But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, ‘Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, ka hriet naw cheu a nih,’ a ta, a dawn a.

en: Watch therefore, for ye know not the day nor the hour.
hmr: Chuongchun, ngaiven ro, a ni le a hun chu in hriet si nawh a.

en: For it is as when a man, going into another country, called his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods.
hmr: “Vân ram chu mi ram danga fe tâwma, ama suokhai koa, a sumhai an kuoma inkawltir ang chu a ni sih a.

en: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his several ability; and he went on his journey.
hmr: Suok pakhat kuomah talent nga a pêk a, suok dang kuomah talent hni, suok dang kuomah talent khat: an thaw thei tâwk ding ang sengin a pêk a; chuongchun, a fe tah a.

en: Straightway he that received the five talents went and traded with them, and made other five talents.
hmr: Chun, talent nga dawngtu chu chuonghai chun a va sumdâwng nghâl tah a, talent nga dang a sukdawk tah a.

en: In like manner he also that received the two gained other two.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin talent hni dawngtu khawm chun talent hni dang a sukdawk tah a.

en: But he that received the one went away and digged in the earth, and hid his lord’s money.
hmr: Talent khat dawngtu ruok chu a va feh a, hnuoi a cho a, a pu tangka chu a thup hmang ta lem a.

en: Now after a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and maketh a reckoning with them.
hmr: “Chun, sâwttak hnungah chuong suokhai pu chu a hung a, an kuomah a sum chanchin a sukfel a.

en: And he that received the five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: lo, I have gained other five talents.
hmr: Chuongchun, talent nga dawng- tu chu a hung a, talent nga dang a hung chawi a, ‘Pu, nangin talent nga i mîn kawltir kha en ta, talent nga dang ka sukdawk,’ a ta.

en: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things; enter thou into the joy of thy lord.
hmr: A pu chun a kuomah, ‘Suok ṭha le ringum, i thaw ṭha ie! tlâwmte chungah ring i um a, tamtak chungah inumtir ka ti che, i pu lâwmnaah lût rawh,’ a ta.

en: And he also that received the two talents came and said, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: lo, I have gained other two talents.
hmr: Chun, talent hni dawngtu khawm chu a hung a, ‘Pu, nangin talent hni i mîn kawltir kha, en ta, talent hni dang ka sukdawk,’ a ta.

en: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things; enter thou into the joy of thy lord.
hmr: A pu chun a kuomah, ‘Suok ṭha le ringum, i thaw ṭha ie! tlâwmte chungah ring i um a, tamtak chungah inumtir ka ti che; i pu lâwmnaah lût rawh,’ a ta.

en: And he also that had received the one talent came and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art a hard man, reaping where thou didst not sow, and gathering where thou didst not scatter;
hmr: “Chun, talent khat kawltu khawm chu a hung a, ‘Pu, mi ti kher kher i nih ti ka hriet che; i tu nawnaa khawm i sîk hlak a, i the dar nawnaa khawm în khâwm hlak a nih;

en: and I was afraid, and went away and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, thou hast thine own.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka ṭi a, ka fe a, i talent kha hnuoiah ka thup hmang a, en ta, i ta ngai kha i hmu nâwk hi,’ a ta.

en: But his lord answered and said unto him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I did not scatter;
hmr: A pu chun a kuomah, ‘Suok suol le zawmthawpa, ka itu nawnaa khawm ka sîka, ka the dar nawnaa khawm kân khâwm ti i hriet maw?

en: thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back mine own with interest.
hmr: Chuong a ni sa chun, ka tangka chu sumdâwngtuhai kuomah lo sie ding i ni ta an nâwm; chuongchun, ka hung nâwk hin ka ta hi a pung leh ka hmu nâwk ding a nih.

en: Take ye away therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him that hath the ten talents.
hmr: Chuongchun, a talent khat kha lâkpêk unla, talent sâwm neitu kuomah pe ro.

en: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not, even that which he hath shall be taken away.
hmr: Tukhawm a nei taphawt chu pe sâng an ta, chuongchun, hau a tih, tukhawm, a nei naw phawt chu a nei sun khawm chu lâkpêk an tih.

en: And cast ye out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness: there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
hmr: Chun, suok ṭhahnem naw kha tuol tieng inthima chun pei dawk ro; chutaka chun ṭap le harâwt chu um a tih,’ a ta, a dawn a.

en: But when the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the angels with him, then shall he sit on the throne of his glory:
hmr: “Mihriem naupa ruok chu a vântirkohai po po leh a ropuinaa inthuoma a hung phâ chun, a ropuina ṭhungphaah ṭhung a ta;

en: and before him shall be gathered all the nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as the shepherd separateth the sheep from the goats;
hmr: a hmaa chun hnam tin in- khâwm an tih; berâm chingtuin kêl laia a berâmhai a ṭhe angin anni rawi chu ṭhêng a ta;

en: and he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.
hmr: berâmhai chu a changtieng sieng a ta, kêlhai ruok chu a vawi tieng sieng a tih.

en: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:
hmr: “Chu phâ chun, Laltak chun a changtienga mihai kuomah, ‘Ka Pa vochuomhai, hung unla, khawvêl siem tîra inthawka, in ta dinga ram buotsai chu chang ro;

en: for I was hungry, and ye gave me to eat; I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink; I was a stranger, and ye took me in;
hmr: ka phîng a ṭâmin nangnîn fâk ding in mi pêk a, ka dang a chârin dâwn ding in mi pêk a; mikhuol ka niin in mîn tlung tir a;

en: naked, and ye clothed me; I was sick, and ye visited me; I was in prison, and ye came unto me.
hmr: saruok ka niin puon in mîn siltir a; ka damnawh a, in mi kan a, intâng inah ka umin in hung sih a,’ la tîng a tih.

en: Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee hungry, and fed thee? or athirst, and gave thee drink?
hmr: “Chu phâ chun, mi felhai chun, ‘Lalpa, iengtik âm phîngṭâmin kan hmu che a, fâk ding kan pêk che? dangchârin kan hmu chea dâwn ding kan pêk che?

en: And when saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed thee?
hmr: Iengtik âm mikhuolin kan hmu che a kan intlungtir che? saruokin kan hmu chea puon kan insiltir che?

en: And when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?
hmr: Iengtik âm damnawin amanih, intâng ina manih kan hmu chea i kuomah kan hung?’ tiin la dawn an tih.

en: And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it unto one of these my brethren, even these least, ye did it unto me.
hmr: Chun, Laltak chun an kuomah, ‘Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hieng ka unau chîntakhai laia mi pakhat chunga in thaw chu, ka chunga thaw in nih,’ tîn la dawn a tih.”

en: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels:
hmr: “Chu zoa chun a vawitienga mihai kuoma khawm chun, ‘ṭawng- sephurhai, kumkhuo mei diebol le a tirkohai ta dinga an buotsaia chun mi fe hmangsan ro;

en: for I was hungry, and ye did not give me to eat; I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink;
hmr: ka phîng a ṭâmin nangnîn fâk ding in mi pêk nawh a; ka dang a chârin nangnîn dâwn ding in mi pêk nawh a,

en: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in; naked, and ye clothed me not; sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.
hmr: mikhuol ka niin in mîn tlungtir nawh a, saruok ka niin puon in mîn siltir nawh a; damnaw le intâng ina ka umin in mi kan si nawh a,’ la tîng a tih.

en: Then shall they also answer, saying, Lord, when saw we thee hungry, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?
hmr: Chu phâ chun, anni khawmin, ‘Lalpa, iengtik âm phîngṭâmin ama- nih, dangchârin amanih, mikhuolin amanih, intâng ina manih kan hmu che a, i rawng kan bâwlpêk naw che?’ tiin la dawn an tih.

en: Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it not unto one of these least, ye did it not unto me.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, ‘Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hieng mi chîntak laia mi pakhat chunga in thaw naw chu ka chunga thaw naw in nih,’ tiin la dawn a tih.

en: And these shall go away into eternal punishment: but the righteous into eternal life.
hmr: Chun, chuonghai chu kumkhaw hremnaah fêng an ta, mi felhai ruok chu kumkhaw hringnaah fêng an tih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these words, he said unto his disciples,
hmr: Chun, Isûn chuong thu po po chu a hril zoin, a închûktir hai kuomah,

en: Ye know that after two days the passover cometh, and the Son of man is delivered up to be crucified.
hmr: “Ni hni chenah Fekân ruoi a hung um ding a nih ti in hriet a, Mihriem Naupa hi hemde dingin an inmantir ding a nih,” a ta.

en: Then were gathered together the chief priests, and the elders of the people, unto the court of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas;
hmr: Chu lai chun, Thiempu laltak Kaiapha an ti in inhuon sûnga chun thiempu lalhai le vântlâng upahai an inkhâwm a;

en: and they took counsel together that they might take Jesus by subtlety, and kill him.
hmr: Isu chu zâwra mana, an sukhlum theina dingin an inrâwn a.

en: But they said, Not during the feast, lest a tumult arise among the people.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, “Ruoiṭhe sûng chu ni naw sien la, chuong naw chun vântlâng lai buoina hung um rawi a tih,” an ta.

en: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,
hmr: Chun, Isu Bethaniah inphâr Simon inah a um lai chun,

en: there came unto him a woman having an alabaster cruse of exceeding precious ointment, and she poured it upon his head, as he sat at meat.
hmr: nuhmei pakhat alabastar bûra hriek rim inhnik totak chawiin a kuomah a hung a, a buthlêng awt laiin a luah a buok a.

en: But when the disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, inchûktirhaiin chu chu an hmu chun an lunginsen a.

en: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.
hmr: “Iengdinga hienga a sukhmang- thai mei mei am a na? Hi hriek hi man tamtaka zawra, pasiehai kuoma pêk thei a ni sih a,” an ta.

en: But Jesus perceiving it said unto them, Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.
hmr: Isu ruok chun chu chu a hrietin an kuomah, “Nuhmei hi iengdinga in sukbuoi am a na? Ka chunga hin thil ṭhatak a thaw a nih.

en: For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.
hmr: Pasiehai chu kumkhuoa in kuoma um an nih annâwm, kei ruok chu kumkhuoa in kuoma um ding ka ni nawh.

en: For in that she poured this ointment upon my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.
hmr: Hi hriek rim inhnik ka taksaa a ibuok hi, phûm dinga mi buotsai dingin a thaw a ni hi.

en: Verily I say unto you, Wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, that also which this woman hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, khawvêl po poah khâwlai khawm hi Chanchin Ṭha hi an hrilna poah, hi nuhmei thil thaw khawm hi ama hriet zingna dingin hril ve pei an tih,” a ta.

en: Then one of the twelve, who was called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,
hmr: Chu hnunga chun sâwm le pahni laia mi pakhat, Juda Iskariot an ti chu, thiempu lalhai kuomah a fe a,

en: and said, What are ye willing to give me, and I will deliver him unto you? And they weighed unto him thirty pieces of silver.
hmr: “Ama chu inmantir ka ti cheu a ieng am mi pêng in ta?” a ta. Chun, tangka sâwmthum an bûkpêk tah a.

en: And from that time he sought opportunity to deliver him unto them.
hmr: Chu chena inthawk chun in- mantirna remchâng a zawng tah a.

en: Now on the first day of unleavened bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Where wilt thou that we make ready for thee to eat the passover?
hmr: Chun, Chawlṭhanglo Bei Ruoi- ṭhe ni, ni hmasataka chun, inchûk- tirhai chu Isu kuomah an hung a, “Fekân ruoi bu fâkna dingin khâwlai am buotsai pêk inlang che i nuom a?” an ta.

en: And he said, Go into the city to such a man, and say unto him, The Teacher saith, My time is at hand; I keep the passover at thy house with my disciples.
hmr: Ama chun, “Khawpuiah tu amani kuomah fe unla, a kuomah, ‘Inchûktirtu chun, ka hun a hnai tah a; ka închûktirhai leh Fekân ruoi i inah ṭhêng kan tih, a tih,’ va ti ro,” a ta.

en: And the disciples did as Jesus appointed them; and they made ready the passover.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuoma a ti ang chun inchûktirhai chun an thaw a, Fekân ruoi ding chu an buotsai tah a.

en: Now when even was come, he was sitting at meat with the twelve disciples;
hmr: Chun, khuo a hung inhnu chun, inchûktir sâwm le pahnihai leh buthlêng an awt a;

en: and as they were eating, he said, Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.
hmr: chun, an fâk laiin ama chun, “Titakzetin ka ti cheu hi, in laia mi pakhat hin mîn mantir a tih,” a ta.

en: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began to say unto him every one, Is it I, Lord?
hmr: Chun, an lungngai ta bêk bêk a, a kuomah, “Lalpa, kei am ka nih?” an ti ta seng a.

en: And he answered and said, He that dipped his hand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.
hmr: Ama chun, “Thlênga mi purpui- tu ngei chun mîn mantir a tih.

en: The Son of man goeth, even as it is written of him: but woe unto that man through whom the Son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man if he had not been born.
hmr: Mihriem Naupa hi a chanchin an ziek angtak khan a fe ding a nih, nisienlakhawm, Mihriem Naupa inman- tirtu ding mipa chung chu a rik! chu mihriem chu insieng naw sien la, a ta dingin ṭha lem a tih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: And Judas, who betrayed him, answered and said, Is it I, Rabbi? He saith unto him, Thou hast said.
hmr: Chun, ân mantirtu ding Juda chun a dawn a, “Rabbi, kei am ka nih?” a ta. Ama chun a kuomah, “în ti zing chu teh,” a ta.

en: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and blessed, and brake it; and he gave to the disciples, and said, Take, eat; this is my body.
hmr: Chun, an fâk laiin Isûn bei a lâk a, mal a sâwmpêk a, a khawi a; chun, inchûktirhai kuomah a pêk a, “La unla, fa ro, hi hi ka taksa a nih,” a ta.

en: And he took a cup, and gave thanks, and gave to them, saying, Drink ye all of it;
hmr: Chun, no a lâk a, lâwmthu a hril a, an kuomah a pêk a, “In rêngin dâwn ro;

en: for this is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many unto remission of sins.
hmr: hi hi ka thisen, suolhai ngai- damna dinga mi tamtak ta dinga suok ding, thuthlungna chu a nih

en: But I say unto you, I shall not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka hril cheu hi, ka Pa rama nangni le a thar ka dâwn ni a tlung hmakhat chun tuta inthawkin grêp hrui raa hi dâwn nâwk ta naw ning,” a ta.

en: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.
hmr: Chun, hla an sak zoin an suok a, Oliv tlânga chun an fe tah a.

en: Then saith Jesus unto them, All ye shall be offended in me this night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Vawizân hin in rêngin ka chung- thuah lungnilovin um vawng in tih, ‘Berâm vêngtu chu vuong ka ta, berâm ruol chu indar an tih,’ ti ziek a ni sih a.

en: But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka thonâwk hnungin Galili ramah in hmaah fêng ka tih,” a ta.

en: But Peter answered and said unto him, If all shall be offended in thee, I will never be offended.
hmr: Peter ruok chun a kuomah, “An rêngin i chungthuah lungnilovin um- hai sien khawm, kei chu lungnilovin um nâw tawp ka tih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, that this night, before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Titakzetin ka hril che, vawizân hin âr a khuong hmain, nangin vawithum mîn phat i tih,” a ta.

en: Peter saith unto him, Even if I must die with thee, yet will I not deny thee. Likewise also said all the disciples.
hmr: Peterin a kuomah, “I thinaa chun thi ve ding ni lang khawm inphat naw tawp ka ti che,” a ta. Chuong ang bawk chun, inchûktirhai po po chun an ti ta seng a.

en: Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and saith unto his disciples, Sit ye here, while I go yonder and pray.
hmr: Chu zoa chun Isu annihai le chun, hmun pakhat Gethsemane an ti chu an tlung a, chun, ama chun a închûktirhai kuomah, “Sawtaka ka va ṭawngṭai sûng po hitaka hin lo ṭhung ro,” a ta.

en: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and sore troubled.
hmr: Chun, Peter le Zebedai nauhai pahni chu a ṭhuoi a, a lungngaiin a lunginzîng ta bêk bêk a.

en: Then saith he unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death: abide ye here, and watch with me.
hmr: Chun, an kuomah, “Ka lungril a lungngai bêk bêk a; thina khawp rau a nih. Hitaka hin um unla mi vêngpui ro,” a ta.

en: And he went forward a little, and fell on his face, and prayed, saying, My Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass away from me: nevertheless, not as I will, but as thou wilt.
hmr: Chun, tlâwmtên hma tieng a va fe dep a, a bawkkhup a, “Aw Pa, a thei chun, hi no hin mi khêl hrâm raw se; nisienlakhawm, keima thu ni loin, nangma thu thu ni lem raw se,” tiin a ṭawngṭai a.

en: And he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto Peter, What, could ye not watch with me one hour?
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai kuoma chun a hung a, anni chu inin a hung hmuh a, Peter kuomah, “E khai! nangnîn dârkâr khat khawm in mi vêngpui thei naw a ni maw?

en: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.
hmr: Thlêmnaa in lût nawna dingin inring zingin ṭawngṭai ro; thlarau chun chu a pei a, tisa ruok chu a hrât naw a nih,” a ta.

en: Again a second time he went away, and prayed, saying, My Father, if this cannot pass away, except I drink it, thy will be done.
hmr: Chun, vawi hninaah a va feh a, a ṭawngṭai nâwk a, “Aw Pa, ka dâwn loa hi no hin a mi khêl thei lul naw chun, nangma thu thu ni raw se,” a ta.

en: And he came again and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.
hmr: Chun, a hung nâwk a, anni chu inin a hung hmu nâwk a, an îmu a suok hle sih a.

en: And he left them again, and went away, and prayed a third time, saying again the same words.
hmr: Chun, a fe san nâwk a, a vawi thumnaah a thu hril ngai hrilin a ṭawngṭai nâwk a.

en: Then cometh he to the disciples, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take your rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
hmr: Chu zoa chun, inchûktirhai kuomah a hung nâwk a, an kuomah, “Tuhin chu in unla châwl ta ro! Ngai ta u; a hun chu a hung tlung tah a, Mihriem Naupa hi mi suolhai kutah an inmantir ding a ni hi.

en: Arise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that betrayeth me.
hmr: Tho unla, fêng ei tiu, a mîn mantirtu ding chu a hung hnai ta hi,” a ta.

en: And while he yet spake, lo, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.
hmr: Chun, a la hril lai zingin Juda, sâwmpahni hai laia mi pakhat chu, a hung tlung tah a, ama ruol chun thiempu lalhai le upahai kuoma inthawkin mipui nasatak, kâwlhnâm le hembâwk chawiin an hung tlung bawk a.

en: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that is he: take him.
hmr: Chun, ân mantirtu ding chun inchikna ding a lo hrillâwk hieu a, “Ka ifâwp taphawt chu ama nîng a tih, man el ro,” tiin.

en: And straightway he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, Rabbi; and kissed him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu chu a va pan nghâl tah a. “Chibai, Rabbi,” tiin a fâwp ta ngâwi ngâwi a.

en: And Jesus said unto him, Friend, do that for which thou art come. Then they came and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Ruola, i hungna san chu thaw rawh,” a ta. Chu phingleh Isu chu an chel a, an man tah a.

en: And behold, one of them that were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and smote the servant of the high priest, and struck off his ear.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, Isu rawihai laia pakhat chun a kutin a ban a, a kâwl- hnâm a phawi a, Thiempu Laltak suok chu a sât a; a nakâwr a sât thlâkpêk a.

en: Then saith Jesus unto him, Put up again thy sword into its place: for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “I kâwl- hnâm kha a sienaah sie nâwk rawh, kâwlhnâm ruoituhai po po chu kâwlhnâm bawkin an thi ding a ni sih a.

en: Or thinkest thou that I cannot beseech my Father, and he shall even now send me more than twelve legions of angels?
hmr: Tukhawm hin vântirko sâng ruk hmun sâwm le hmun hni nêka tam lem mi hung tirpêk dingin ka Pa kuomah ngên thei naw dingin in mi ring am a nih?

en: How then should the scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ngên ang lang, iengtin am Pathien Lekha Thu-hieng anga hung um ding thu hi-tlung thei a ti leh?” a ta.

en: In that hour said Jesus to the multitudes, Are ye come out as against a robber with swords and staves to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and ye took me not.
hmr: Chu lai chun, Isûn mipuihai kuoma chun, “Kâwlhnâmhai, hem- bâwkhai châwiin suomhmang man ding ang elin a mi man dingin in hung suok a ni maw? Pathien biekinah ni tin inchûktirin ka ṭhung hlak a, in mi man si nawh a.

en: But all this is come to pass, that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples left him, and fled.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, zâwlnei lekha thuhai a tlung theina dingin hieng po po hi a hung tlung tah a ni hi,” a ta. Chu lai chun, inchûktirhai po po chun ama an thlathlam a, an tlân hmang ta vawng a.

en: And they that had taken Jesus led him away to the house of Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.
hmr: Chun, Isu mantuhai chun, Thiempu Laltak Kaiapha ina Dân Inchûktirtuhai le upahai um khâwmnaa chun ama chu an ṭhuoi tah a.

en: But Peter followed him afar off, unto the court of the high priest, and entered in, and sat with the officers, to see the end.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peterin hla- taka inthawkin ama chu a zui a, Thiempu laltak in inhuonna sûng tuol chenin; chun, a va lût a, a tâwpna hmu dingin siehlawhai lai chun a ṭhung ve a.

en: Now the chief priests and the whole council sought false witness against Jesus, that they might put him to death;
hmr: Chun, ama an sukhlum theina dingin thiempu lalhai le rorêltuhai po po chun Isu hêkna an zawng a;

en: and they found it not, though many false witnesses came. But afterward came two,
hmr: hretu tehlêm tamtak hung hai sien khawm an hmu si nawh a. A nakie ruok chun mi pahni an hung a,

en: and said, This man said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.
hmr: “Hi mipa hin, ‘Pathien biekin hi ṭhiek a, ni thum sûnga bâwl nâwk thei ka nih,’ a tih,” an ta.

en: And the high priest stood up, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?
hmr: Chuongchun, Thiempu Laltak chu a ngîr suok a, a kuomah, “Iengkhawmin i dawn naw maw? Hienghaiin an hêkna che hi iengtizie am a na?” a ta. Isu ruok chu a to zing a.

en: But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou art the Christ, the Son of God.
hmr: Chun, Thiempu Laltak chun a kuomah, “Pathien hring hmingin ka vau che, Krista, Pathien Naupa chu i ni am a nih? mi hril rawh,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto him, Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Henceforth ye shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “I hril ang chun ka nih; chu nawa khawm, ka hril cheu hi, hi hnung leh Mihriem Naupa hi thilthawtheina changtienga ṭhunga, vân sûm chunga hung in la hmu ding a nih,” a ta.

en: Then the high priest rent his garments, saying, He hath spoken blasphemy: what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard the blasphemy:
hmr: Chun, Thiempu Laltak chun a silfênhai a keithlêr a, “Pathien a hrilsiet tah; hretu dang iengdingin am ngai tâng ei ta? Ngai ta u, Pathien a hrilsietzie chu tuhin in hriet tah. Iengtin am in ngai a?” a ta.

en: what think ye? They answered and said, He is worthy of death.
hmr: Anni chun, “Thi tlâk a nih,” tiin an dawn a.

en: Then did they spit in his face and buffet him: and some smote him with the palms of their hands,
hmr: Chun, a hmaiah chil an sâk a, kutin an hnawk a;

en: saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ: who is he that struck thee?
hmr: chun, aṭhen chun, “Nang Krista, tuin am a ben cheh a? mi hril rawh,” tiin an ben a.

en: Now Peter was sitting without in the court: and a maid came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus the Galilæan.
hmr: Chun, Peter chu in inhuon sûng tuollaia chun a ṭhung a; chun, nunghâk pakhat a kuomah a hung a, “Nang khawm, Isu, Galili rama mi kuoma um kha i ni hi,” a ta.

en: But he denied before them all, saying, I know not what thou sayest.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, “I thu hril chu ka hriet dêr nawh,” tiin an rênga hmaah ân phat a.

en: And when he was gone out into the porch, another maid saw him, and saith unto them that were there, This man also was with Jesus of Nazareth.
hmr: Chun, tuol kawt bula chun a va suok phingleh nunghâk dangin ama chu a hmuh a, chutaka umhai kuoma chun, “Hi mipa khawm hi Isu Naza- reth mi kuoma um kha a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And again he denied with an oath, I know not the man.
hmr: Chun, “Chu mihriem chu ka hriet nawh,” tiin inkhâmin ân phat nâwk a.

en: And after a little while they that stood by came and said to Peter, Of a truth thou also art one of them; for thy speech maketh thee known.
hmr: Chun, sâwt nawte hnungah a kâwla ngîrhai chun Peter kuomah, “Nang khawm an laia mi i ni ngei el, i ṭawngah ân hriet annâwm,” an ta.

en: Then began he to curse and to swear, I know not the man. And straightway the cock crew.
hmr: Ama chun, “Chu mihriem chu ka hriet nawh” tîn ṭawngsie inphur rauin ân khâm tah a. Chun âr a khuong nghâl tah a.

en: And Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went out, and wept bitterly.
hmr: Chun, Peter chun, Isûn “âr a khuong hmain nangin vawi thum mîn phat i tih,” a ti kha a hung hriet nâwk tah a. Chun, a suok a, a ṭap ta ngâwi ngâwi a.

en: Now when morning was come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:
hmr: Chun, zîngkâr a hung ni chun, thiempu lalhai le vântlâng upahai po po chu Isu sukhlum dingin a chungthuah an inrâwn a;

en: and they bound him, and led him away, and delivered him up to Pilate the governor.
hmr: chun, an khuop a, an ṭhuoi a, Bawrsâp Pilat kuomah an pêk tah a.

en: Then Judas, who betrayed him, when he saw that he was condemned, repented himself, and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
hmr: Chun, Juda ân mantîrtu khan Isu thiemnaw an inchangtir ti a hriet phingleh ân sîr a; tangka sâwmthum kha thiempu lalhai kuoma chun a hung chawi nâwk a,

en: saying, I have sinned in that I betrayed innocent blood. But they said, What is that to us? see thou to it.
hmr: “Mi thiem thisen kân mantir kha thil ka suksuol a nih,” a ta. Anni ruok chun, “Chu chu kan ta dingin ieng am pawi a ta? Nangin i thaw thawin thaw rawh,” an ti san a.

en: And he cast down the pieces of silver into the sanctuary, and departed; and he went away and hanged himself.
hmr: Chun, ama chun tangka chu hmun inthienga chun a pei lût a; a fe hmang a, a vân âwkhlum tah a.

en: And the chief priests took the pieces of silver, and said, It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood.
hmr: Chun, thiempu lalhai chun tangka chu an lâk a, “Hi hi thawlâwm bâwma sie a thieng nawh ie, thisen man a ni sih a,” an ta.

en: And they took counsel, and bought with them the potter’s field, to bury strangers in.
hmr: Chuongchun, an inrâwn a, mikhuolhai phûmna dingin bêlhemtu hmun chu an inchâwk tah a.

en: Wherefore that field was called, The field of blood, unto this day.
hmr: Chu lei chun a nih, chu hmun chu tu chena, “Thisen Hmun,” an ti chu.

en: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying, And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was priced, whom certain of the children of Israel did price;
hmr: Chu lai chun, zâwlnei Jeremiain hieng thu a hril hi a hung tlung tah a: “Chun, tangka sâwmthum, An isak man, Israel thla tuhaiin amanih an isak man chu, An lâk a;

en: and they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord appointed me.
hmr: Lalpain a mi tiem angin, Belhemtu hmun man dingin an pêk a,” ti hi.

en: Now Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And Jesus said unto him, Thou sayest.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu Bawrsâp hmaa chun a ngîr a. Chun, Bawrsâp chun, “Judahai lal i ni?” tîn ân dawn a. Chun, Isûn, “I hril ang chun ka nih,” a ta.

en: And when he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.
hmr: Chun, thiempu lalhai le upa- haiin an hêk laiin iengkhawmin a dawn nawh a.

en: Then saith Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?
hmr: Chuongchun, Pilatin a kuomah, “An hêkna zozai che hi i hriet naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: And he gave him no answer, not even to one word: insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.
hmr: Chun, bau khat khawmin a dawn nawh a; chuongchun, Bawrsâp chun mak a ti hleh a.

en: Now at the feast the governor was wont to release unto the multitude one prisoner, whom they would.
hmr: Chun, Bawrsâpin ruoiṭhe ni chun, mi intâng pakhat an dit taphawt mipuihai chu ân suopêk hlak a.

en: And they had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.
hmr: Chun, chu lai chun, mi intâng hming inthangtak Barabba an ti chu an nei a.

en: When therefore they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whom will ye that I release unto you? Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?
hmr: Chuongchun, an hung inkhâwm chun, Pilatin an kuomah “Tu am in- suopêk lang cheu in nuom a? Barabba am, Isu, Krista an ti chu?” a ta.

en: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him up.
hmr: Thîkna leiin ama chu an inmantir ti a hriet sih a.

en: And while he was sitting on the judgment-seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that righteous man; for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.
hmr: Chun, rorêlna ṭhungphaa ân ṭhung lai chun, a nuhmeiin, “Kha mi feltak chunga khan iengkhawm thaw naw rawh; vawisûn hin ama leiin mangah thil tamtak ka tuor a nih,” tiin ân chah a.

en: Now the chief priests and the elders persuaded the multitudes that they should ask for Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.
hmr: Chun, thiempu lalhai le upa- haiin Barabba hnia, Isu sukhlum dingin mipuihai chu an thlêm a.

en: But the governor answered and said unto them, Which of the two will ye that I release unto you? And they said, Barabbas.
hmr: Bawrsâp ruok chun anni chu a biek a, “Anni pahni chu a tu lem am insuopêk lang cheu in nuom a?” a ti nâwk a. Anni chun, “Barabba” an tih a.

en: Pilate saith unto them, What then shall I do unto Jesus who is called Christ? They all say, Let him be crucified.
hmr: Pilatin an kuomah, “Isu, Krista an ti hi iengtin am thâwng ka ti leh?” a ta. An rêngin, “Krawsah inhemdêtir rawh,” an tih a.

en: And he said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out exceedingly, saying, Let him be crucified.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Iengdingin am ie? Ieng am a suksuol leh?” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, anni rawi chun “Krawsah inhemdêtir rawh,” tiin an khêk rak rak a.

en: So when Pilate saw that he prevailed nothing, but rather that a tumult was arising, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this righteous man; see ye to it.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pilatin ieng- khawm thaw thei loa buoi tieu tieu ding a nih ti a hrietin, tui a lâk a, mipui hmaa chun a kut a sâwp a, “Hi mi fel thisena hin kân thieng; nang- nîn in thaw thawin thaw ro,” a ta.

en: And all the people answered and said, His blood be on us, and on our children.
hmr: Chun, vântlâng po po chun, “A thisen chu keini chunga le, kan nauhai chungah um raw se,” tiin an dawn a.

en: Then released he unto them Barabbas; but Jesus he scourged and delivered to be crucified.
hmr: Chu zoa chun Barabba chu ân suopêk tah a; Isu ruok chu a vuok a, krawsa hemde dingin a pêk tah a.

en: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the Prætorium, and gathered unto him the whole band.
hmr: Chu zoa chun, Bawrsâp sipaihai chun Isu chu lal inah an ṭhuoi lût a, an pâwla mi po po a kuomah an ko khâwm a.

en: And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.
hmr: Chuongchun, a puonhai dâm an hlîppêk a, puon sen an insiltir a.

en: And they platted a crown of thorns and put it upon his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they kneeled down before him, and mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!
hmr: Chun, hling lukhum an phier a, an inkhumtir a, a kut changtieng luong an inchawitir a; a hmaah an dingṭhaṭhuon a, “Chibai, Judahai lal,” tiin nuiza siemnain an hmang a.

en: And they spat upon him, and took the reed and smote him on the head.
hmr: Chun, chil an sâk khum a, luong chu an lâkpêk a, a lua chun an vuok a.

en: And when they had mocked him, they took off from him the robe, and put on him his garments, and led him away to crucify him.
hmr: Chun, nuiza siemnaa an hmang zoin, puon chu an hlîppêk a, ama puonhai chu an insiltir nâwk a; krawsa hemde dingin an ṭhuoi tah a.

en: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name: him they compelled to go with them, that he might bear his cross.
hmr: Chun, an fe suok laiin Kurini khuoa mi, a hming Simon an hmuh a; chu mipa chu a kraws put dingin an man a.

en: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, The place of a skull,
hmr: Chun, Golgotha an ti hmun an hung tlung a, (chu chu, “Luru hmun,” tina a nih)

en: they gave him wine to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tasted it, he would not drink.
hmr: uoin thûr, thil kha le pawl, a dâwn dingin an pêk a, nisienla- khawm ân tem phingin a dâwn nuom ta nawh a.

en: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots;
hmr: Chun, krawsah an hemde zoin, aisânin a silfênhai chu an insem a.

en: and they sat and watched him there.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun an ṭhung a, an vêng a, a hêkna —

en: And they set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
hmr: “HI MIPA HI ISU JUDAHAI LAL A NIH,” tia ziek a lu chungah an bel a.

en: Then are there crucified with him two robbers, one on the right hand and one on the left.
hmr: Chun, ama ruol chun, suom- hmang pahni an hemde veh a, a changtieng pakhat a vawitieng pakhat.

en: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads,
hmr: Chun, mi inlawn taphawt chun an lu thinin, an tiel a,

en: and saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days, save thyself: if thou art the Son of God, come down from the cross.
hmr: “Nang Pathien biekin ṭhiek a, ni thuma bâwl nâwktu, insukdam rawh, Pathien Naupa i ni chun, krawsa kha hung ṭum ta la,” tiin.

en: In like manner also the chief priests mocking him, with the scribes and elders, said,
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin thiempu lalhai chun, Dân inchûktirtuhai le upahai leh tielin,

en: He saved others; himself he cannot save. He is the King of Israel; let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe on him.
hmr: “Mi dang hman a sukdam hlak a; ama le ama ân sukdam thei si nawh a. Israel lal a nih annâwm, tuhin krawsa inthawkin hung ṭum ta sien la, chuongchun, ama awi nâwm ei ni!

en: He trusteth on God; let him deliver him now, if he desireth him: for he said, I am the Son of God.
hmr: Pathien a awi annâwm, ama hi a nuom chun tuhin sandam raw se, ‘Pathien Naupa ka nih,’ a ti sih a,” an ta.

en: And the robbers also that were crucified with him cast upon him the same reproach.
hmr: Suomhmang an hemde vehai khawm chun, chuong ang bawkin an ti el veh a.

en: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.
hmr: Chun, nisa indinga inthawka zânbu suong pha chenin khawvêl a hung inthim ta vawng a.

en: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
hmr: Chun, zânbu suong pha vêl chun, Isu chu râwl inringtakin, “Eli, Eli lama sabakthani” tiin a khêk suok a. (Chu chu, “Ka Pathien, ka Pathien, iengdinga i mi mâksan?” tina a nih.)

en: And some of them that stood there, when they heard it, said, This man calleth Elijah.
hmr: Chun, a kâwla ngîr ṭhenkhathai chun chu chu an hrietin, “Hi mipa hin Elija a ko a nih,” an ta.

en: And straightway one of them ran, and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.
hmr: Chun, an laia mi pakhat a tlân nghâl tah a, sponj a lâk a, uoin thûr ân chie sip a, hmawlah a târ a, a hang indâwntir a.

en: And the rest said, Let be; let us see whether Elijah cometh to save him.
hmr: Chun, mi danghai chun, “Um raw se, ama la dingin Elija a hung am en ei tiu,” an ta.

en: And Jesus cried again with a loud voice, and yielded up his spirit.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu râwl inringtakin a khêk nâwk a, a thlarau ân thla tah a.

en: And behold, the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake; and the rocks were rent;
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, Pathien biekina puonzâr chu a chung tienga in- thawkin a hnuoi tieng chenin, a lo tlêr suok tah a; chun, simkhawleihnuoi dâm ân hnîng a, lungpuihai an hung kawi a;

en: and the tombs were opened; and many bodies of the saints that had fallen asleep were raised;
hmr: thlânhai an hung inhawng a; mi inthieng in tahai taksa tamtak khawm keithoin an um tah a;

en: and coming forth out of the tombs after his resurrection they entered into the holy city and appeared unto many.
hmr: chuonghai chu a thonâwk hnunga chun, thlâna inthawka hung suokin khaw inthienga chun an lût a, mi tamtak kuomah an inlâr tah a.

en: Now the centurion, and they that were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake, and the things that were done, feared exceedingly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.
hmr: Chun, sipai za hotu le a kuoma Isu vênga um vehai chun, simkhaw- leihnuoi inhnîng le thil umziehai chu an hmu chun an ṭi ta bêk bêk a, “Hi mipa hi Pathien Naupa a ni ngei el,” an ta.

en: And many women were there beholding from afar, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun nuhmei tamtak, a rawngbâwlpêk pum peia Galili rama inthawka Isu hung zuituhai chu an um a; hlatakah an thlîr a;

en: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
hmr: chuonghai lai chun Mari Magdalin hai, Mari, Jakob le Josef nu hai, Zebedai naupahai nuhai rawi an ṭhang a.

en: And when even was come, there came a rich man from Arimathæa, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus’ disciple:
hmr: Chun, zântieng a hung ni chun, mi hausa, a hming Josef, Arimathaia mi a hung a, ama ngei khawm chu Isu inchûktir a ni bawk a.

en: this man went to Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded it to be given up.
hmr: Chu mipa chu Pilat kuomah a va feh a; Isu ruong chu a hnih a. Chun, Pilatin pêk din gin thu a pêk a.

en: And Joseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
hmr: Chuongchun, Josef chun ruong chu a lâk a, puon zai inhmi fâitakin a tuom a;

en: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the tomb, and departed.
hmr: ama thlân thar, lung a iverkuoa chun ân zâl a, thlân kawtkhâr chu lung lientakin ân del a, a fe tah a.

en: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun, Mari Magdalin le Mari dang chu an um a, thlân hma zâwna chun an ṭhung a.

en: Now on the morrow, which is the day after the Preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together unto Pilate,
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun (chu chu Inringlâwk ni zo tûk a nih) thiempu lalhai le Pharisaihai chu Pilat kuomah an um khâwm dup a,

en: saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said while he was yet alive, After three days I rise again.
hmr: “Pu, chu hlêmtu chun, a dam lai khan ‘Ni thum chenah thonâwk ka tih,’ a ti kan hriet zing a.

en: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest haply his disciples come and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: and the last error will be worse than the first.
hmr: Chuongchun, thlân chu ni thum ni chen vêng ṭha dingin thu pe rawh, chuong naw chun a inchûktirhai chu hungin, ama chu inru hlau an ta, vântlâng kuomah, ‘Mithi laia in- thawkin a thonâwk ta a nih,’ ti rawi an tih; chuongchun, hlêmna nuhnung lem chu a hmasa nêk khan ṭha naw nâwk zuol a tih,” an ta.

en: Pilate said unto them, Ye have a guard: go, make it as sure as ye can.
hmr: Pilatin an kuomah, “Vêngtu sipaihai in nei annâwm, fe unla in thei ang angin invêngṭhattir ta unla,” a ta.

en: So they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, the guard being with them.
hmr: Chuongchun, vêngtu sipaihai leh an feh a, thlân chu an invêng ṭhattir a, lung chu an inchik a.

en: Now late on the sabbath day, as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre.
hmr: Chun, Châwlni zo, ni saria ni hmasatak dinga khuo a var tâwmin, Mari Magdalin le Mari dang chu thlân en dingin an feh a.

en: And behold, there was a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled away the stone, and sat upon it.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, simkhawleihnuoi nasatakin a hung inhnîng a, Lalpa vântirko vâna inthawkin a hung ṭum a, lung chu a hung inhlum a, a chungah a ṭhung tah a.

en: His appearance was as lightning, and his raiment white as snow:
hmr: A hmêl umzie chu kâwlinlep ang a na, a silfên chu vûr angin a vâr a.

en: and for fear of him the watchers did quake, and became as dead men.
hmr: Ama an ṭi leiin vêngtuhai chu an inthin a, mithi ang elin an hung um tah a.

en: And the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye; for I know that ye seek Jesus, who hath been crucified.
hmr: Chun, vântirko chun nuhmeihai chu a biek a, an kuomah, “Nangni chu ṭi naw ro! Isu an hemde kha in zawng ti ka hriet!

en: He is not here; for he is risen, even as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.
hmr: Hitaka hin a um ta nawh; a hril ang ngeiin a thonâwk ta a nih. A zâlna hi hung en hman ta u.

en: And go quickly, and tell his disciples, He is risen from the dead; and lo, he goeth before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him: lo, I have told you.
hmr: Chun, fe vak unla, a inchûktirhai kuomah, ‘Mithi laia inthawkin a thonâwk ta a nih, ngai ta u, Galili ramah in hmaah a fe, chutaka chun ama chu hmûng in tih,’ tiin hril ro. Ngai ta u, ka hril ta cheu hi,” a ta.

en: And they departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring his disciples word.
hmr: Chun, ṭi le lâwm bêk bêk pumin thlâna inthawk chun an fe vat vat a, a închûktirhai hril dingin an tlân tah a.

en: And behold, Jesus met them, saying, All hail. And they came and took hold of his feet, and worshipped him.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, Isûn anni chu ân tuokpui a, “Chibai” a ti tâwl a. Chuongchun, anni chun a ke chu an va chel a, chibai an bûk a.

en: Then saith Jesus unto them, Fear not: go tell my brethren that they depart into Galilee, and there shall they see me.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah “Ṭi naw ro, fe unla, Galili rama fe dingin ka unauhai va hril ro; chutaka chun mi hmûng an tih,” a ta.

en: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guard came into the city, and told unto the chief priests all the things that were come to pass.
hmr: Chun, an va fe lai chun vêngtu sipai ṭhenkhat chu khawpuiah an va lût a, thil umzie po po chu thiempu lalhai kuomah an va hril a.

en: And when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave much money unto the soldiers,
hmr: Chun, upahai leh an inkhâwma an inrâwn zoin sipaihai kuoma chun tangka tamtak an pêk a,

en: saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.
hmr: “ ‘Zânah kan in kârin a închûk- tirhai chu an hung a, ama an inrûk a nih,’ ti ro.

en: And if this come to the governor’s ears, we will persuade him, and rid you of care.
hmr: Chun, Bawrsâpin chu chu a hriet chun ama chu thlêm kan ta, lunginhâng loin siem kan ti cheu,” an ta.

en: So they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this saying was spread abroad among the Jews, and continueth until this day.
hmr: Chuongchun, tangka chu an lâk a, an iti ang pei chun an ti tah a; chuongchun, tu chen hin chu thu chu Judahai laiah an la hril ta pei a nih.

en: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, unto the mountain where Jesus had appointed them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, inchûktir sâwm le pakhat hai chu Galili ramah, Isûn tlâng a iruot pêka chun an feh a.

en: And when they saw him, they worshipped him; but some doubted.
hmr: Chun, ama an hmu chun chibai an bûk a, ṭhenkhat ruok chun an ringhlah a.

en: And Jesus came to them and spake unto them, saying, All authority hath been given unto me in heaven and on earth.
hmr: Chuongchun Isu chu an kuomah a hung a, anni rawi chu a biek a, “Hnuoi le vâna thuneina po po ka kuomah pêk a ni tah.

en: Go ye therefore, and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them into the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit:
hmr: “Chuongchun, fe unla, hnam tina mi inchûktir dâmin siem unla, Pa le, Naupa le, Thlarau Inthieng hming chun baptist unla;

en: teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I commanded you: and lo, I am with you always, even unto the end of the world.
hmr: thu ka ipêk po po cheu pawm dingin inchûktir ro. Chun, ngai ta u, kei kumkhuoin khawvêl tâwp chen khawmin in kuomah um pei ka tih,” a ta.

en: And in those days cometh John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judæa, saying,
hmr: Chuong lai chun Baptistu Johan chu, Judai thlalêrah thuhrilin a hung a,

en: Repent ye; for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
hmr: “Sim ro, vân ram chu a hnai tah,” tiin.

en: For this is he that was spoken of through Isaiah the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make ye ready the way of the Lord, Make his paths straight.
hmr: Ama chu a nih, zâwlnei Isaiin, “Thlalêra mi khêk rawl chun, ‘Lalpa lamlien buotsai unla, A lampuihai suktlûn ro,’ a tih,” tia a hril kha.

en: Now John himself had his raiment of camel’s hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his food was locusts and wild honey.
hmr: Chun, Johan chun sanghâwngsei hmul puon a sil a, a kâwng chu savun kâwngkhiin ân khit a; a bu chu khâuṭhikṭhi le ram khuoizu a nih.

en: Then went out unto him Jerusalem, and all Judæa, and all the region round about the Jordan;
hmr: Chu lai chun Jerusalema mi dâm, Juda rama mi po po dâm, Jordan vadung vêla mi po po an suok a, a kuom tieng an feh a;

en: and they were baptized of him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.
hmr: an suolhai thupha chawiin Jordan vadungah ama kuomah Baptisma an chang tâwl a.

en: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said unto them, Ye offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pharisaihai le Saddukaihai tamtak a baptisma chang dinga hung a hmu phingleh, an kuomah, “Rûl thlahai, lungsen hung tlung ding hi tlânsan dingin tuin am a kâwk cheu a?

en: Bring forth therefore fruit worthy of repentance:
hmr: Chuongchun, sim hming input tlâkin ra ro.

en: and think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
hmr: “ ‘Abraham ei thlatu a nih annawm,’ tiin inngaituo naw ro; Pathienin hieng lunghai hi Abraham thlahai dingin ân ngirtir thei ti ka hril cheu hi.

en: And even now the axe lieth at the root of the trees: every tree therefore that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
hmr: Tuta inthawk el khawmin thing bul tinah hreipui an sie tah; chuong- chun, thing tin ra ṭhaa ra naw phawt chu an phûr a, meiah an pei hlak.

en: I indeed baptize you in water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you in the Holy Spirit and in fire:
hmr: Kei chun chu simna dingin tuiin ka baptis hlak cheu a; nisienla- khawm, ka hnunga hung ding chu keia nêkin a ropui lem a, a kekawk chawi tlâk khawm ka ni nawh. Ama chun Thlarau Inthieng le meiin baptis a ti cheu.

en: whose fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing-floor; and he will gather his wheat into the garner, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.
hmr: A kutin a leipup a chawi a, a hrizâwl zâp fai hieu a ta, a pangah a bû hlûng a ta, a si ruok chu mei rêm thei loin raw hmang a tih,” a ta.

en: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to the Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.
hmr: Chu lai chun a kuoma baptisma chang dingin Isu Galili rama in- thawkin Jordan vadungah Johan kuomah a hung a.

en: But John would have hindered him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?
hmr: Johan ruok chun, “I mi baptis ka ṭûl lem sih a, ka kuomah i hung lem a ni maw?” tiin khap a tum a.

en: But Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer it now: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness. Then he suffereth him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn a kuom- ah, “Tuhin remti hrâm rawh, hieng anga felna po po sukkim hi ei ta dingin a mawi a nih,” tiin a dawn a. Chuongchun, rem a ti tah a.

en: And Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway from the water: and lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming upon him;
hmr: Chun, Isu baptisma a chang phingleh, tuia inthawk chun a suok nghâl tah a; chun, ngai ta, a ta dingin vân a hung inhawng a, Pathien Thlarau chu vaṭhu anga hung ṭuma a chunga hung fu a hmuh a.

en: and lo, a voice out of the heavens, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, vâna inthawkin râwlin “Hi hi ka Naupa dittak, ka ilâwm bêk bêk chu a nih,” a ta.

en: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.
hmr: Chu zoa chun Isu chu Diebol thlêma um dingin thlalêrah Thlarau ṭhuoi lûtin a um tah a.

en: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he afterward hungered.
hmr: Chun, ni sâwmli le zân sâwmli a nghei hnungin a phîng a hung ṭâm tah a.

en: And the tempter came and said unto him, If thou art the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.
hmr: Chun, thlêmtu chu a hung a, a kuomah, “Pathien Naupa i ni chun, hieng lunghai hi beia inchang dingin thu pe rawh,” a ta.

en: But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun, “Mi- hriem hi bei chauin hring naw ni hai a, Pathien baua thu tin suokin hring lem an tih,” ti ziek a nih, tiin a dawn a.

en: Then the devil taketh him into the holy city; and he set him on the pinnacle of the temple,
hmr: Chu zoa chun diebol chun khaw inthienga chun a ṭhuoi lût a, Pathien biekin sîp zuma chun a sieh a;

en: and saith unto him, If thou art the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and, On their hands they shall bear thee up, Lest haply thou dash thy foot against a stone.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah, “Pathien Nau- pa i ni chun tla thla rawh; ‘I chungchânga chu a vântirkohai chu thu pêng a ta, An kutin dawm an ti cheh a, Chuong naw chun I kein lung sui hlau rawi i tih,’ ti ziek a ni si a,” a ta.

en: Jesus said unto him, Again it is written, Thou shalt not make trial of the Lord thy God.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “ ‘Lalpa i Pathien fie naw,’ ti ziek a ni ve bawk a nih,” a ta.

en: Again, the devil taketh him unto an exceeding high mountain, and showeth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;
hmr: Chun, diebol chun tlâng insâng- takah a ṭhuoi nâwk a, khawvêl ram po po le a ropuina chu ân entir a.

en: and he said unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.
hmr: A kuomah, “Bawkkhupin chibai i mi bûk chun, hieng po po hi pe vawng ka ti che,” a ta.

en: Then saith Jesus unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
hmr: Chu phingleh Isûn, “Setan, fe hmang dai rawh; ‘Lalpa i Pathien chibai bûk la, ama rawng chau bâwl rawh,’ ti ziek a nih,” a ta.

en: Then the devil leaveth him; and behold, angels came and ministered unto him.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun diebol chun a zâmsan tah a. Chun, ngai ta, vântir- kohaiin a rawng an bâwlpêk tah a.

en: Now when he heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee;
hmr: Chun, Johan an man ti Isûn a hriet phingleh Galili ramah a fe ta dai a;

en: and leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali:
hmr: chun, Nazareth a mâksan a, Kapernaumah a um ta zing a, chu chu Zebulun le Naphtali biela dil panga um a nih:

en: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,
hmr: zâwlnei Isai baua,

en: The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, Toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,
hmr: “Dîl tienga Jordan râlah, Zebulun le Naphtali ram, Jentailhai Galili;

en: The people that sat in darkness Saw a great light, And to them that sat in the region and shadow of death, To them did light spring up.
hmr: Inthim hnuoia ṭhunghai chun var nasatak an hmuh a, Thina hmun le a hlima ṭhunghai chunga chun, Var a hung suok tah a,” tia a hril kha a hung tlung theina dingin.

en: From that time began Jesus to preach, and to say, Repent ye; for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
hmr: Chu chena inthawk chu Isûn, “Sim ro, vân ram chu a hnai tah,” tiin a hril phut tah a.

en: And walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brethren, Simon who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishers.
hmr: Chun, Galili dil panga a lêng malamin, unau pahni, Simon (Peter an ti chu) a unau Andri leh dila chun lên dêngin a hmuh a; nga mantu an ni hrim a.

en: And he saith unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you fishers of men.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Mi zui ro, chuongchun, mihriem mantuin siem ka ti cheu,” a ta.

en: And they straightway left the nets, and followed him.
hmr: Lênhai chu mâksanin an zui nghâl tah a.

en: And going on from thence he saw two other brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.
hmr: Chutaka inthawk chun a fe pei a, unau dang pahni, Zebedai naupa Jakob le a unau Johan chu, an pa Zebedai kuoma lawngah an lênhai siemṭhain a hmuh a, anni chu a ko tah a.

en: And they straightway left the boat and their father, and followed him.
hmr: Chuongchun, lawng le an pa chu an mâksan a, an zui nghâl tah a.

en: And Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of disease and all manner of sickness among the people.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an inkhawmna inhaia inchûktirin, ram Chanchin Ṭha chu hrilin mihai laia natna tinrêng le hrât nawna tinrêng suk- damin Galili ram po po a fang pei a.

en: And the report of him went forth into all Syria: and they brought unto him all that were sick, holden with divers diseases and torments, possessed with demons, and epileptic, and palsied; and he healed them.
hmr: Chun, Suria ram po poah a chanchin ân thang tah a; chuong- chun, mi damnaw po po, damnawna le natna tinrênga nahai, khawhri imanhai, hringawl invawihai, zeng- hai a kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a, a lo sukdam tâwl a.

en: And there followed him great multitudes from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judæa and from beyond the Jordan.
hmr: Galili rama inthawk dâm, Dekapoli khuoa inthawk dâm, Jeru- salema inthawk dâm, Judai rama inthawk dâmin le Jordan râla inthawk dâm chun mipui nasatakin ama an zui bawk a.

en: And seeing the multitudes, he went up into the mountain: and when he had sat down, his disciples came unto him:
hmr: Chuongchun, mipuihai chu a hmuin tlângah a lâwn a; chun, a ṭhung a, a inchûktirhai a kuomah an hung a;

en: and he opened his mouth and taught them, saying,
hmr: chuongchun, thu a hril a, anni ân chuktir a:

en: Blessed are the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
hmr: “Thlaraua pasiea inhriehai chu an hamṭha; vân ram an ta a ni sih a.

en: Blessed are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.
hmr: “Thlainvaihai chu an hamṭha; thlamuongin an la um ding a ni sih a.

en: Blessed are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.
hmr: “Zainêmhai chu an hamṭha; hnuoi ro hi an la hluo ding a ni sih a.

en: Blessed are they that hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.
hmr: “Felnaa phîngṭâma dangchârhai chu an hamṭha; an la tlai ding a ni sih a.

en: Blessed are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.
hmr: “Mi chunga zângaitheitakhai chu an hamṭha; zângaina an la hlaw ding a ni sih a.

en: Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God.
hmr: “Lungrila inthienghai chu an hamṭha; Pathien an la hmu ding a ni sih a.

en: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called sons of God.
hmr: “Inremna siemtuhai chu an hamṭha; Pathien nauhai inbûkin an la um ding a ni sih a.

en: Blessed are they that have been persecuted for righteousness’ sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
hmr: “Felna leia suknawmnatna tuor hnunghai chu an hamṭha; vân ram an ta a ni sih a.

en: Blessed are ye when men shall reproach you, and persecute you, and say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.
hmr: “Miin keima leia an hal cheu a, an suknawmna cheu a; khêla suol tinrêngin an hêk pha cheu, in la hamṭha ding a nih.

en: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great is your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets that were before you.
hmr: “Lâwm unla, nasatakin hlim ro; vânah in lâwmman a um râwn sih a; chuong ang bawkin in hmaa zâwlnei umhai khawm an suknawmna hlak kha.

en: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost its savor, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under foot of men.
hmr: “Hnuoi machi in nih; nisien- lakhawm, machi hi a da ta chun iengin am sukal nâwk an ta? Peihâwna, mihriemhai sir mei mei ding chau naw chun, ienga ding khawmin a ṭha ta nawh.

en: Ye are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hid.
hmr: “Khawvêl var in nih. Tlâng sîpa khaw um chu thuphmang thei a ni nawh.

en: Neither do men light a lamp, and put it under the bushel, but on the stand; and it shineth unto all that are in the house.
hmr: Mîn khâwnvar sitin leikhâwr hnuoiah an sie ngai nawh; a sienaah an sie lem hlak; chuongchun, in sûnga mi po po a ên hlak.

en: Even so let your light shine before men; that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin in var chu mi mithmuah var raw se; chuong- chun, in thilthaw ṭhathai hmûng an ta, in Pa vâna mi chawimawi thei an tih.

en: Think not that I came to destroy the law or the prophets: I came not to destroy, but to fulfil.
hmr: “Dân thu amanih, zâwlneihai thu amanih sukbo dinga hung ka ni ring naw ro, sukbo dinga hung ka ni nawh a, sukkim dinga hung ka ni lem.

en: For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass away, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass away from the law, till all things be accomplished.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hnuoi le vân hi a bo hmakhat chun Dân thua sunhâng chite amanih, thai- hâng chite amanih, pakhat khawm, bo naw tawp a tih, a rênga a tlung kim hmakhat chun.

en: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach them, he shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
hmr: Chuongchun, tukhawm hieng thupêk laia pakhat, a chîntak khawm bawsea, chuonga thaw ve dinga mihai inchûktir taphawt chu, vân rama chun mi chîn tak tîng an tih; ami- ruokchu, tukhawm zâwma inchûktir taphawt chu, vân rama chun mi lien tîng an tih.

en: For I say unto you, that except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no wise enter into the kingdom of heaven.
hmr: In felnain Dân inchûktirtuhai le Pharisaihai felna a khûm naw chun vân ramah lût naw tawp in tih ti ka hril cheu a ni hi.

en: Ye have heard that it was said to them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:
hmr: “Tienlaia mihai kuoma chun, ‘tuol i that ding a ni nawh,’ ti le, ‘tukhawm tuolthat chu rorêlna hmabâk zingin um a tih’ an tih ti in hriet tah;

en: but I say unto you, that every one who is angry with his brother shall be in danger of the judgment; and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council; and whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of the hell of fire.
hmr: kei ruok chun, tukhawm a unau chunga lunginsen taphawt chu rorêlna hmabâk zingin um a tih; chun tukhawm a unau kuoma, ‘Hmang- nabopa’ ti taphawt chu rorêlna hma- bâk zingin um a tih; chun tukhawm, ‘Invêtpa’ ti taphawt chu Hremhmun meia pei hmabâk zingin um a tih ti ka hril cheu hi.

en: If therefore thou art offering thy gift at the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath aught against thee,
hmr: Chuongchun, mâichâm bula i thilpêk în hlân lai taka, i unauin i chungah lungninawna a nei ti i hriet dawk nâwk chun,

en: leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way, first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.
hmr: chutaka mâichâm hmaa chun i thilpêk chu mâksan la, fe la, i unau rem zet la, chu hnunga chun i thilpêk chu inhlân rawh.

en: Agree with thine adversary quickly, while thou art with him in the way; lest haply the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.
hmr: I khingpui chu lampuia in intlawn laiin rem vat rawh; chuong naw chun, i khingpui chun rorêltu inmantir a ti cheh a, rorêltu chun mi man hotu kuomah pêng a ti cheh a, intângna inah khum hlau rawi an ti che.

en: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou have paid the last farthing.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril che hi, pawisa khat chena i pêk kim nek hma chun, chutaka inthawk chun suok naw tawp i tih.

en: Ye have heard that it was said, Thou shalt not commit adultery:
hmr: “ ‘I uire ding a ni nawh,’ an tih ti in hriet tah.

en: but I say unto you, that every one that looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.
hmr: Kei ruok chun, tukhawm nu- hmei dit ena en taphawt chun, a lungrilah a uire zing a nih ti ka hril cheu hi.

en: And if thy right eye causeth thee to stumble, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body be cast into hell.
hmr: Chun, i mit changtiengin a sukthlûk che chun khel dawk la, pei dai rawh; i taksa a puma Hrem- hmuna peia a um nêkin, i taksa pêng pakhat bo chu i ta dingin a ṭha lem a nih.

en: And if thy right hand causeth thee to stumble, cut it off, and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not thy whole body go into hell.
hmr: I kut changtiengin a sukthlûk che chun, tan la, pei dai rawh; i taksa a puma Hremhmuna peia a um nêk chun, i taksa pêng pakhat a bo chu i ta dingin a ṭha lem a nih.

en: It was said also, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:
hmr: “Chun, ‘Tukhawm nuhmei ma chun inmâkna lekha a kuomah pe raw se,’ an ti bawk a.

en: but I say unto you, that every one that putteth away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, maketh her an adulteress: and whosoever shall marry her when she is put away committeth adultery.
hmr: Kei ruok chun, tukhawm tlangvâl dit lei ni loa mâni nuhmei ma taphawt chun, ama chu ân uirettir a nih; tukhawm mâk hnung chu nei taphawt chu a uire a nih ti ka hril cheu hi.

en: Again, ye have heard that it was said to them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:
hmr: “Tienlaia mihai kuoma chun, ‘Khêlin inkhâm naw la, Lalpa kuomah în khâmna chu hlen lem rawh,’ an tih ti in hriet ta bawk a.

en: but I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by the heaven, for it is the throne of God;
hmr: Kei ruok chun ka ti cheu hi, vânni hrim hrim khâm naw ro, vân sâlin amanih inkhâm naw ro, achu Pathien Lalṭhungpha a ni sih a; hnuoi sâl khawmin inkhâm naw ro, achu a ke innghatna a ni sih a;

en: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
hmr: Jerusalem sâlin inkhâm bawk naw ro, achu lal ropuitak khawpui a ni sih a.

en: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, for thou canst not make one hair white or black.
hmr: I lu sâlin în khâm ding a ni bawk nawh a, samzai pakhat khawm i sukvârin, i sukdum thei si nawh a.

en: But let your speech be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: and whatsoever is more than these is of the evil one.
hmr: ‘A nih,’ in ti chu ‘a nih,’ ni sienla, ‘A ni nawh’ in ti chu ‘a ni nawh’ ni el raw se, chuonghai bâk chu suola inthawka suok a nih.

en: Ye have heard that it was said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:
hmr: “ ‘Mit sikah mit, ha sikin ha,’ an tih ti in hriet tah.

en: but I say unto you, Resist not him that is evil: but whosoever smiteth thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.
hmr: Kei ruok chun ka hril cheu hi, mi suol khing naw ro. I bieng changtienga ben taphawt che chu a khing tieng khawm dawpêk lem rawh.

en: And if any man would go to law with thee, and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloak also.
hmr: Tukhawmin i kuomah thupawi siemin, i zakuo lâk a tum chun, i puon khawm inlâktir nghâl rawh.

en: And whosoever shall compel thee to go one mile, go with him two.
hmr: Mêl khat fe dinga phût luitu taphawt che kuoma chun mêl hni fe rawh.

en: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.
hmr: A hnitu che kuoma chun pe la, i kuoma pûk nuomtu chu nghatsan naw.

en: Ye have heard that it was said, Thou shalt love thy neighbor, and hate thine enemy:
hmr: “ ‘I vênghai hmangai la, i hmêl- ma theida rawh,’ an tih ti in hriet tah.

en: but I say unto you, Love your enemies, and pray for them that persecute you;
hmr: Kei ruok chun ka hril cheu hi, in hmêlmahai chu hmangai unla; a suk- nawmnatuhai cheu chu ṭawngṭai- pêk ro;

en: that ye may be sons of your Father who is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sendeth rain on the just and the unjust.
hmr: in Pa vâna mi nauhai in ni theina dingin; ama chun mi suolhai le mi ṭhahai chunga chun a nisa ân suoktir a, mi fel le mi fel nawhai chunga khawm ruo ân sûrtir hlak a nih.

en: For if ye love them that love you, what reward have ye? do not even the publicans the same?
hmr: A hmangaituhai cheu chau in lunginsiet hin lâwmman ieng am hmûng in ta? Siedâwltuhai khawmin chuong angin an thaw ve a ni naw am a nih?

en: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more than others? do not even the Gentiles the same?
hmr: chun, in unauhai chau chibai in bûk hin a ieng am in thaw tam bik a? Jentailhai khawmin chuong angin an thaw ve a ni naw am a nih?

en: Ye therefore shall be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
hmr: Chuongchun, in Pa vâna mi a ṭhafamkim angin in ṭhafamkim ding a nih.

en: Take heed that ye do not your righteousness before men, to be seen of them: else ye have no reward with your Father who is in heaven.
hmr: “In thil ṭha thawhai chu mihriem hmaa, an ihmu dinga thaw lo dingin fimkhur ro; chuong naw chun in Pa vâna mi kuomah lâwmman nei naw ti niu.

en: When therefore thou doest alms, sound not a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have received their reward.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi kuoma thil i pêkin, mi vervêkhaiin mi inpâk an hlaw theina dinga, inkhâwmna in- haia le, kawtthlêrhaia an thaw hlak angin, i hmaah tawtawrâwt inmûttir naw.

en: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu, an lâwmman chu an hmu zo tah. Nang ruok chun mi kuoma thil i pêkin, i kut changtiengin a thaw chu i kut vawitiengin hre naw raw se; i thilpêk chu a rûk a ni theina dingin;

en: that thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father who seeth in secret shall recompense thee.
hmr: chuongchun, i Pa a rûka hmutu che chun thung a ti che.

en: And when ye pray, ye shall not be as the hypocrites: for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have received their reward.
hmr: “Chun, in ṭawngṭaiin, mi vervêk- hai angin in thaw ding a ni nawh, mîn an hmu theina dingin, inkhâwmna inahai, kawtthlêr ṭhuom laitakahai ngir puma ṭawngṭai an ngaina sih a. Titakzetin ka hril cheu, an lâwmman chu an hmu zo tah.

en: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thine inner chamber, and having shut thy door, pray to thy Father who is in secret, and thy Father who seeth in secret shall recompense thee.
hmr: Nang ruok chun i ṭawngṭaiin, i pindan sûng rilah lût la, i kawt khâr la, i Pa arûka um kuoma chun ṭawng- ṭai rawh; chuongchun, i Pa arûka hmutu che chun thung a ti che.

en: And in praying use not vain repetitions, as the Gentiles do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
hmr: “Chun in ṭawngṭaiin, Jentailhai angin hril ngai hril mei mei naw ro; an ṭawng tam leiin hrein an ring a nih.

en: Be not therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni angin um naw ro; ama in hni hmain in Pa chun ieng ieng am in pawimaw ti chu a hriet zing a nih.

en: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father who art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.
hmr: “Chuongchun, nangni chu hieng ang hin ṭawngṭai ro: Kan Pa vâna mi, I hming inzaum raw se, I ram hung tlung raw se.

en: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
hmr: I dit zâwng vâna mîn an thaw angin, hnuoia mîn thaw raw se,

en: Give us this day our daily bread.
hmr: Vawisûn hin kan fâkkhawpin bu mi pe la,

en: And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.
hmr: Kan bathai hi mi ngaidamla, Keini khawmin kan iengkhat battuhai kan ngaidam ang khan.

en: And bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.
hmr: Suol dinga thlêmnaa chun mi ṭhuoi lût naw la, Mi suol laka chu mi sandam lem rawh, tiin.

en: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
hmr: “Mi an bawsiethai in ngaidam chun, in Pa vâna mîn ngaidam vêng a ti cheu.

en: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mihai in ngai- dam si naw chun, in Pain in baw- sietnahai ngaidam bîk naw ni.

en: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may be seen of men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have received their reward.
hmr: “Bu in nghei pha khawmin, mi vervêkhai angin ngui hmêl put naw ro; anni chun mi mithmua bungheia an inlang theina dingin an hmêl an sukpawr hlak sih a. Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, an lâwmman chu an hmu zo tah.

en: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thy head, and wash thy face;
hmr: Nang ruok chun bu i nghei pha i lu sahriek nâl la, i hmai phi rawh;

en: that thou be not seen of men to fast, but of thy Father who is in secret: and thy Father, who seeth in secret, shall recompense thee.
hmr: chuongchun, i Pa arûka um mithmua chau naw chun, mihriem mithmuah bungheiin inlang naw ti ni; chuongchun, i Pa arûka hmutu che chun thung a ti che.

en: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon the earth, where moth and rust consume, and where thieves break through and steal:
hmr: “Hnuoia hângthim le tuiêkin a fâk sietnaah, inruhaiin an verpawpa an inrûknaa hin in ta dingin rohai inkhâwl naw ro.

en: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth consume, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:
hmr: Vânah, hângthim le tuiêkin a fâk siet nawnaah, inruhaiin an ver- pawpa an inrûk nawnaa chun, in ta dingin rohai siekhâwl lem ro;

en: for where thy treasure is, there will thy heart be also.
hmr: i ro umna taphawtah i lungril khawm a um ding a ni sih a.

en: The lamp of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.
hmr: “Taksa khâwnvar chu mit hi a nih; i mit a var chun i taksa a rêngin var suok a tih.

en: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is the darkness!
hmr: I mit a se ruok chun i taksa a rêngin inthim vawng a tih. Chuong- chun, i sûnga var chu inthim ni sien chu, inthim chu a va nasa awm ngei de!

en: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
hmr: “Tukhawmin hotu pahni rawng bâwl kawp thei naw ni hai; pakhat theidain pakhat dit an tih, annawleh, pakhat ṭanin pakhat hmusit an tih. Pathien le sum rawng bâwl kawp thei naw ti niu.

en: Therefore I say unto you, Be not anxious for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than the food, and the body than the raiment?
hmr: “Chuleichun, ka hril cheu hi, ‘Ieng am dâwnin ieng am fa tâng ka ta?’ tiin, in hringna thu le, ‘Ieng am silin bil ka ta aw?’ tiin, in taksa thu lungkham naw ro. Fâkding nêkin hringna a hlu lem a ni naw am a nih? Silfên nêkin taksa khawm a hlu lem a ni naw am a nih?

en: Behold the birds of the heaven, that they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; and your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are not ye of much more value than they?
hmr: “Chunglêng vatehai hi en ta u; bu an tu nawh a, an sîk bawk nawh a; bu ina khawm an sêklût bawk nawh, nisienlakhawm, in Pa vâna mi chun a châwm sih a. Nangni chu anni nêkin nasatakin in hlu lem a ni naw am a nih?

en: And which of you by being anxious can add one cubit unto the measure of his life?
hmr: Chun, nangni lai tuin am lung- kham leiin mâni dung tieng tawng khata suksâng chuong thei cheu?

en: And why are ye anxious concerning raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:
hmr: Chun, silfên thuah iengdinga in lungkham am a na? Ram tûktinpâr inṭhangzie hi ṭha takin ngaituo ro; sin an thaw nawh, pat khawm an kher bawk nawh;

en: yet I say unto you, that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, ka hril cheu hi, Solomon meu khawm a ropuina po poa ân thuom khan hieng tûktinpâr pakhat tluk khawm hin cheiin a um nawh.

en: But if God doth so clothe the grass of the field, which to-day is, and to-morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?
hmr: Chuongchun, ram hlohna, vawi- sûn anga hringa, a zînga thuka ti nâwk el ding hman Pathienin chuong ang lâwma a chei chun, aw! nangni ringna tlâwmhai, silfên a pêk lem hman hman ding cheu a ni naw am a nih?

en: Be not therefore anxious, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
hmr: Chuongchun, ‘Ieng am fâng ei ta?’ ‘Ieng am dâwn ei ta?’ amanih, ‘Ieng silin am um ei ta?’ ti amanih, lungkham naw ro. Jentailhaiin chuong po po chu an zawng hlak a nih.

en: For after all these things do the Gentiles seek; for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
hmr: Chuong po po chu in pawimaw ti in Pa vâna miin a hriet zing a nih.

en: But seek ye first his kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
hmr: A ram le a felna chu zawng hmasa lem ro; chuongchun, chuong po po chu a pêk sa ding cheu a nih.

en: Be not therefore anxious for the morrow: for the morrow will be anxious for itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
hmr: Chuongchun, a zînga dingin lungkham naw ro, a zîng chun ama ding chu a lungkham fâwm ding a ni sih a. Ni khat dingin ni khat rimsik a hun a nih.

en: Judge not, that ye be not judged.
hmr: “Sawisêl naw ro, sawisêla in um nawna dingin.

en: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured unto you.
hmr: In sawisêl ang bawkin sawisêlin um in tih, in inkhina ngai bawka inkhipêk ni nâwk in tih.

en: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
hmr: Chun, iengdinga mâni mita tlung- pûm um ngaituo si loa; i unau mita hmawl hlek um chu i hmu am a na?

en: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me cast out the mote out of thine eye; and lo, the beam is in thine own eye?
hmr: Iengtin am i unau kuomah, ‘I mita hmawl hlek kha mîn lâk dawktir rawh,’ ti thei i ta? Ngai ta, nanga mit ngeiah tlungpûm chu a um zing sih a.

en: Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother’s eye.
hmr: Mi vervêk! I mita inthawkin tlungpûm kha la suok hmasa rawh; chuongchun, i unau mita inthawka hmawl hlek lâk suok ding chu feltakin hmu thei i tih.

en: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast your pearls before the swine, lest haply they trample them under their feet, and turn and rend you.
hmr: “Ui kuoma dâm thil inthieng chu pe naw ro; vawk hmaa dâm in lung- hlu pei bawk naw ro; chîl se hlau rawi an ta; ngha lêtin phirthlêr rawi an ti cheu.”

en: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
hmr: “Hni ro, chuongchun, pêkin um in tih; zawng ro, chuongchun, hmûng in tih;

en: for every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.
hmr: nawk ro, hawngpêkin um in tih; tukhawm a hni taphawt chun an hmu hlak; tukhawm a zawng chun an hmu hlak; tukhawm a nawk chu hawng- pêk ning an tih.
